El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su almacigo comprara abonos, y también productos para fumigación contra enfermedades. El se dedica a la agricultura de café y actualmente su cafetal necesita una resiembra por lo cual opto hacer este almacigo para repoblar su terreno y a la vez mejorar su plantación a mejores condiciones. El tiene como meta aumentar su producción dentro de varios años y a su vez mejorar su estabilidad económica para el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alcides is married, 67 years old, and lives with his wife who is his top priority. This loan will be used to buy supplies to take care of his coffee seedlings, to buy fertilizers and for fumigation to prevent disease. He has made his living by growing coffee and now his coffee field needs replanting which is why he chose these coffee seedlings to repopulate his land while improving the conditions of his farm at the same time. He has a goal to increase production within a few years and in turn improve his financial stability for the future. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. In the past, he has not had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help with planting of coffee seedlings

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y tiene siete hijos. Ella es una persona dedicada al trabajo de campo desde que tenía 12 años de edad, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, y fue así como hoy a su edad es una persona llena de muchos conocimientos y experiencias que ha vivido desde que se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y que fue lo que su padre le enseño para poder ganarse dignamente su vida y así sacar a delante a su familia. 

 Los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos  como lo son los fertilizantes y herbicidas, fungicidas necesarios para la siembra los compra en un municipio; para llegar hasta el lugar donde compra  viajar durante 15 minutos en pick-up. 

El préstamo qu esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  comprar 6 quintales de abono, 2 bolsas de semilla de maíz y fungicidas para el control de plagas y enfermedades que atacan el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo brindado al cliente, comprara los abonos necesarios para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con el fin de incrementar la unidad de producción  y generar mayores ganancias a la hora de la comercialización de la producción obtenida.

con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de cultivar mayor cantidad de granos generando así un excedente mayor al que actualmente genera para comercializarlo  y obtener un ingreso mayor al final de la cosecha.
Él piensa en diversificar la producción, que actualmente maneja para obtener nuevas fuentes de ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia
texts.en:
Miguel is a married 60 year old man with seven children. He has been working in the fields since he was 12 years old. His parents taught him to be a farmer and this is why today he is very knowledgeable and has had much experience since he began his work in farming. His father taught him farming in order for him to be able to earn an honorable living and help his family to succeed.

He purchases his agricultural supplies - fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides that are necessary for planting basic grains -  in a town that takes him 15 minutes to get to by pickup truck.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy 6 quintals of fertilizer, 2 bags of corn seed and fungicide to control the pests and diseases that attack corn fields. With the support provided to the customer, he will purchase the fertilizer needed to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn with the goal of increasing his production and generating a higher income when selling the produce he has obtained.

With this loan he will have the opportunity to cultivate a larger amount of grain and thus generate a greater surplus than he currently obtains in order to sell it and obtain a higher income at the end of the harvest. He plans to diversify the production that he currently manages in order to obtain new sources of income and to help his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintals of fertilizer, 2 bags of corn seed and fungicide in order to control the pests and diseases that attack cornfields.

loans.name: Wossidji  V Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe WOSSIDJI  V sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Warinibougou, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  du mil, et d’arachide en association avec le gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ASSITAN  première personne  à  droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5Ha de mil, de mais et d’arachide en association avec le gombo
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The Wossidji V group is composed of married women who are on the average 43 years of age, with five children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Warinibougou, a village in the Guégnaka community, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali).
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be better manage their business at the beginning of the rainy season. They cultivate, among other produce, millet, peanuts and okra. They are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this new loan, Assitan, the first one seated on the right, plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and small tools as well as pay the cost of labor to work about 1.5 ha [about 4 acres] of millet, corn and peanuts as well as okra. 

After harvesting, the produce is sold in the twon of of Fana, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Assitan plans to earn about 150,000 West African francs during this agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, weeding and small tools.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 51 years old and married with four children.

Catalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of laundry soap, coffee, milk, sugar, and other items to sell in her general store.

Catalina has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling candles.

Catalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock items like laundry soap, coffee, milk, sugar, and others to sell in her general store

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Darlene is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Darlene has a general store business in the Philippines. Darlene has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Darlene has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Darlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is taking a loan of $1,200 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is married and has two children. 

Francisca has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan. She will buy an additional supply of goods to keep in her store such as secondhand clothes, shoes and bags. 

She is happy with TRM, which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Cristabel

texts.es:
Cristabel tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive con sus 3 hijos entre las edades de 6 a 15 años de edad. Actualmente, se dedica a la agricultura junto con sus dos hijos que le ayudan a trabajar en su tiempo libre; por que  están estudiando nivel básico, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 11 años y lo aprendió desde que era pequeña ya que le tocaba ir a dejar el almuerzo hasta el lugar donde trabajaba su papá y le ayudaba en lo que ella podía, además de trabajar en agricultura Cristabel  se dedicaba a la crianza de pollos de engorde; pero dejo de producir porque no tuvo éxito con una camada que tenía destinada para la venta porque le llego la peste y se le murieron todos los pollos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de abono para fertilizar el maíz, 4 litros de herbicidas para el control de malezas, y 2 botes de insecticida de  para control de plagas en el maíz y cultivar 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz. Todo esto para que su cultivo este en  buenas condiciones de nutrición, limpieza y control de plagas, además ella utiliza una combinación de productos químicos y orgánicos como la gallinaza que será mezclada con el fertilizante químico. La gallinaza que utiliza la desechan los pollos y así obtiene mejores resultados en la producción de granos básicos. 

Con la cosecha, mejorará su alimentación; ya que se le apoyara para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así pueda trabajar la agricultura y obtener los granos para la alimentación de sus hijos. Y también tener un ingreso extra para ir cubriendo las necesidades de sus hijos

Cristabel desea instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras en un futuro no muy lejano; ya que cuenta con instalaciones adecuadas para tener producción. Como también sueña en ver a sus hijos graduándose de la universidad y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cristabel is 40 years old, married, and lives with her three children. They are between the ages of 6 and 15. Currently she is working in agriculture with her two sons who help her work in their free time. Because she has a basic level of education, she has been doing agriculture for 11 years, and she learned when she was a little girl and she would have to leave for lunch to go where her father was working to help him when she could. Besides working in agriculture, Cristabel also raises broiler chickens, but production stopped when she wasn't successful with the litter that was intended for sale because a plague came and all of the chickens died.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 3 bags of fertilizer to fertilize the corn, 4 liters of weed-killer to control the weeds and 2 containers of insecticide to control infestations in the corn and to cultivate 3,500 square meters of corn. All of this so that her harvest is in good nutritional condition, cleaning, and pest control. 

Cristabel also uses a combination of chemical products and organic products like manure that will be mixed with the chemical fertilizer. The manure that she uses is what the chicken discard, so she gets better results in the production of staple grains. 

With the harvest, Cristabel will improve her diet as it will support the purchase of agricultural supplies that will help the farming and produce grains for her children's diets. She will also have extra income to cover her children's needs. 

Cristabel wishes to establish a farm for laying hens in the near future with suitable installations to have a production. She also dreams of seeing her children graduating from the university and that they will have a better life.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of fertilizer to fertilize corn, 4 liters of weed-killer to control weeds, 2 containers of insecticide to control infestations of the corn harvest, and to cultivate 3,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Cristobal Mauricio

texts.es: Cristóbal, de 27 años de edad habitante del barrio Waspan Sur, trabaja en una empresa embotelladora como ejecutivo de ventas, es soltero pero tiene un hijo a quien mantiene con sus ingresos, actualmente está cursando la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, lo cual está por culminar por lo que solicita apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, en vista de que con su salario no podría cubrir este gran gasto que de lo contrario tendría que ahorrar, lo que llevaría a atrasarse para su desarrollo profesional.
texts.en: Cristóbal is 27 years old and lives in the Waspan Sur barrio. He works as a sales executive for a bottling company. He is single, but he has a son whom he supports with his income. He currently is pursuing a civil engineering degree, which he is about to complete, and he is requesting the loan to pay the fees for his degree. His salary won't cover this big expense and he would otherwise have to save for it, which would be a setback for his professional development.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 26 years old, married and has three children. She and her husband aim to become successful someday in order to provide a good education for their children and to have a better way of living.  

To achieve their goals, Pacita plans to improve her small eatery to generate sufficient income. She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and other ingredients needed in cooking different food to sell. She hopes that someday, she will become successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and other needed ingredients

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza works hard to support her family. Eliza is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Eliza has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like eggs, noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Eliza has been in this business for four years now.

Eliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like eggs, noodles, canned goods, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a mobile prepaid load business and from rice farming. Angelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ellen works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Ellen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, rice, etc. for her business.

Ellen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, and rice for her business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

Nieves has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables and from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her charcoal, farming and vegetable sales and general store businesses.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business selling vegetables.

Marivic has been in this business for three years. Marivic earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her vegetable sales business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to puchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 45 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Eden is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies.

Eden has been farming rice for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 44 years old and married with four children.

Elnora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, and other items.

Elnora has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling fish and farming vegetables.

Elnora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock like soap, can goods, milk, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Precy works hard to support her family.

Precy has a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Precy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock like soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, egg, and other items to sell in her general store.

Precy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, egg, and other items

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 53 años de edad, esta casado. Es un hombre que desde niño fue adoptado debido a la extrema pobreza de su familia decidieron regalarlo con una familia que le iba a dar lo necesario porque tenían vivienda digna y ganado. Es así como inicia su vida con una nueva familia y desde los 8 años comienza a gustarle el cuido de los animales y dedicado al trabajo agrícola porque de eso es de donde ha logrado hacer lo que hoy posee.

Los insumos agrícolas, los compra en una zona donde los obtiene a un mejor precio, y para eso viaja 30 minutos en carro y también compra los productos veterinarios para el cuido del ganado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca y su ternera, que se la vende su suegro. De esta manera, espera que la producción de leche se ha de 7 a 8 botellas por día y eso es saber invertir el dinero porque con la venta de la leche cubre otras necesidades de su familia. Siempre se había dedicado al cuido de animales pero ajenos, y con el crédito comprara su propia vaca y así espera continuar creciendo.

A futuro el cliente espera crecer con el número de animales propios que desde pequeño soñó tener y que por sus limitantes económicas de su familia no pudo cumplir ese sueño, pero para toda persona existe una segunda oportunidad y el señor Manuel con la ayuda de fundación campo espera ser un productor de leche a gran escala.
texts.en:
Manuel is 53 and married. He is a man who was adopted as a child due to the extreme poverty of his birth family, which decided to give him to another family that would be able to give him what he needed because they had cattle and a respectable house. This is how he began his life with his new family. It was when he was eight years old that he started to be drawn toward farming and the care of animals, and this is how he has managed to achieve what he has today. 

He buys his agricultural supplies in an area where he can get good prices, and to do so he travels 30 minutes by car. He also buys veterinary products in order to care for his cattle. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a cow and her calf, which his father-in-law is selling. With them, he hopes that milk production will reach seven to eight bottles a day. He knows this is how to invest the money because selling the milk will cover some of his family's other needs. He has always been dedicated to the care of animals, but they have always been other people's animals. With this loan he will buy his own cow and thus he hopes to continue growing. 

In the future the client hopes to increase the number of his own animals, which he has dreamed of ever since he was little but has been unable to achieve so far because of his family's financial limitations. But there exists a second chance for everyone and Manuel hopes to be a milk producer at a grand scale with the help of Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy a cow and her calf.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old and married with five children.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soap, canned goods, chips, candies, and other products to sell.

Rosario has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosario aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, canned goods, chips, and candies to sell

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 47 years old and married with one child.

Chita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Chita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa sales business for three years and also earns an income from a general store.

Chita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of nipa to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

Tessie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Tessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling fruits.  Elvira is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, noodles, snack foods, coffee, and milk to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her general store business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, noodles, snack foods, coffee, and milk to sell

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emiliano is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer salaries and to buy additional sacks of rice seeds for her business.

Emiliano has been farming rice for 35 years. She earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborer salaries and to buy additional sacks of rice seeds for her business

loans.name: Sawe Puncak Indah Group

texts.en: Because Ni Ketut now has a local sow, she will use her new loan to purchase feeds and renovate the cages. The sow will give birth soon and she hopes the sow can birth safely. Ni Ketut will sell the piglets after two months. She already prepared for all the needs and she hopes this time the business will run smoothly so she can earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and renovate the cages

loans.name: Richard Komba's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu. Like their fellow teachers in various areas where Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) operates, they came to SMT to apply for staff loans. These loans are specifically designed for low-paid staff. With this type of loan, staff can meet their most immediate and pressing needs. At the end of each month, their bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayments and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Sahr is the featured leader of this group. At 52, Sahr is married to a housewife. A native of Banganbuya, Sahr is the father of seven children - four in primary school, two in secondary school, and one in college. Sahr has been a school teacher for 30 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Celuk Rahayu Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, maintaining pigs at home to support the family income, especially the husband's income, was a common thing for the Balinese people, especially those living in the village. This way of maintenance is still traditional. To improve abilities and knowledge, these ladies joined a group. In addition to exchanging information, they can also get loans even though they do not have collateral that can be pledged in banks or other financial institutions to obtain loans. With the pig breeder program from MUK, Ni Nengah and Celuk Rahayu Group members feel there is ease of retrieval, and their pig farming can be developed for the welfare of the family.

Ni Nengah is a 55-year-old housewife. To improve their ability in terms of raising pigs and get capital for businesses, she and other ladies of the area formed a group. Ni Nengah will use the loan to buy two piglets and feed. In a six-month period, the pigs will be ready for sale. The benefits of this effort will be used to support the family economy and set aside for saving.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Aurea to improve her business. She has a shop where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as secondhand clothes, shoes and bags. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2007. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business direct-selling personal collection and Avon products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers for her direct sales business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. Erlinda earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en:
Voskehat has a big family of eight, including Voskehat herself, her husband (pictured in the photo), her twin daughters, her parents-in-law, and her brother and sister. The family owns a farm which currently includes cows, pigs, chickens and turkeys. Voskehat also grows different types of trees (peach, apricot, nut, apple, pear, cherry and plum).

Together with Voskehat, all of the family members run a farming business. The women milk the cows and make dairy products, and the men sell these dairy products and the harvest at local markets. Agriculture helps the family to have a stable income and it is very important to them.

They own a barn that is old and needs to be renovated. Unfortunately, as daily costs are very high, Voskehat has no financial means for the renovation. With this loan, she plans to renovate the barn and to purchase fertilizer and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

This loan is very important to this family, as it will help them to cover their operation costs and continue to expand their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fuel and renovate her barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to replace what was lost in Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in the town of Goris and works breeding swine. She keeps her farm animals in a barn located near the town. Anahit sells pigs and meat to meat production centers and to her loyal customers throughout the town. 
She lives with her husband and two children, who are already grown-up and help their mother with agricultural activities. All the income that the family gathers is first used to cover their basic daily needs, so there is nothing left for expanding the livestock. For this reason, Anahit has applied for this loan to purchase 6 pigs. She will fatten and then sell them. This will significantly increase the family's income, and they will be able to live a better life. 
She has great plans connected with her farming business and hopes that this loan from Kiva will be a kind of motivation for future development.

loans.use: to pay for 6 pigs.

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Odette  fait partie du groupe Kwizera et habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à  David, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants qui étudient.  

Elle fait le commerce de manioc depuis 16  ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Odette belongs to the Kwizera group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is married to David, a merchant. Together they have five children who are in school.

She has run a business selling manioc for 16 years.

She is on her third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of manioc for resale in order to earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy a large quanitty of manioc for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Coeur Angelique De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Ulrick est le coordonateur de son groupe Coeur Angelique de Ouanaminthe. Il est marié ,Il  a 4 enfants, Il  habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. Il dirige son commerce de vente de tennis et de souliers pendants les 9  dernières années

Ulrick votre prêt va investir dans l'achat de chaussures sportives (tennis). Il  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Coeur  de Ouanaminthe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes de produits  cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc

Il déclare que son défi principal est devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza International.
texts.en:
Ulrick is the coordinator of his group, named Coeur Angelique de Ouanaminthe. He is married and has four children. He lives in the northwest area of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and running water is very limited. He has run his business selling sneakers and shoes for the past nine years.

With this loan, Ulrick is going to invest in buying more sneakers. He hopes that this loan will help to expand his business. The other members of the Coeur Angelique de Ouanaminthe group need loans for their businesses, which include selling cosmetics, soda, etc.

He declares that his main challenge is to become a large merchant in the North department. He says that his principal goal is to have a large business, which will help him build a large house with the help of Esperanza International.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Atunoy

texts.ru: Атуной женщина с прекрасной душой и добрым сердцем. Она является хранительницей очага и основной кормилицей в семье. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Атуной более 13 лет занимается бизнесом. Она продает на местном рынке ткани для шитья национальных женских платьев. Она серьёзно относится к бизнесу. Атуной сезонно обновляет свой товар и расширяет ассортимент своего товара. Ее сын помогает ей введение бизнеса. Она имеет большой опыт в сфере бизнеса и постепенно развивает бизнес. Атуной очень хотела бы получить займ для того, чтобы купить ткани по последней моде, так как конкуренция большая и все бизнесмены уже обновили свой ассортимент. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки ткани для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Atunoy is a woman with a beautiful soul and a good heart. She is both the family manager and the main breadwinner for the family. She has a husband and three children. Since she was 13 years old, Atunoy has been in business. She sells fabric for sewing traditional women's dresses in the local market. She takes her business very seriously. Atunoy updates her goods seasonally and is expanding her product line. She is introducing her son to business and he helps her. She has lots of experience in business and has gradually developed her business. Atunoy very much wants a loan to buy the latest fashion of fabric, as competition is strong and most businesses have already updated their assortment. She is applying for a sum of 5000 Somoni to buy fabric for the new season. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Yemfinsi's Group

texts.fr:
Mr YEMFINSI est le représentant du groupe. Il se porte bien. marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 02 vont à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr vend des céréales (Maïs, petit mil, haricot) depuis 08ans. Il s’approvisionne à Boromo et Léo.  Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes revendeurs. 
Il veut s’acheter 20 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin et stocker les céréales et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Yemfinsi is the leader of this group. He supports himself well. He is married and has two children, of whom the elder is 12 years old and the younger is 7. Both children attend school and Mr. Yemfinsi has five people in his care.
Mr. Yemfinsi has sold cereals (maize, pearl millet, beans) for eight years. He gets his supplies at Boromo and Léo. His customers are male and female retailers.
He wants to buy 20 bags of maize and 10 bags of millet.
With his profits, he wants to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to open a large store and stock his cereals, as well as to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of maize and 10 bags of millet

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia is taking a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She is running a shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers and shoes. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 45 years old, and she is happily married to Jaime, who works as warehouse man. God has blessed them with three loving children, and two of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Letecia owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell them per piece for a higher price to have profit. She also sells LPG gas and charcoal for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Letecia hopes to expand her business and have more branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 49 years old and married with five children.

Librada works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of soft drinks, seasonings and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Librada has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Librada aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks, seasonings and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
With a background in clinical psychology, Roslyn has always been passionate about helping others.  Roslyn first became interested in rebuilding families during her time as a Protective Services Assistant (PSA).  As a PSA, she would supervise visits between parents and children, often due to a court mandate or turmoil within the family.  Roslyn became adept at documenting the visits to share with the court.

After some time as a PSA, Roslyn earned her credentials to work as a Child Protective Services (CPS) social worker.  After more than 15 years as a CPS social worker, Roslyn wanted to provide even more support to families going through difficult and often heartbreaking situations.  She earned her Doctorate in Clinical Psychology in 2011 and began providing therapy for individuals, couples and families. 
 
Determined to provide even more specialized services, Roslyn decided to start her own supervised visiting facility, allowing parents in high conflict or high-risk situations access to their children in a safe and supervised environment.  Furthermore, Roslyn’s facility, A Seed of Change, will operate as a community-based outreach program offering additional supportive services to families in crisis, i.e., conflict resolutions skills groups, non-violent communication skills groups, and parenting workshops.

Her Kiva loan will be used to furnish her office with a computer, TV and homey furniture, creating an environment that is safe and nurturing for the clients she serves.  It will also be used to expand her office and secure licenses to connect with the court system.  

With your help, Roslyn can achieve her dream of rebuilding and caring for struggling families.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, TV and furniture for her office and pay for licenses

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: A $1,000 loan was requested by Palmira to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Palmira independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a responsible housewife and is blessed with one child.  She and her husband aim to improve their way of living and provide a better future for their child through their business.  

In line with this goal, she plans to improve her small variety store to increase her income. Lack of capital made her borrow a loan from the lenders in the amount of PHP 20,000. She will use the funds buy more stock of basic commodities such as soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, eggs, oil, assorted candies and school supplies to sell in her store. She believes that someday she will make her business grow and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy different commodities and school supplies

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
This is Cristy. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials that she needed and she was able to have more output. The loan also helped with their everyday expenditures, especially with her children's education. She has been in this business for 20 years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells mineral water.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristy hopes that her business will expand even more and it will be more stable. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is taking a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has six children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second hand clothes, second hand shoes and second hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) who offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, second hand shoes and second hand bags

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, laundry soap, bath soap, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Liza has been in this business for 10 years. Liza earns more income from her barbershop.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, laundry soap, bath soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three grown children. She is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been raising hogs for six years now. Remedios requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy feed and pig supplements. In the future, Remedios would like to expand her piggery business to be able to pay her weekly contributions and to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Tipapa

texts.en:
Tipapa is 32 years old and married. He supports a family of six children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last six years with a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of 50,000 KES from KADET and this will facilitate him to adequately prepare his farm and purchase more inputs.

Tipapa hopes the anticipated profits will expand his farm as well as cater for reinvestment. His future dream is to improve his family's living standards and educate his children successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Lolita has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

Lolita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Lucrecia

texts.en:
Ma. Lucrecia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lucrecia is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lucrecia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ma. Lucrecia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Carina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Carina is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF in order to buy more charcoal to resell.

Carina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has one child and has been doing farming work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: profit. His biggest challenge is 'raising funds for my projects.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Weldon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, 'quick loan processing.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said that he'd learned 'that the interest rate is 18 percent.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Weldon replied, 'It will better our livelihoods.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Weldon owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle. He does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Parsinate

texts.en:
Parsinate is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five members. His children are 10, 7 and 3 years old. Parsinate learned about KADET LTD from other farmers in his neighborhood.

Parsinate has been farming maize for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into keeping sheep. His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Unidade Group

texts.en:
Juliana is one the members of Unidade Group. The word "Unidade" is in the local language, and it means "togetherness."

Juliana is taking the loan to add more working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits to sell. She is a hardworking woman. She started her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $100 dollars.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene, 36, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Leo, an employee. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mylene operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families, only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business and a laundry shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Mylene hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Dailen

texts.en:
Dailen is 38 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Dailen is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dailen has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income by selling food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер является повторным клиентом ИМОН и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Алишеру 50 лет. Он женат и имеет 3 совершеннолетних детей. Детям 27, 23 и 20 лет. Его жена занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Алишер более 5 лет работает в Таджикском Государственном Университете Политики и бизнеса. Он работает шофёром. Он честно выполняет свою работу. Его коллеги охарактеризовали его как честного и ответственного человека. Алишер уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом имеет плохое состояние. Алишер запрашивает займ на сумму 10 000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Alisher is a repeating client of IMON International and has a good credit history. Alisher is 50 years old. He is married and has three adult children. His children are ages 27, 23 and 20. His wife is providing sewing services. Alisher has been working in the Tajik State University in the Business and Politics department for over five years. He works as a driver. He does his job honestly. His coworkers have described his as an honest and responsible man. Alisher has been planning to fix his house for several years because it's in a bad shape. Alisher is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood. He is waiting for her kindness and promises to pay off the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair the house.

loans.name: Elvia Leticia

texts.es:
Elvia es una señora casada  de 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo quienes viven en el Cantón Ojo de Agua San Antonio Palopo, Sololá. 
Ella cuenta con una venta de ropa y cosméticos en donde vive,  la cual lleva 5 años de tener su negocio y gracias a Dios todo le ha ido bien porque les ofrece variedad de productos a sus clientes,  sin que ellos tengan la necesidad de viajar a otro lugar. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de productos como ropa, cosméticos y  útiles, de esta manera  podrá  ofrecerles  un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y con lo que le genere,  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvia, 25, is married and has a one-year-old son. They all live in Ojo de Agua, San Antonio Palopó canton, department of Sololá.

She says that she has a store at home, where she has been selling clothes and cosmetics for five years. Thanks to God, her business is prosperous because she offers a wide variety and her customers do not have to go somewhere else to find them. Through this business, she makes enough to cover the home expenses.

Elvia is requesting a loan of Q 5,000 [GTQ] to buy clothes, cosmetics and school supplies, in order to offer a better service to her clients. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions with the profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and school supplies.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila, de 56 años es una mujer trabajadora. Está casada con Pascual, su esposo. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos, a quien cuidan y educan en su casa propia, desde hace 40 años. En el pueblo la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la artesanía y el arte; pero muy pocas personas como Luzmila, encontraron éxito en otros campos de desarrollo. Ella cuenta que hace 35 años, abrió una panadería y desde ese entonces todo le va muy bien, la mayoría de sus habitantes compran panes y pasteles en su negocio. Según cuenta cada día tiene nuevos clientes. Pero como en su sangre corre el gusto por el arte, ella también se dedica al tejido y bordado; sus 20 años de experiencia se refleja en su tienda de artesanía en el parque central de su localidad, donde vende sus principales tejidos, en épocas festivas llega a obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora ella quiere abrir su panadería en diferentes lugares, pero por el momento tendrá que esperar, pues su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud. Este es su quinto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante.
Luzmila, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de hilos , telas , entre otros para la elaboración de sus ricos panes.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 56, is a hardworking woman. She is married to Pascual, with whom she has six children, although only one lives with them. They educate and take care of her/him [gender not specified] in a house they have had for forty years.

Most locals work with handicrafts and other types of art, although a few people, such as Luzmila, followed a different path. She says that she opened a bakery 35 years ago which has always been successful and where locals buy bread and pies. She says that she gets new customers every day. However, art runs through her veins; she works with knitting and embroidery. She has 20 years of experience and a handicrafts store located in the town’s main square, where she sells her clothes. She makes good profits during the holiday season. She would also like to open her bakery in different places, but for that she will have to wait because her husband is very sick.

This is Luzmila’s fifth loan with Kiva. She feels grateful for the help she receives to get ahead. With the 1,000 soles [PEN] she is requesting, she will buy threads and fabrics and also some ingredients for the delicious bread she makes.

loans.use: to buy threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru: Манижа трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка, которому 2 года. Манижа является студенткой 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Она учится в факультете Финансы и кредит. Манижа учится хорошо и отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Ее муж Умедчон, который работает торговым представителем, данное время тоже не имеет денег, чтобы помочь жене. Манижа запрашивает займ на сумму 750 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Manizna is a hardworking and happy woman. She is married and has one child who is two years old. Manizha is a student at the Tajik State University of Commerce in her third year. She studies in the department of Finance and Credit. Manizha studies well and is excellent and active in the social university life. She has to pay for her tuition, but does not have money. Her husband Umedjon who works as a sales representative does not have money at this time either to help his wife. Manizha is asking for a loan in the amount of $750 USD to pay for her tuition and awaits for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, aged 46, and a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a driver. Together with her husband, Susana manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Susana operates a mobile store. Her mobile store is basically a small houseware store, which retails plastic containers, dipper, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. She transports her goods around her local community to sell the products. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30, 000. She will use the loan to buy different products, such as dust pans, hangers, basins, pails, pitchers, glassware, laundry baskets, trays and other products needed for her store.

Susana hopes that her business will grow and have another branch. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products, such as dust pans, hangers, basins, pails, pitchers, glassware, laundry baskets, trays and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old. He is married to Catherine, and they have two children. Francis runs a retail shop in Gichagi, on the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in this business for one year now, and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Francis' second loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to add to his stock by buying more items such as sugar, cooking oil and rice. With these items, Francis will be able to expand his business. In the future he hopes to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, cooking oil and rice for his store.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es:
Silvia es una señora casada de 28 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos quienes actualmente viven en la 2ª. Ave. 9-63 zona 1 Barrio San Antonio, Sololá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la compraventa de ropa americana en el mercado local de Sololá. Inicio esta actividad desde hace 1 año porque se dio cuenta que existe mucha demanda en este tipo de negocio. A través de esta labor obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que le permite contribuir en la economía de su familia.
Ella ve que la demanda de sus clientes y sus  ganancias son buenas, por lo que está  solicitando un préstamo  de Q 2,500.00 para la compra de  ropa y así  brindarles  una gran  variedad de ropa a sus clientes. 
Su  sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y brindarles una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Silvia is 28 years old and married.  She has three children and they all live on 2nd Avenue in the San Antonio barrio of Sololá.  

Silvia makes a living buying and selling American clothes at Sololá's market.  She started this work a year ago because she realised there was a lot of demand for this kind of business.  Through her work, Silvia makes a profit and an income that allows her to contribute to the household economy.

Silvia has seen that demand from customers and her profits are good and so is applying for a loan of 2,500 Qetzal in order to buy clothing.  She will then be able to offer a greater variety of items to her customers.

Silvia's dream is to improve her children's quality of living and to provide them with a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy American clothes.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 34 years old and is married with three children. 

Felomina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Before this loan, Felomina has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Felomina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
LOLO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de BATURU. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne 4 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de riz et de céréale à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la première assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BATURU dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE, excelle dans la vente de riz et céréale. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de riz et 3sacs de sorgho.  Elle s’approvisionne à DALABALA et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses grains à DALABALA et KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
LOLO is a group from the BENKADI association from Baturu. It comprises five women who know one another through family and neighbourhood links. They have an average age of 35. Married with on average four children, they conduct various business, such as the trading of rice and cereals in the case of Maimouna, who is seated on the right in the photo.
They live in large, traditional families in Baturu, which is in the district of Yanfolila (an area of Sikasso, in the Republic of Mali). They have been in business for several years and are in great demand in their business areas.
With a view to meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program five years ago. They are now on their seventh mutual loan. 
Maimouna, who is the group leader and very well known in Kangare, excels at selling rice and cereals. She plans to use her loan to purchase five sacks of rice and three sacks of sorghum. She buys her supplies in Dalabala as well as locally from wholesalers, and she sells in both Dalabala and Kangare - retail - for both cash and credit, to a customer base of both men and women.
She is hoping for a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which will allow her to repay the loan and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
An industrious mother of three children, Sinat is 47 years old and is a villager from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. 

She earns an income from growing rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been involved in this business for 20 years, and is able to earn up to 32,900 KHR per day. 

Sinat is a fourth-cycle client of VisionFund (Kiva's partner); and she has fully repaid her past three loans already. Her previous loan has enabled her to support her business.

Sinat is the leader of her group. The group is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR (in total). Sinat's loan portion will be 1,400,000 KHR, and she will use the loan to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this will help her to increase her income, and enable her to grow her business greater than before,

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees for her farm.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Couturier de profession, et cela depuis 2007, Ayaovi exerce son activité dans un atelier. Il est père d’un enfant et est âgé de 39ans. Sa femme est coiffeuse. Il coud les habits et a de nombreux clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé pour commander. Ce second prêt qu’il sollicite lui servira à s’approvisionner en machine et tissus pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Il veut épargner le profit supplémentaire, créer d’autres points de vente d’habits et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is a clothes designer by profession and has been working from his workshop since 2007. He is the father of one child and is 39 years old. His wife is a hairdresser. 
He makes clothes and has many customers who come from all over the city of Lome to order clothes. This second loan will allow him to buy equipment and fabrics so that he can better meet the needs of his customers. He wants to save any extra profits, open other sales outlets and ensure that his family is financially stable.

loans.use: to buy equipment and fabric

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús es una mujer de 54 años de edad, con un matrimonio sólido y madre de una hija mayor de edad la cual vive con ellos y ayuda en los quehaceres domésticos en el hogar. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que hace más de 20 años trabaja la tierra por lo cual agradece a sus padres por haberle enseñado a trabajar ya que en su familia la agricultura es una tradición y un medio de ingreso económico único para el sustento familiar. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla en ese aspecto de su vida. El cultivo de café es una actividad agrícola que de ser tratada a tiempo, de darle mantenimiento entre otros se pueden obtener buenas ganancias por lo tanto el día de hoy Teresa de Jesús ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que ayudaran a tener su cultivo limpio, sano y libre de plagas que puedan dañarlo.

Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir mejorando sus cultivos, tecnificarlos y seguir cuidándolos para que se mantengan sanos y no perder credibilidad ante sus clientes mismos que son los intermediarios entre otros que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 54 years old and has a solid marriage.  She has a daughter who is now an adult, but who still lives with her parents and helps with household chores.  Teresa has a lot of experience as she has been working the land for over twenty years.  She is grateful to her parents who taught her this work, as farming is a tradition in the family and a source of income for supporting the household.  Teresa did not go to school as her parents were very poor and could not support her with education costs.  Growing coffee is something that, if you take your time and maintain the crops, can provide a good profit.  So, today, Teresa is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy supplies to help keep the crops clean, healthy and to avoid diseases that could damage them.

Teresa's future plans are to continue improving her crops and to continue looking after them so that they remain healthy.  She wants to make the coffe-growing process more technical and she does not want to lose credibility in her customers' eyes.  Teresa's customers include wholesalers who come to the area looking for a good quality product.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yoeurm's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurm is a 35-year-old mother of four children, and lives in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province.

For Yoeurm, one and half hectares of rice cropping is the main source of income for the family. To earn extra income, her husband also works at a construction site during his spare time. She has been in this business for three years, and earns approximately 4,900 KHR per day. 

This is Yoeurm's fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has wisely managed her past three loan to sustain her business promptly. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her co-borrower are seeking a loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Yoeurm will spend her loan portion to buy two sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees. She will also use a small portion of it to buy cucumber seed for earning extra income. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and earn a higher income so that she can expand her vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch is a young mother with two children. She lives in a thatched-roof house in Battambang province.  Her primary source of income comes from growing rice on five hectares of land and beans on another five hectares. To earn additional income, Sreytouch and her husband also catch fish to sell. 

This is Sreytouch's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her past loan, which enabled her to earn more income to sustain her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking for new loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. Sreytouch hopes that she can double her crop output and earn a good income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 21 años, vive con su mamá y sus 6 hermanos, a los que quiere y aprecia en la casa de sus padres. Está joven señorita, hábil y con mucho futuro. Estudia en el instituto de bellas artes de su localidad, donde está aprendiendo a pintar hermosos cuadros, pues el arte lo lleva en la vena, ya que su familia se dedica a la artesanía. Según cuenta le falta 2 años para culminar sus estudios; pero desde ahora pinta hermosos cuadros al óleo; los cuales comercializa a buen precio. Además de dedicarse al bordado de disfraces, faldas y manteles. Ya tienen dos años emprendiendo su propio negocio y según afirma le va muy bien y cada día tienen más pedidos. Ahora ella quiere trabajar muy duro, para expandir su negocio y juntar el dinero necesario para poder estudiar la carrera de gastronomía, pues es otro de sus sueños. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.    Rocío; invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de telas, hilos de colores, blondas, lanas de diversos colores para la realización de sus trabajos.
texts.en: Rocío is 21 years old and lives at her parents' house with her mother and six siblings, whom she loves and appreciates.  This skilled young woman has a good future ahead of her.  She is studying at the local art school, learning to paint beautiful pictures.  Rocío has art in her blood, with the whole family working with artisan products.  Rocío tells us that she has two years left before she finishes her studies but she is already producing wonderful oil paintings, which she sells at a very good price.  In addition, Rocío makes fancy dress costumes, skirts and tablecloths.  She has had her business for two years and assures us that it is going very well, as she is receiving more and more orders every day.  She now wants to work very hard in order to expand her business and save up the necessary money to study cooking, another of her dreams.  This will be Rocío's fourth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the support she is being given. She promises to make her repayments on time.  Rocío will invest the 1500 Nuevo Soles in buying material, coloured threads, blond lace and wool of varying colours for her work.

loans.use: to buy material, coloured threads, blond lace and wool.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children. Alfred has been involved in agricultural work for six years. His primary income comes from selling milk, eggs, tea, crops.

He stated that what he most enjoys about farming is: 'Profit'. His biggest challenge is 'Raising funds.' He has not given any of the farm animals names.

Alfred was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Low interest rate'. This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That the interest rate is 18 percent.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Alfred replied 'It will better their livelihood.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alfred owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is a 50-year-old mother of six children. She lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

Seng grows rice on three hectares of farmland. During their free time, her husband also works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. Seng has owned this business for three years.  

This is Seng's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan, which she has completely repaid, has helped her to earn a better income to sustain her living conditions. Seng is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy five sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more profits, so that she can save some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Teriya est un groupe qui regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans.
