Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de légume à l’image de AMI qui est la première personne debout de  la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU  dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de légume de condiment. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, cube maggi.et des poissons séchés).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Teriya is a group of four women who all came to know one other through family and neighbourhood links. They have an average age of 40. Married with on average five children, they conduct various activities, such the trading of condiments and vegetables as in the case of Ami, who is the person standing on the far left of the photo.
The women live in large, traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the county of Kati (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali). They have been trading locally for several years and are are in great demand for their products and services.
With a view to meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their fifth mutual loan. Ami, who is the group leader and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the selling of vegetables and condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase a variety of condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, stock cubes and dried fish). She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her food products in Ouelessebougou - retail - for both cash and credit, to both men and women.
She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, an amount which will allow her to repay the loan, and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, aged eleven and seven. Faith's husband works as a clerk within the town council, while Faith manages the wheat farm as well as running their small shop.

Faith has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now servicing a second loan of KES 60,000. The funds have been used to hire a tractor as well as to purchase fertilizer for the wheat plantation. She will use the income proceeds to educate her children.

Faith hopes to expand her shop from the gains earned from the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for tractor hire.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is 45 years old, and is married with four children. He is a tricycle driver providing transport services in his village, where he earns P400 a day.  He has been in this business for ten years and wants to increase his income and continue to provide safe and good services to all his passengers.  

Benito would like to borrow an additional capital of P8,000 from the lenders to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle.

Benito hopes to achieve economic stability and give his family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 57 years old and is married with three children. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Editha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar laborando en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar maíz, azúcar, entre otros productos para realizar sus ventas en el negocio.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y con las ganancias, ha logrado brindarle el apoyo a sus hijos en los estudios; las condiciones económicas y circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
María needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue working in her business.  This loan will allow her to buy corn, sugar and other products she needs to make her sales.

María's previous loan helped her to improve her income and she has managed to use her profits to support her children in their studies.  Her financial situation and family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and other products

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 46 years old, and is married with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a policeman for twenty years. 

With his little salary he has been able to support his family. He hopes that all his children will finish school. However, his main source of income is his salary, and delayed payment is a challenge. Wilson is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: José Ezequiel

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona trabajadora que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura y otras labores que generen ingresos para su familia. Pero desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, todo comenzó con la idea de realizar su boda con la persona que hoy es su esposa, pensaron en ahorrar un dinero comprando 70 pollos de engorde y sin saber nada del tiempo que tardaba en desarrollarse el pollo lo hicieron. Y tuvieron que vender los 70 pollos por que se engordaron antes de la fecha de su boda. Y es así como iniciaron su negocio.
Los insumos como concentrados, vitaminas y vacunas los compra en el Municipio; porque es el único lugar donde el cliente obtiene buen precio y tiene asesoría técnica para su producción. Para llegar a este lugar tiene que viajar una distancia de 5 kilómetros en autobús o en pick-up.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de concentrado para iniciar el desarrollo de un lote de pollos y la otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas. 

Sus planes a futuro es tener una galera donde pueda desarrollar mas pollos y darles mantenimiento en mejores condiciones para lograr mayores rendimientos económicos y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y cubrir la demanda de los pollos.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a hard-working person who lives with his wife and two children.  José works as a farmer and also carries out additional work to make income for his family.  For the past four years, he has been raising chickens for meat.  It all started with the idea of marrying the woman who is now his wife.  The couple decided to save some money on their wedding by purchasing 70 chickens to fatten themselves and, without knowing anything about the amount of time it takes a chicken to grow, they did this.  They had to sell the 70 chickens because they developed before their wedding date.  This is how they started their business.  The couple buy the supplies they need such as concentrated feed, vitamins and vaccines in Sensuntepeque because it is the only place where customers receive a good price and technical advice.  To reach this place, José has to travel 5km by bus or pick-up truck.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy four 100lb bags of concentrate to feed a batch of chickens.  He will use the remaining money to buy farm supplies.

José's future plans are to build a shed where he can raise more chickens and provide them with better conditions.  This will make him more money and he will be able to both satisfy his family's needs and cover his demand for chickens.

loans.use: to buy four 100lb bags of concentrate to feed his chickens, and to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Bunry's Group

texts.en:
Bunry is a local villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province. He is father of one little girl. 

To provide for his family, Bunry manages four hectares of cassava farming, which he has had for six years. 

This is Bunry's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is leading the group of two to apply for a loan. He and his joint member are seeking a loans of 4,000,000 KHR and 3,000,000 KHR, respectively. Bunry will use his loan portion to plow his farmland, pay for labor costs, buy insecticide and cassava seedling. He hopes that he can make more income in order to save more money for his daughter’s education costs in the future.

loans.use: to plow his farmland, pay for labor costs, buy insecticide and cassava seedling.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 71 años de edad, es viudo y tiene cinco hijos. Es una persona trabajadora y muy humilde, que desde pequeño nunca tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a su padre y para el fue muy difícil crecer si un padre; por ser el primer hijo varón de su madre fue quien le ayudo a cultivar y trabajar para la familia y desde que tenía 15 años de edad, inicio cultivando su primera milpa y desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar, la agricultura y nadie le enseño todos los conocimientos que hoy tiene los adquirió al ver la necesidad de sus hermanos y su madre.
Como todo agricultor de la zona  compra los insumos, donde mejor precio le den y pueda ahorrar un par de pesos, debe de viajar desde la comunidad en pick-up durante 30 minutos. Para llegar hasta el lugar donde adquiere los insumos y eso tiene un costo por que tiene que pagar para que le lleven los productos hasta donde vive y de ahí los carga en su espalda hasta que los lleva a su humilde casa.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de fertilizantes, semilla de maíz, herbicidas y fungicidas para el control de plagas y malezas que puedan dañar su cultivo. También invertirá en la mano de obra para la preparación del terreno.

Con el préstamo, dispondrá de  los productos necesarios, para el mantenimiento adecuado de su cultivo y con eso obtener una mejor cosecha de calidad que supere los niveles de productividad de la zona y sea hasta más fácil su venta.


Su deseo es, ayudar a sus nietos a que aprendan a ganarse la vida humildemente y puedan superarse en esta vida.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 71 years old, widowed, and has five children.  He is a hard-working, very humble person who never had the chance to know his father.  It was very difficult for Gregorio growing up without a father and, because he was the eldest son, he was the one who had to help his mother to farm and work for the family.  He started growing his first field of corn at the age of 15 and hasn't stopped working since.  Nobody taught him all the things he knows about farming.  He learned them because he could see the needs of his siblings and mother.

In common with other farmers in his area, Gregorio buys his supplies wherever he can get them at the best price and save a few pesos.  He has to travel around 30 minutes by pick-up truck from his community to get to the place where he buys his supplies and this has its price because he has to pay for them to deliver the products to his property, where he loads them onto his back and carries them to his humble home.

Gregorio is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy three sacks of fertilizer, corn seeds, and herbicides and fungicides to control pests and weeds that can damage his crops.  He will also pay laborers to prepare his land.

With this loan, Gregorio will have all the products he needs to adequately care for his crops.  This will allow him to achieve a better, good-quality harvest that will beat local productivity levels and his sales will be easier.

Gregorio would like to help his grandchildren to learn to earn a modest living.  He hopes that they will do well in life.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizers, corn seeds, and herbicides and fungicides to control pests and weeds that can harm his crops.  He will also pay laborers to prepare his land

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
Karlen was born in and still lives in the sunny and beautiful village of Artsvanik, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. He has higher technical education and now works at the Kajaran Copper Molybdenum Combine as an engineer. 

Karlen is married, and he lives with his wife and son. His elder son is married and lives with his own family separately. 

From an early age, Karlen has been involved in agriculture and farming. He owns a plot of land and some farm animals. Karlen cultivates crops and a large variety of vegetables: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, radish and greens. He receives a decent income from selling his garden harvest, meat and milk to re-sellers at the cities of Kapan and Kajaran. Karlen also breeds from his two cows, two bulls, two calves, a horse and ten chickens.

Karlen has requested a loan of 1,100,000 AMD to buy animal fodder and fertilizer. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him as well as many other farmers who have had a great success by the help of given loans.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Elsa earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Koitat

texts.en:
Koitat is 42 years old, married to Kibiyoto and blessed with six children, which he supports. 

He is a wheat farmer in the Naituyupaki area and has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 30,000 monthly. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, which will facilitate land preparation and enable him to purchase farm supplies to help obtain better yields.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for his family's basic needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es:
Vicente, tiene 48 años de edad y está acompañado. El, se dedica a la agricultura y realiza  el cultivo de maíz para obtener ingresos necesarios y mantener su hogar, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo desempeña de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm, asimimo posee un taller de estructuras metalicas.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas adecuados tales como: semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros; esto le ayudara a tener la capacidad de mayor inversión e incrementar sus ganancias.
Su deseo es fortalecer el negocio para optimizar su situación económica y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente is 48 years old and lives with his partner.  He is a farmer and grows corn to make the income he needs to support his household.  He learned this trade from his parents and works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.00am to 12.00pm.  He also owns a metal shop.

Vicente needs this loan to buy farm supplies such as corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other products.  This will help him to invest more in his business and increase his profits.

Vicente would like to strengthen his business so that he can improve his financial situation and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has four children and has been doing this work for eight years. Her primary income sources are from selling milk, eggs and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling products'.  Her biggest challenge is 'Cultivating.' The cow has been given the name 'Karoi.'

Esther was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It gives a grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Interest.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Esther replied 'More yields.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Esther owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Lorena Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Lorena, es una señora de 35 años de edad, casada tiene dos hijos, en la actualidad ella no trabaja solamente su esposo se encarga de los gastos del hogar, Lorena para apoyar a su familia se está dedicando a estudiar, ya que antes no pudo por estar trabajando ahora que se le presento la oportunidad de realizar una carrera en Licenciatura en Psicología Clínica desea aprovechar al máximo para prepararse, está solicitando el crédito para pagar  el curso de titulación, lo que le permitirá realizarse como toda una mujer profesional y sería un punto de apoyo a su familia y a la comunidad.
texts.en: Lorena is 35 and married with two children  At the moment she is not working and it is her husband who is responsible for the household expenses.  In order to support her family Lorena is studying, as she was unable to do so earlier because she was working.  Now that a chance has come up to do a Clinical Psychology degree, she wants to take every opportunity to prepare.  She is, therefore, applying for a loan to pay for the degree course, which will allow her to become a professional woman and would be a means of support for her family and the wider community.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer sencilla de 49 años; está casada con Moisés. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los que quieren mucho, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde muy joven se dedica al tejido; pues es un legado de la zona. Sus principales prendas son gorras de todo diseño, tamaño y color. Ella misma comercializa todos sus productos en otra ciudad, donde tiene gran demanda, además de llevar queso y menudencia para venderlo a los mismos comerciantes. Ahora desea continuar tejiendo pues tiene muchos pedidos y como es una mujer trabajadora, se encuentra día y moche trabajando para poder abastecer la demanda. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Hilda; invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de lanas de diversos colores para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Hilda is a humble, 49 year old woman. She is married to Moisés. They both have 5 children, whom they love very much, but they only live with 2 of them in the house she inherited from her parents. Since she was very young, she has worked in knitting, as it is a legacy of the area. Her main items are hats of all designs, sizes and colors. She sells all of her products in another city where there is a lot of demand. She also takes cheese and odds and ends to sell to the same merchants. Right now, she wants to continue knitting because she has a lot of orders, and since she is a hardworking woman, she finds herself working day and night to fill the demand. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help she has received. She is also committed to making her payments on time. Hilda will invest the S/.1500 soles in buying wool in varied colors to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy wool in varied colors.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo, ya que cultiva granos básicos y hortalizas; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El efecto del préstamo anterior le ayudo en gran medida, ya que la producción aumento y sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
José needs to take out a new loan because he needs more working capital.  He grows basic grains and vegetables.  This loan will allow him to buy the farm supplies he needs such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

José's previous loan helped him a lot.  His yield increased and he invested his income in covering his household expenses.  Both his financial situation and his family situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
This is Visitacion, age 46, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, an employee. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Visitacion operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business and a laundry shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.

Visitacion hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy synthetic hair, a hair dryer and cosmetics to use in the salon

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sangke district of Battambang province, Ran is 37 years old and married. She is blessed with four kids who currently are students at a local state school. To make a living, she sells food including rice and porridge as her main source of income. Her husband also helps her to earn more income by driving a motor-taxi for a fee. With this loan, she is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the first successful loan which she has repaid completely, she can relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood better than before and, in particular, she can keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy more ingredients for her food-selling business including rice and meat. She hopes that she can make more profit from her business so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food-selling business including rice and meat.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha es soltera, 37 años de edad y  con un hijo su negocio es la venta de calzado desde hace 3 años, y venta de tamarindo, el calzado lo vende en su comunidad y el tamarindo lo comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tamarindo, Francisca es otra socia y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Petrona tiene 54 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Martha, who is 37, single and the mother of one child.  She has been selling footwear and tamarinds for 3 years.  She sells the footwear within her community and tamarinds at Masaya market  She will use the loan to buy tamarinds. The other members of the group are Francisca, who sells fruit and vegetables, and 54-year-old Petrona, who sells fruit.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. 

Gina is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Gina has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for four years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, laundry soap, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es:
Damaris, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y por la forma de pago que la Institución brinda; este le permitirá comprar material de bisutería tales como: nailon, perlas, plástico, asimismo cadenas enchapadas, collares, pulseras, anillos, entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior le genero mayores ingresos, ya que logro adquirir material para el negocio y tener más inventario para poder cumplir con la demanda del cliente; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Damaris needs to take out another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business.  The repayment format that the institution provides allows her to buy jewelry materials such as nylon, pearls, plastic, plated chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.

Damaris' previous loan made her more income because she managed to buy materials for her business and had more stock available which meant that she could meet her customer demand.  Both her financial situation and her family situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy nylon, pearls, plastic, plated chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en:
Ban is 59 years old and a widowed mother of eight children. She strives to earn a living via rice cropping, which she has been doing for 11 years. Ban has been with VisionFund for the past four cycles and has fully repaid back her past loans completely, which has supported her business on time. 

Now, Ban is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. Her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Ban will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She highly believes that she can increase her income so she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: To plow her farmland.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A hardworking farmer residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sarom is 63 years old and blessed with seven children. Currently, only one child is still in school. 

She earns a living from her three hectares of rice farming, with which she has been engaged for 31 years and is able to earn about 11,100 KHR per day. 

Her past loan was the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which she has fully repaid with success. Her living conditions improved, which is the positive outcome of her past loan. 

Now, she is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying potash for her crop. She believes that she can expand her business and improve on last year and earn more income to sustain her way of life.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

loans.name: Brenda Marisela

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven de 21 años de edad con muchos sueños, muchas metas y muchas esperanzas de poder cumplir todas y cada una de ellas. Ella es casada con un grado de secundaria completa graduándose como maestra de educación primaria la cual no la desempeña por la falta de empleo y plazas en cada una de las instituciones en la zona donde ella habita. Su único apoyo es su pareja que actualmente él se desempeña como mecánico automotriz en un taller de la zona el cual es muy reconocido y con mucho prestigio. Con el apoyo de él, ella ha decido emprender un negocio el cual es la compra/venta de mercadería en general como: Lociones, maquillaje, aceite para motor de motocicleta y carro, etc. De ellos no depende nadie por lo tanto es un poco más fácil el sustento familiar y poder dar mantenimiento y comprar productos en pequeña escala para su negocio.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento a COMIXMUL parta la compra de mercadería en general ya que la demanda de su negocio está creciendo y necesita inyectarle a su negocio un poco más de capital e invertirlo en productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  

Sus planes es poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que la cooperativa ofrece por sus tasas bajas de interés para cumplir su sueño de abrir una tienda de mercadería ya que actualmente elle vende de casa en casa sus productos desplazándose a las diferentes zonas de su municipio.
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman of 21 who has a lot of dreams and goals.  She is very hopeful that she will be able to fulfill each and every one of them.  Brenda is married and completed her secondary education, graduating as an elementary school teacher.  She does not work as a teacher as there were no jobs in any of the schools in her area.  Her only support is her husband who works as a car mechanic in a well-known, very prestigious auto repair shop in her area.  With his support, Brenda has decided to set up a business buying and selling general merchandise such as lotions, make-up, motorcycle oil, car oil, etc.  The couple have no dependents so it is a little easier to support their family and Brenda is able to buy products on a small scale for her business.

Brenda is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy general merchandise as her demand is growing and she needs to inject a little more capital into her business and invest in products to sell to her customers.

Brenda's plans are to continue enjoying the benefits offered by the cooperative with their low interest rates.  She hopes to fulfill her dream of opening a general store as she currently sells her products door to door, travelling to different areas of her town.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
Chanra, 36, is a rural farmer from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has three children to cater for, as they are still in school. 

The main source of her family's income is a dual income, as her husband works for others for a fee, while Chanra earns another income from rice cropping and a pig raising business. 

This is the business that she has had for 10 years, earning about 28,300 KHR per day. Chanra has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan. The past loan enabled her to improve her living conditions and expand her business at a gradual pace; she has also repaid her past loan with success. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, while her joint member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying rice seed to plough into her rice farming business and pig feed. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her businesses on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy rice seed to plough into her rice farming business and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Lilliam Milagros

texts.es: Liliam, tiene 25 años es una joven que en la actualidad no trabaja, se dedica a sus estudios, la carrera de Administración de Empresas con mención en Mercadeo, su mama le ayuda a pagar la mensualidad de la universidad, su meta es culminar su profesión y buscar una oportunidad de empleo para poder ayudar a su familia con sus ingresos. El apoyo de crédito que solicita es para pagar el curso de titulación.
texts.en: Liliam, who is 25, is not working at the moment; she is studying for a degree in Business Administration (with a minor in Marketing).  Her mother helps her to pay her monthly tuition fees.  Her ambition is to complete her course and find a job opening so that she can use her income to help her family.  The loan she is seeking is to pay the tuition fess for her degree course.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a 57 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has 6 children and the youngest is 15.  She runs a retail store.  She sells items like biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, bread, coconut wine and soaps.  She has been operating a retail store for more than 10 years now. 

Celedonia requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and beverages to avoid stock shortage and to cater to the needs of her customers.  In the future,  Celedonia would like to expand her retail store business to support her family and also to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and beverages

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a cash crop farmer in Oloitoktok town.  She specializes in crops such as maize and beans.  She also plants vegetables to sell.  Beatrice is 37 years old and married with 2 children.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting during this rainy season.  She anticipates making more income with which she will use to buy more farm inputs such as insecticides and tilling tools.

She hopes to improve her farming methods and be successful in her farming business hence make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en: Donata is a fifty three year old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She deals in the craft business and also does agriculture for additional income.  She dreams of expanding her business to new areas, however, delays in getting raw materials is her challenge.  Donata will use the loan to buy raw materials for making crafts.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Claudia Marisol

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Es ama de casa vive con su compañero de vida, quien se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, además  vive con su hijo de un año y tres meses es una mujer dedicada a los oficios del hogar que está al pendiente de su esposo y su hijo en todo momento.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para la construcción de un muro al frente de su casa. Con la inversión, estará más segura tanto ella como su familia y así su hijo podrá jugar libremente y sin riesgo a los alrededores de la casa, evitando problemas de los vehículos y animales que transitan por la zona. 

Mejorara grandemente sus condiciones de seguridad; ya que sin el muro estaba propensa a cualquier situación de riesgo tanto ella como su familia. Después, de la construcción del muro de su casa quiere construir un corredor en su hogar; ya que quiere ampliar su vivienda para que  su familia este más cómoda y su hijo jugara con mayor seguridad dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 23 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. She is a house wife and lives with her life's companion, who works in agriculture.  She also lives with her fifteen month old son. She is a woman who cares for the home and is watching over her husband and son at all times. 

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy construction materials for a wall in front of her house. With the investment, both she and her family will be safer and her son can play freely and risk free around the house, avoiding problems with vehicles and animals that are in the area. 

She will gradually improve her security conditions, since without the wall she and her family were vulnerable to any risky situation. After building the wall, she wants to build a hallway in her house, since she wants to expand it so her family is more comfortable and he son can play more safely inside the house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Ida Armenia

texts.en:
Ida Armenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell to customers.

Ida Armenia has been in this business for four years.  Ida Armenia earns more income from rice retailing.  Ida Armenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods  to sell.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay, age 53, is the mother of nine children; three of whom are still in school.  Now, her main source of income is from the pig-raising business.  This is not the first loan for Lay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid back her previous loans with great success and it has enabled her to increase her income, up to 47,200 KHR per day so she can afford to buy a decent motorbike for commuting as well as to support her business. 

Now, she is in a group of four applying for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pigs for raising.  She hopes that this business keeps growing so that she can make more income to expand this business to a bigger scale.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, age 49 is the mother of eight children, who is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  Nowadays, she needs to support only three children as they are still in school.  Her two hectares of rice farming, which she has had for 12 years, has generated her about 9,800 KHR per day. 

Ly is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each.   After the past loan which she has fully repaid back, she feels confident that she can upgrade her living conditions.  For this cycle, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for her plowing fee.  She hopes that she can gain a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for her plowing fee

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome works hard to support her family.  Salome is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Salome requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Salome has been in this business for 20 years now.  Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, a mother of three children, is 53 years old and a rice grower on two hectares of land as the main source of income to deal with the daily cost of living. She has been engaged in the current business for 15 years.  

Touch is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and currently leads a group of three to apply for a new loan in the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland.  She highly believes that she can make more income than before to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron and metal sheets to put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  46 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  Lafiabougou un des quartiers de la ville de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 13 eme  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1 ère femme  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires pour faire la restauration. Elle compte acheter 3 sacs de farine 2 bidons de vingt litres un sac d’oignon et les ingrédients indispensables à la restauration.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à SAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes(plats alimentaires), sur place à SAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djekafo group are 46 years old on average, and have an average of six children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighbourhoods in the town of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and involved in various business activities. This includes trading food products, such as condiments, and catering.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Djekafo group are requesting their 13th solidarity loan. Kadia, pictured on the far left, will use her part of the loan to buy food supplies to use in her catering business. She will buy three sacks of flour, two 20-liter cans of oil, a bag of onions and other essential ingredients.

The women buy their supplies in San and the surrounding villages. They sell prepared dishes in San to both men and women customers.

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 75 500 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her catering business.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Fotemogoban ont en moyenne  45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  LAFIABOUGOU, un des quartiers de ville de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits divers, les articles de boutiques (lait, sucre, thé etc.)  
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont à leur 4er prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 1 ère personne de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des produits divers  tels les tissus wax Bazin et les bijoux.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à Koutiala  et  à SAN. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à San, aux marchés et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Fotemogoban group are 45 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighbourhoods in the town of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are related and are all involved in trading various products, such as general goods (milk, sugar, tea, etc.).  

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Fotemogoban group are requesting their 4th solidarity loan. Djeneba, pictured on the far left, intends to use her loan to buy various products such as wax bazin cloth and jewellery.

The women buy their supplies in Koutiala and San. They sell their goods in San in the markets and surrounding fairs, to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 45 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to buy the materials needed to make rugs and door mats and she was able to produce more output.  The loan also helped in the education of her children as well as in their everyday expenses.  She also has a variety store which she is also attending to.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Nelly dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Es una persona emprendedora, con deseos de superación. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, oficio que aprendió de sus padres quienes toda su vida fueron agricultores, e inculcaron en ella el deseo de seguir cultivando la tierra. Al mismo tiempo en sus espacios libres se dedica a hacer los quehaceres del hogar.
Ella compra las semillas y todos los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad que esta a  una distancia de 2kilometros de su hogar. De donde aborda el autobús, que es el medio en donde transporta todos los materiales, hacia su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, semillas para cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 metros cuadrados de ajonjolí.   

Con la cosecha espera obtener un buen ingreso, con los cuales espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella tiene un sueño y es  mejorar su vivienda, entre sus planes también esta comprar más ganado bovino y por supuesto con los ingresos de la cosecha poder pagar el préstamo para seguir teniendo acceso al mismo.
texts.en: Zoila, who is 48, is the single mother of two children.  She is an enterprising woman who is determined to succeed.  She has grown corn and sesame for a number of years, having learned her trade from her parents who were farmers all their lives and who instilled in her the desire to continue farming the land.  In her spare time, she also does her housework.  She buys seeds and all her agricultural supplies in a city which is about 2km from where she lives.  She transports all her materials back home by bus.  The loan which she is seeking from Fundación Campo will be used to buy manure, weed killer, pesticide and seeds for 10.500 square metres of corn and 3,500 square metres of sesame.  She expects the harvest to earn her a good income which she hopes to use to improve her living conditions Her dream is to improve her home, and other plans include buying more cattle and, of course, using income from the harvest to pay back her loan so as to be eligible for further ones.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed killer, pesticide and seeds for 10.500 square metres of corn and 3,500 square metres of sesame.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sophorn is one of the breadwinners in a family consisting of three kids.  She meets the daily food consumption expenses via a rice cropping business, which she has been in for several years and it earns her about 18,300 KHR per day. 

Sophorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles, including this loan.  She has utilized her past loans wisely to improve her living condition.  For this cycle, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan.  Sophorn is the leader who requests for 1,400,000 KHR while the other two joint members are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each.  For Sophorn, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash as well as to pay the plowing fee.  She hopes that she can get a better yield than before and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy potash as well as to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Djedouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  DJEDOUMA ont en moyenne  30 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  SANTORO, un des quartiers du cercle de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et produits divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEDOUMA sont à leur 4 eme  prêt solidaire. SALI 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1bidon d’huile alimentaire, des poivres, des tomates fraîches, des oignons, des aubergines, des paniers de grains de céréales et quelques paniers de fruits et légumes. 
 Elles s’approvisionnent à SAN. Elles effectuent ses ventes, à San et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djedouma group are 30 years old on average, and have an average of five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Santoro, one of the neighbourhoods in the cercle of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and are involved in trading food products, such as condiments, and other goods.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Djedouma group are requesting their 4th solidarity loan. Sali, pictured standing on the far left, will use her loan to buy one can of cooking oil, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, aubergines, baskets of cereal grains and some baskets of fruit and vegetables. 

The women buy their supplies in San. They sell their goods in San and in surrounding markets to individual customers for cash or on credit. Their clientele includes both men and women. 

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 20 000 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Tismayan Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres  socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Nimia mujer de 52 años, acompañada, con dos hijos mayores, su negocio es la venta de  leche, cuajadas, cremas, pipianes, plátanos tanto en su domicilio como ambulante en las calles de Masaya, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 30 años es muy reconocida en el municipio y en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de leche, cuajadas, cremas, queso, plátanos verdes etc. Reyna es una integrantes del grupo tiene 32 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva,   y Leyda tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva también.
texts.en:
This group comprises three entrepreneurial members.  One of them is 52-year-old Nimia who lives with her partner and has two adult children.  Her business is selling milk, 'cuajada' (soft white cheese), cream, squash and plantains both from home and as an itinerant vendor in the streets of Masaya.  Nimia has been in this business for 30 years.  She is very well known in her town and community.  She will invest her loan in buying milk, cuajada, cream, cheese, plantains, etc. 

Reyna is another member of this group.  She is 32 years old and her business is selling new clothing.  Leyda is 35 years old and her business is also selling new clothing.

loans.use: to invest in buying milk, cuajada, cream, cheese, plantains, etc.

loans.name: La Conscience Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Sofi est conseillère du groupe d’affaire  « La Conscience », doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 63 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants certains ont déjà leurs familles respectives. Son conjoint est un informaticien. La cliente est vendeuse des légumes. Elle installe ses produits au marché. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Il y a 4 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les légumes. Pendant la sécheresse, elle a des difficultés de trouves les marchandises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Sofi is the leader of the “La Conscience” business group. She is an experienced business woman and the most senior member of the group. She is 63 years old, married and the mother of 10 children, some of whom already have families of her own.  Her husband works in IT. 

Sofi sells vegetables at the market. She began this business four years ago with her own money that she received from her husband. 

This new loan will help her buy vegetables. During the dry season, she has difficulties finding produce. So she is seeking to increase her capital and feed her children. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for providing support through microcredit to small-scale entrepreneurs. 

It should be noted that one group member is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUIYA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de LAFIABOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec deux enfants en moyenne, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de  condiment, de légume et de la restauration à l’image de AWA qui est la première assise de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à LAFIABOUGOU dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
AWA qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à LAFIABOUGOU, excelle dans la restauration. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter avoir avec ce prêt 10  kilogrammes de condiments, 2 sacs de céréales divers et de tubercules pour servir pendant longtemps sans pénurie.  Elle s’approvisionne à KANGARE sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group in the Danaya association in Lafiabougou. The group is made up of four married women who know each other through being relations and neighbours. On average, they are 25 years old and have two children. 

The women are involved in various activities, such as trading condiments and vegetables, and catering, like Awa, pictured sitting on the right. They live in large traditional families in Lafiabougou in the prefecture of Yanfolila (in the Sikasso region, Mali). 

The women have been involved in small-scale business for several years, and are very much in demand. 

In order to satisfy growing customer demand, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance programme two years ago. This is their fourth solidarity loan. 

Awa, the group leader, is very well-known in Lafiabougou and she excels in catering. She is going to use her loan to buy 10 kilograms of condiments and two sacks of various cereals and root vegetables, so that she has enough stock to last for a long time. She buys her supplies from wholesalers and sells her food to individuals in Kangare, both for cash and on credit, to a customer base that includes both men and women.   

Awa hopes to make 25 000 CFA francs per month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 61 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Tiene al rededor de unos 40 años de  trabajar para sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo. Ella hacia tamales, pan horneado para vender ademas tiene un molino de nixtamal de una tolva, mientras su esposo trabajaba como albañil en la zona y como jornal de trabajos agrícolas cuando el trabajo como albañil era escaso. con su familia cuidan también 5 cabezas de ganado bovino cultivan sorgo 0.7 hectáreas para obtener forraje para el ganado y el grano para las aves de corral  y 1.40 hectáreas de maíz que les proporciona el maíz para el consumo de la familia y si el precio es bueno venden una parte para cubrir algunos gastos de la casa y el forraje para el ganado ya que la zona posee dos estaciones meteorológicas bien marcadas una época de lluvias donde hay que sembrar los granos básicos y el forraje para el ganado y una época seca bien marcada donde los pastos se escasea y secan no hay ninguna fuente natural de agua para  abastecer los potreros y cultivos.       

los insumos agrícolas se compran en  la ciudad, pero hay que salir en el único autobús que sale de la comunidad o en pick-up a unos 15 kilómetros, luego cargarlos en la espalda hasta el lugar de los cultivos con su familia y alguna persona que se contrata para hacer este trabajo; ya que su esposo ya no trabaja por motivos de salud hace unos 15 años sufrió un accidente en una construcción de la cual quedo en estado de coma y desde entonces el esposo perdio en gran porcentaje la capacidad  de razonamiento la de ejercer trabajos pesados y prácticamente  es Guadalupe la que lleva los ingresos al hogar. 
         
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, fungicidas, semillas, pago de mano de obra para cultivar 0.7 hectáreas  de cultivo de sorgo y 1.4  hectáreas de cultivo de maíz. Con el crédito satisfacera las necesidades de granos para consumo de la familia y las aves de corral  y el forraje para alimentar en la época seca a las vacas que poseen.    



En un futuro espera trabajar de manera diferente talvez con capital propio  y mejorar el ganado ya que en este momento las vacas que están son de tipo carne  y cruzando las vacas con un toro tipo leche se obtengan animales que se adapten al clima de la zona y produzcan mas leche y haya mas ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 61 years old, married, and has four children.  She has been working for approximately 40 years to provide for their family, with the help of her husband.  Guadalupe makes tamales and bread to sell and also has a mill for grinding boiled corn which has one hopper.  Her husband used to work as a builder in the area.  He also worked as a farm laborer when building work was scarce.  Together with her family, Guadalupe also cares for 5 head of cattle and grows sorghum over 0.7 hectares in order to provide fodder for their cattle and grain for their farmyard birds.  She also grows corn over 1.4 hectares which is used for her family's own consumption and, if the price is right, she sells some in order to cover some household expenses and the cost of cattle fodder.  The area in which she lives has two well defined seasons: a rainy season when she grows basic grains and fodder for the cattle and a dry season when pasture is scarce and dried out.  There is no natural water source for filling water troughs or watering crops.

Guadalupe buys her farm supplies in the city.  She has to catch the only bus that services her community or travel by pick-up truck for 15 kilometers.  Then she has to carry her products on her back until she reaches her farmland with her family and whoever else she hires to do this work because her husband is no longer able to work for health reasons.  Fifteen years ago he suffered an accident on a construction site which left him in a coma.  He lost a large part of his reasoning ability as well as his ability to carry out heavy labor.  Guadalupe is practically the only one who provides income for their household.

Guadalupe will use the loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides and seeds.  She will also pay laborers to farm 0.7 hectares of sorghum and 1.4 hectares of corn.  This loan will allow her to meet the need her family and farmyard birds have for basic grains and provide her cattle with fodder during the dry season.

In the future, Guadalupe hopes to be able to work differently, perhaps with her own capital.  She would like to improve her cattle.  The cows that she has right now are bred for their meat.  By crossing them with a dairy bull she could obtain animals that adapt well to the local climate and produce more milk.  This would make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides and seeds, and to pay laborers to farm 0.7 hectares of sorghum and 1.4 hectares of corn

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen, 36, is the mother of five children, four of whom still count on her, as they are in school. The rest of her family mainly depends on 10 hectares of rice fields which she has managed for ages. She, a third-cycle client, is part of a group of two who are seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and it has returned her a decent income, up to 82,200 KHR a day to support her big household. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. The group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of potash to support her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income so she can earn income to maintain the good living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Roca Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Charlotte mujer de 36 años de edad, acompañada con dos hijos , su negocio es ser costurera y vender cosméticos de la Avon desde hace 15 años en su comunidad ya que es muy reconocida, este crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de cosméticos como cremas faciales, cremas para manos, cremas para pies, cremas para cuerpos, delineadores, máscaras, pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, perfumen de varón, perfumen de damas, colonias para después de afeitar, lociones para hombre etc.Yahaira es una mujer que tiene 34 años y su negocio es la venta de cajetas y Rafaela tiene 38 años de edad y su negocio es tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
This group has three entrepreneurial members.  One of them is Charlotte.  Charlotte is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  She has been working as a seamstress and selling Avon cosmetics in her community for the past 15 years.  She is now very well known.  Charlotte would like to invest this loan in buying cosmetics such as face cream, hand cream, foot cream, body cream, eyeliners, mascara, lipsticks, nail polish, men's and women's perfume, aftershave, men's lotions, etc.

Yahaira is a 34-year-old woman.  Her business is selling soft candies.  Rafaela is 38 years old and her business is a convenience store.

loans.use: to invest in buying cosmetics such as men's and women's perfume, face cream, hand cream, foot cream, body cream, eyeliners, mascara, lipsticks, nail polish, aftershave, men's lotions, etc.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is 58 years old. She lives in a small city, Vanadzor, with her husband. Their two children, a son and a daughter, are married and live separately with their own families. Seda graduated from the Department of Physics in the Vanadzor Pedagogical Institute. Now she works at the school as a teacher of physics while also tutoring one-on-one in the subject. She works at home in separate room. She is doing her work with pleasure and she says that she loves the children very much because dealing with them always keeps her feeling young and hale. 

Seda is asking for a loan of 500.000 AMD to buy a computer and some new physics literature to make her courses more interesting and attractive.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some new physics literature.

loans.name: Estelina

texts.es:
Estelina tiene una edad de 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Su familia por el factor económico no pudieron apoyarla y solo pudo cursar hasta el segundo grado de educación primaria. Fueron sus padres que desde niña le  inculcaron actividades como: oficios domésticos, la agricultura (cultivo de café) y a la comercialización de banano, plátano y otras frutas. En compañía de su compañero de hogar tiene 3 hijos varones: el primero tiene 16 años curso el tercer año de secundaria, el segundo 13 años no estudia y el tercer hijo tiene 3 años. En compañía de su pareja y sus 2 hijos mayores se dedican a elaborar diferentes actividades como: limpia, poda, abona, corta de la cosecha y con la comercialización de banano, plátano y otras frutas. Las tierras que cultivan son obtenidas por herencia.

Actualmente ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, abono y foliares para sus cultivos de café.    

Estelina sueña con ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con un patrimonio más fortalecido capaz de enfrentar las situaciones económicas de una manera favorable mediante el estudio y poder comprar mas tierra para poder cultivar café.
texts.en:
Estelina is 32 years old and the mother of three children.  For financial reasons, Estelina's family were unable to support her and she was only able to study up to the second year of her primary education.  From an early age, her parents taught her to carry out activities such as looking after the house, farming (growing coffee) and selling bananas, plantains and other fruit.  Estelina and her partner have three sons.  Their eldest is 16 years old and in the third year of his secondary education.  Their middle son is 13 and not in school.  Their youngest is 3 years old.  Estelina, her partner and their two eldest sons work weeding, pruning, fertilizing and harvesting their crops.  They also sell bananas, plantains and other fruit.  They inherited the land on which they grow their crops.

Estelina has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to invest in buying fertilizers, compost and foliar fertilizers for her coffee crops.

Estelina dreams of seeing her children enjoy better living conditions and a stronger inheritance.  She hopes to see them able to successfully face difficult financial situations by receiving an education.  She also hopes to buy more land on which to grow coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and foliar fertilizers for her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 5  y 9 años, ambos dependen de ella y no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se  dedica a la venta y elaboración de pupusas, este lo realiza todos los días de 4:00pm a 7:00pm y lo desempeña desde hace 2 años con ayuda de sus hijos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, aceite, repollo,  tomates,  entre otros productos que le servirán para dicha actividad y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Su sueño es brindarles la educación  y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children who are 5 and 9 years old.  They are both dependent on her and she does not have any family members abroad.  María's business is making and selling pupusas.  She works every day, from 4.00pm to 7.00pm, and has been carrying out this work, with the help of her children, for two years.

María is requesting a loan to buy the raw materials she needs such as 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (seasoned shredded pork), corn, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.  This will be helpful to her in her business and allow her to meet customer demand.

María's dream is to provide her children with an education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, seasoned shredded pork, oil, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support three children. She is married and earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Joan requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Joan is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
One of a breadwinner in a family consisting of three kids who are still in school, Phea is 32 years old and a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She manages four hectares of a rice farm as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for several years, and is able to earn up to 14,300 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Phea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid the previous loan with success, and has improved her living conditions in a good place. 

Now she and a joint member are seeking a new loan of 1,300,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor for plowing her farmland. 

She hopes this purchase will help her to grow her rice effectively, and it will sell at a high price so she can triple her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her hand-tractor to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak, a married 35-year-old mother of two children who attend the local public school, is a villager from Banteay Meanchey province. To help support the family, she has been making Cambodia rice cakes for sale for many years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day.

Sopheak has received and repaid six previous loans from Kiva partner VisionFund, loans that have helped provide good living conditions for the family and enabling her to maintain a good cash-flow in her business. Now leading a group of two in this new loan request, Sopheak will spend her portion to buy more ingredients to make her rice cakes including sugar, flour, etc. She hopes that she can increase her income in order to set aside some money to buy more home appliances for her children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make her rice cakes including sugar, flour, etc.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Review Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 29-year-old lady, married with one child. She offers computer services in Kitengela town, as well as  secretarial services such as typing, editing, scanning, and photocopies. She also has a video game and Playstation to offer gaming services to clients. She has been in this business for five years.

This will be her fifth loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy bulk printing paper and files, and install more video games, as well as purchase more Playstations. This will enable her to generate more income which she will use to purchase more printers.

She hopes to expand her business and even open her own cyber cafe.

loans.use: To buy printing paper, video games, and a Playstation.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spices vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her stall.

Santa has been in this business for two years; she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Santa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Maynina

texts.en:
Maynina, a 41-year-old married mother of six children, five of whom are in school, is a very hard-working entrepreneur. For the past two years she has been operating a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

In the future, Maynina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Juling

texts.en:
Juling is 38 years old, married, and they have four children. She is an entrepreneur who buys and sells junk for a profit.  Aside from her junk-selling business, she also makes barbecue sticks to sell.  She offers sticks to nearby barbecue stands.  She wants her business to grow and this is the reason why she is asking for the financial assistance of lenders and borrowing an additional capital of P5,000 to buy more newspapers, empty cans, and bottles to sell. 

Juling is hoping that someday she can have continuous profits and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers, empty cans, and bottles to sell

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin and her family live in the city of Vanadzor, which is in the Lori area. A married mother of a son and a daughter, both married and living separately, Angin is 54 years old and has a vocational education; she graduated from Vanadzor Technical School's Department of Trading.

Nearly 10 years ago, Angin began her own shop selling food and household items including baked goods, sweets and candies, dairy products and eggs, sausages, canned goods, spices, juice, cigarettes, etc. Her husband is unemployed and helps her a great deal, since they obtain the needed products from Yerevan wholesale markets and sometimes from distributors of various companies.

Angin has decided to start selling souvenirs in her shop as well as renew her entire inventory, so she is requesting a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams for the purchases. She hopes for and awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs and renew her shop's inventory

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
Claribel  is 37 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamiz city Mis Occ. She is married with three children. Claribel has a corn production business. She has this business for one year. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn production. 

Claribel has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future Claribel hopes to improve her living conditions and sustain her financial statues to cover their needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn business

loans.name: Sonia Ivonne

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo y su hija la cual tiene 3 años de edad, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, este oficio lo realiza desde hace ocho años y empezó a desempeñarlo por iniciativa propia, ya que necesitaba trabajar para obtener ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar blusas juveniles, blusas para adultos, trajes para niños, camisas sport, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara para incrementar su inventario y satisfacer la clientela.
Su sueño es tener un negocio sostenible y trabajar con capital propio, asimismo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sonia lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter and has no relatives living abroad. She sells new and second hand clothing, a job which she has done for 8 years.  She started out in business on her own initiative, as she needed to work to have an income.  She will use the loan she is applying for to buy children's and women's blouses, children's outfits and sports shirts amongst other things; the injection of funds will help her to increase her stock and satisfy her customers.  Her dream is to have a sustainable business, to work with her own capital and to improve her family's living conditions.
