loans.use: to buy children's and women's blouses, children's outfits and sports shirts amongst other things.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 38 años, tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Julia antes se dedicaba  al cultivo de cacao y café pero para estar cerca a sus hijos decidió abrir un pequeño negocio en la puerta de su casa, donde actualmente vende caramelos, bebidas y otras cosas cerca de un colegio. Hace poco empezó a vender chupetes y otras bebidas heladas gracias a la compra de una refrigeradora con un préstamo anterior y para no descuidar unos terrenos que tiene decidió alquilarlo a otros agricultores y eso también le permite generar ingresos. Uno de sus principales objetivos es abrir una tienda de abarrotes para empezar a comercializar vivieres y obtener mejores ingresos para seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos para que ellos continúen estudiando. Ella considera que la educación de su familia es la mejor inversión que puede hacer. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, se siente contenta por el préstamo que obtuvo, ya que gracias a ello continuará con sus planes de trabajo. Con el monto de S/. 2000 soles comprará productos al por mayor tales como galletas, caramelos, bebidas gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en: Julia is 38 years old. She has three children. They live with her in her own house made of adobe. In the past, Julia farmed cacao and coffee. However, in order to be closer to her children, she decided to open a small business in the door of her home. She currently sells candy, beverages and other items close to a school. Recently, she started to sell icepops and other cold drinks thanks to the purchase of a refrigerator from the previous loan. So that she does not neglect her plots of land, she has decided to rent them to other farmers. This decision also generates earnings. One of her main objectives is to open a grocery store in order to start selling supplies and earn more income. With this, she can continue supporting her children economically and they can continue studying. She considers her family’s education to be the greatest investment she can make.  This is her second loan with Kiva, she is happy about the loan she received. Thanks to the loan, she will continue with her work plans. With the loan amount of 2000 soles, she will purchase wholesale products like cookies, candies, soft drinks and other items.

loans.use: purchase products like cookies and candy for her store.

loans.name: Nelliency

texts.en:
Nelliency is 37 years old, married and a mother of two children. She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last four years. She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her third loan of 100,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add some clothing material for her tailoring business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Nelliency hopes to grow her tailoring shop, as she intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing material for her tailoring  business.

loans.name: Ma. Margie

texts.en:
Ma. Margie is 46 years old, married, and has one child.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Margie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Margie has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Eldivina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Eldivina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Ma. Eldivina is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Eldivina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which produces coffee for export. He has three children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are crops and a personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Income from farming." His biggest challenge is marketing. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Its terms are favorable." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Financial management."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Paul replied, "Improve our livelihood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns poultry and a bicycle, but does not own a cow, pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a friesian cow and milking jerrycans.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 50-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, age 20, 16 and 10 years old. 

She runs a  retail store. She sells items like noodles, shampoo, soaps, biscuits and canned goods. Aside from running a store, she raises hogs. 

Leonida requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store and feed for the pigs, to augment her income. In the future, Leonida would like to expand her both businesses to earn a living and to save for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica runs a boutique business in Kitengela town and has been in this business for five years. She sells women's and children's clothes, shoes and handbags. She is 24 years old, married and has two children.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more clothes, handbags and shoes to sell. She anticipates generating more income with which she will buy more varieties of the above-mentioned items.

She hopes to grow her boutique business and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, handbags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband, for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Angelina is asking for a loan to buy more materials for boat repair like wood, nails and paint. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Angelina dreams of making their business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for boat repair like wood, nails and paint.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca of Poblacion IV, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is a 50-year-old mom with three adult children. For a living she worked as a teacher. Aside from this, she operates a service-based business providing a motorcycle for rent. The rental of her motorcycle helps them pay their monthly bills and other expenses. 

She borrowed a loan of 10,500 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to acquire licenses for her transportation business. She plans to expand her business in order to generate more income for the entire family.

loans.use: to acquire licenses for her transportation business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married with two children who live in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  He owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle rental in the community. He has been a member of GDMPC Micro Credit, and it helps him improve his ability to engage in business and also gain access to microfinance services. 

Recently, he requested a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase tires and spare parts. He hopes to gain more income to support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Artsvik

texts.en:
Artsvik lives with her husband in the village of Artsvanik in the Syunik region. They have three daughters who are married and live separately with their families. Artsvanik has graduated from the college of the food industry and trading in Kapan. 

It has already been 13 years that Artsvanik has her own business, in which her husband helps her very much. She has rented a space for her buffet at the Kajaran Copper Molybdenum Combine. For workers of the combine, it is a very close and convenient place to eat something and to have a rest. 

Artsvik wants to buy a freezer, meat grinder and crockery for her buffet, and she asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams for that purchase. She wants to provide the workers with fresh and tasty dishes, and she hopes for support and assistance from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, meat grinder and crockery

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 54, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and manages her house while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Delia operates a school/office supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase school supplies to expand her product inventory.

Delia dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a vacation. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. 

She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $100. Maria is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos a los que quiere mucho y juntos viven en la casa que heredó de su madre. El trabajo al que se dedica por muchos años es la venta de frutas y comida de manera eventual. Es decir que de acuerdo a la temporada de cosecha de cada fruta comercializa este producto. Cuando existe mucha producción de cítricos los comercializa a la sierra y como la fruta es muy escasa por esta zona, tiene mucha venta y aumenta sus ganancias. Comenta también que en temporadas de festivas vende comida en las plazas de los diversos pueblos de la zona, por lo que también es un ingreso adicional. Ahora espera poder comprar mucha fruta con el capital adquirido pues este año las frutas están escasas y a ella le conviene aumentar el precio de venta de sus frutos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA. Agradece el apoyo recibido, pues de esta manera podrá progresar en su negocio y mejorar en sus ingresos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Margarita invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de frutas variadas para su negocio.
texts.en: Margarita, who is 34, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and 3 children, whom she loves very much, in the house which she inherited from her mother.  She has worked for many years selling fruit and food on a casual basis, when each fruit is in season.  When there is a glut of citrus fruits, she sells them in the mountains and, as they are very rare in that area, sales are good and she increases her earnings.  She also says that, during holiday periods, she sells food in various town squares around the area, which also provides additional income. She now hopes to buy a large amount of fruit with the capital obtained, but fruit is scarce this year and she has to increase the selling price of her goods.  This is her first loan with KIVA. She is grateful for the help, as it will enable her to make progress with her business and improve her income.  Furthermore, she promises to make her repayments punctually.  Margarita will invest the S/.1500 soles in the purchase of  a variety of fruit for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him is 46 years old and lives in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She is married with four children. Three of them are her burden, while the oldest works in a garment factory to help cover the family expenses. To help her husband earn income, she has had a grocery store business for more than one year, generating a net profit of $3.00 per day. 

She is now requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her store, as the increase will lead to better sales. In the future, she hopes to save for expanding her store, increase the inventory, and thereby, earn more income to satisfy her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Neceria

texts.en:
Neceria is married with six children who are school-aged. Neceria is 40 years old and lives in Minalulan, Maria, Siquijor. 

Neceria sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, vegetables and meat. 

Neceria is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Neceria hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 47 years old and has a clothes business in Emali town. He also supplies textile materials to various tailors within his area. He is married to Esther, and together they have two children.

This will be his eighth loan term with KADET LTD., and he plans to buy more stock of clothes for selling. These include shirts, trousers and sweaters. He also plans to buy more stock of textile materials to supply his tailoring customers. He will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to grow his business and become a successful businessman and hence, make more income and be able to provide for his family as well as ensure his children get a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes and textile materials for selling.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is 45 years old, married and a mother of two children. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Mpeketoni, Lamu. 

She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). Racheal was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer, and is applying for her fourth loan of 40,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on, to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to grow her business and sustain her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling her farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Grace was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and she is applying for her sixth loan of KES 50,000, to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for her business. She will use the profits made through this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her farming activities. 

Grace's goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Hagie

texts.en:
Hagie lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 34-year-old mother with three children. 

For a living, she owns and manages a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale and family consumption. 

In order to buy seedlings and manure fertilizer, she borrowed a loan of 5,700 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, of which she has been a member since 2008. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
As a 27-year-old father of one child, Paul  provides a service-based business offering motor transportation in the local community of Poblacion IV, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He also operates his farm of rice for consumption and he sells a portion of it. 

In order to obtain finances for land preparation and to buy fertilizer, he borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), which he had joined last year. 

He plans to save a portion of his profit for the future of his child and for the entire family, as well.

loans.use: to obtain finances for land preparation and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old and the father of a single child. Ali is the only provider in his family.

Ali owns a small shop where he sells sandals and shoes. Since 2008, this business has been the source of living for Ali and his family. Now, after studying the market and searching for the best suppliers, Ali has become well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices and the good quality of his shoes.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 USD in order to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take better care of his family and provide for all of their needs.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his shop

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy additional supplies for her restaurant, including meat and vegetables. She started her restaurant in 2008, and has been earning a good income from it. Manuela is happy with the loan that she is taking. She wants to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her restaurant, including meat  and vegetables.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio is a 48-year-old married man with 12 children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in agriculture for 20 years and with the proceeds he has been able to start a retail shop to help him in meeting daily expenses for the family. He dreams of becoming a model farmer, but pests and diseases plus bad weather are his challenges. 

Donozio will use the loan to buy oranges, maize and sugar cane for planting.

loans.use: to buy oranges, maize and sugar cane for planting.

loans.name: Siloe Group

texts.es: Formado por tres emprendedoras una de ellas es Claudia mujer casada, dos hijos, desde hace 5 años se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio quien lo comercializa en su domicilio y  ambulante, el objetivo de este préstamo es para la compra de cerdos en pie. Flora es otra socia tiene 43 años de edad y su negocio es el destace de cerdo también y Rafaela tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es  la venta de fritanga.
texts.en:
[The group] is made up of three entrepreneurs. One of them is Claudia, a married woman with two children. For five years, she has been butchering pigs in her house and selling the meat from her house and on the street. The objective of this loan is to buy live pigs.

Flora is another partner. She is 43 years old and her business is also butchering pigs.

Rafaela is 50 years old and her business is selling fried food.

loans.use: to buy live pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 24 years old and blessed with two young children. 

Her husband operates their tricycle business, providing transport services in their village. They usually earn PHP 300 a day and carefully budget for their daily expenses at home.  

She wants to maintain safe travel for their passengers, and this is the reason why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and provide the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Rosalina is hoping that someday she can have better income and save profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and provide the maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a single mom from Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She lives with her parent. In order to support her needs, she manages a plot of garden from a portion of their land, planting a variety of vegetables for sale. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012 and recently borrowed a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer such as manure, and pay for farm maintenance costs. She saves a portion of her income to finance her child’s education in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a responsible and diligent wife and mother to her four children. She is selling grocery items in their village, and is glad that she earns a daily income of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos). Her desire to provide good service to her customers made her borrow a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, basic commodities and school supplies such as papers, pens and crayons to sell in her store. 

With good products and services, Visitacion believes that she will earn more profits and have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, basic commodities and school supplies.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is a young farmer who lives in Kapan with his wife, small son, sister and parents. Aram has no higher education and he is fully engaged in farming and agriculture. Aram’s father is a builder and very often he is hired for different building works and he cannot help his son around their farm, but Aram’s wife and mother help him very much. 

Aram has a plot of land on which he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes and greens. He also has apple and apricots trees. Aram breeds chickens as well and selling eggs and chickens also brings good income to his family. All these products he sells to his loyal customer that buy right from his house.
 
Aram has seriously decided to be involved in chicken breeding and he asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of chickens and food for them and also some seedlings of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a lot of chickens and food for them and also some seedlings of vegetables.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a farmer who lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. She has eight children and has been doing this work for 22 years. Her primary income sources are crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Making profits."  Her biggest challenge is "General management of all activities." An animal on the farm has been given the name of "Mumo."

Sera was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Favourable terms to farmers."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Assists smallholder farmers to improve their livelihood."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Sera replied, "Income will help to cater for family expenses."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sera owns a cow but does not own pigs, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Carlos Felipe

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es agricultor de toda la vida y se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado desde hace muchos años. Oficios que aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes inculcaron en él valores morales y sirvieron de ejemplo para que fuera un hombre con buenos principios.


El  préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro terneros e insumos para su nutrición y salud. El préstamo le permitirá, mejorar sus condiciones económicas, puesto que una vez desarrollado los terneros, procederá a venderlos. Obteniendo un mayor ingreso por el que ha adquirido en un principio a los animales.

Desea, aspirar a criar mayor cantidad de ganado, para cumplir uno de sus sueños, el cual es tener una casa nueva. Así mismo, espera contar con instalaciones pecuarias donde poder criar sus animales.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 46, is married with two children.  He has been a farmer all his life, breeding cattle for many years.  He learned his trade from his parents who instilled moral values in him and set an example which he followed in becoming a man of good moral character.


The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo will be used to buy four calves and supplies of nutritional and health products.  It will also enable him to improve his financial situation because the calves will be sold once they are fully developed and he will earn more than he initially paid for the animals.

His aim is to breed more cattle so that he can achieve one of his dreams: to have a new house.  At the same time, he hopes to have cattle facilities where he can raise his animals.

loans.use: to buy four calves and supplies of nutritional and health products.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa tiene  28 años, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijos en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. 
Marisa se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven. Cuando se divorcio, necesitaba estar más tiempo con sus hijos y fue así que decidió dejar temporalmente el campo para poner un pequeño negocio donde vendía algunas bebidas heladas y le fue muy bien para empezar. Lo que más le agrada de su negocio es que tiene mucha empatía con sus clientes y esto ha vuelto su tienda bien popular con sus clientes leales. Hace poco tiempo vio por conveniente poner un negocio más grande como una tienda de productos comestibles para seguir generando ingresos en beneficio de sus hijos. Su principal objetivo a largo plazo es construir su casa con material noble y poner otro negocio más grande para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Este es el préstamo tercero préstamo que tiene con KIVA, agradece por la confianza que le brindan y espera seguir cumpliendo responsable mente con la devolución del dinero. Con el monto de 4,000 nuevos soles comprara mercadería  al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, cereales, conservas, gaseosas y otros.
texts.en:
Marisa is 28 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her kids in her own home which is built from adobe.

Marisa worked in agriculture from a very young age.  When she got divorced, she needed to spend more time with her children and so decided to temporarily quit the fields and set up a small business selling cold drinks.  Things went very well.  What Marisa likes most about her business is that she sympathizes a lot with her customers and this has made her store very popular and gained her loyal customers.  A little while ago, she saw that it would be a good idea to set up a larger business, such as a grocery store, so that she could continue making income for her children's benefit.  Her main, long-term goal is to build her home from solid, long-lasting materials and to set up an even larger business so that she can support her children's education.

This is Marisa's third loan from Kiva.  She is grateful for the trust that they are placing in her and hopes to continue making her loan repayments in a responsible manner.  Marisa will use the 4,000 soles she has requested to buy merchandise wholesale such as rice, sugar, cereals, canned food, soda, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, etc. for her store

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Doña Mirian tiene 41 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos que están en primaria cursando diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Ella en compañía de su esposo se dedica particular mente a la producción de café ya que esta actividad ha sido tradición en su familia y en la de su pareja. Ella también cultiva granos básicos como ser arroz, maíz y frijoles. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a una distancia de 30 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada en vehículo.

Ella ha solicitado a la Cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de urea, fertilizantes y abono para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.   

Sus planes y metas es con el tiempo poder tecnificar la zona de su cultivo, facilitándole más el mantenimiento, corte entre otros que son necesario para poderla asistir de una mejor forma. Sus sueños son los de apoyar a sus hijos hasta verlos graduados a nivel superior para que tengan una base y puedan desenvolverse como a ellos mejor les convenga para su bienestar y el de sus familias.
texts.en:
Mirian is 41 years old and is married with two children, who are in different years at primary school. She completed primary education thanks to the support she was given by her parents. Her, with her husband, makes a living growing coffee because this activity is a tradition of her and her husband's family . She also grows basic grains such as rice, corn, and beans. Her coffee crops are located 30km from her home, and she travels to them by vehicle. 

She has requested a loan from Cooperativa COMIXMUL to buy urea, fertiliser and compost to support and maintain her coffee plants.

Her plans and goals are to be able to introduce technology to her plot of land over time, making it easier to maintain and cut crops among other activities that are necessary to help them better. Her dreams are to support her children until they graduate at a higher level so that they have a stable base and develop in the way they want for their and their families wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy urea, fertiliser and compost for her coffee crop.

loans.name: G.s Abrahan Zuniga Group

texts.es:
La señora Kelyn de 25 años, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación en una colonia, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta  de camisas, faldas, vestidos, sandalias, capris, camisas de hombre, camisas de mujer, ropa de niños de todo tipo, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo y lo realiza de manera de ambulante.
La señora Kelyn está el préstamo para comprar de fardos de ropa de faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc. para así poder tener más mercadería que poder ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan a diario  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretender aumentar más sus ingresos y hacer más grande su negocio
La señora Kelyn su sueño es poder mejorar su casa de habitación.
Doña Kelyn al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera que la inversión que realice en su negocio les ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y las de su familia 
Doña Sara se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales que vende de lunes a domingo y lo realiza solo por encargo.
Doña Wendy se dedica a la venta de ropa en general de adulto y de niño.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Señora Kelyn is 25 years old ,and lives with her husband in her home in a community in the south of Honduras. For five years, she has made a living selling shirts, skirts, dresses, sandals, tops, blouses, and children's clothing. She goes out and sells these items in the street from Mondays to Sundays.

Señora Kelyn needs the loan to buy clothing such as skirts, dresses, trousers, shirts, blouses etc. so that she has more stock that she can offer to customers who visit her every day. With the help of this loan, she hopes to boost her earnings and expand her business.

Kelyn's dream is to improve her home. Like her colleagues in the group, she hopes that the investment she makes with help her to improve her and her family's quality of life a little. 

Sara makes a living selling tortillas and tamales, traditional local foods, which she makes to order and sells from Monday to Sunday.
Wendy makes a living selling adult's and children's clothing.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, trousers, shirts, blouses, etc. for their business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: In a village of Sebasi, in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Myrna lives with her big family. She helps her husband manage their own farm of corn for a living. She has been doing this for years and it helps a lot to support the basic needs of the family. She requests a loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to generate additional income in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
Wilian,  requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita  más capital de trabajo para incrementar en su producción y obtener mayores ingresos; este le permitirá reparar galera para albergar los pollos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mantener el trabajo y obtuvo ingresos para los gastos familiares; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Wilian has decided to request a new loan because he needs more working capital to increase his production and boost his earnings. This will allow him to repair the hen house for his chickens.
His previous loan helped him to keep working and make money to pay household expenses. His economic circumstances and family situation have remained stable.

loans.use: to repair the hen house for his chickens.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 28-year-old, married man with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for 12 years and he sells cassava flour as an additional income source. 

He hopes to become a great businessman, owning a food store in town which can continuously supply his customers all year round, despite bad debtors. 

Timothy will use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for five years as well as farming to gain additional income. He hopes to expand his business to new areas, but high competition and transport costs are his challenges. John is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 16 colonies of bees

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una joven de 29 años de edad madre de 2 hijos los cuales el mayor esta primaria y el ultimo con 8 meses de nacido. En compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 5 años siendo ellos 2 los únicos involucrados en las diferentes actividades del campo como ser: Limpia, Poda, abona y Fertilización de las plantas de café. La tierra que cultivan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada en la misma área donde ellos habitan por lo cual se les hace más fácil la asistencia técnica de sus cultivos. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que en la temporada llegan a la zona para la adquisición del producto.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café ya que no ser tratado a tiempo es probable que se llene de bichos que deterioran el producto.  

Sus planes y metas son poder asistir a sus cultivos para evitar que la plantación se dañe y poder obtener una excelente cosecha la cual se pueda aprovechar al máximo sin dejar nada. Sus sueños son darles una excelente educación a sus hijos y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is a young, 29-year-old woman and the mother of two children; the oldest is in primary school and the youngest is 8 months old.  Together with her life partner, she has made a living through agriculture for more than five years.  The two of them are alone involved in carrying out all the different work in the fields, like: cleaning, pruning, composting, and fertilizing the coffee plants.  The land that they cultivate is their own, thanks in part to inheriting it from her parents.  It is located in the same area where they live, which makes it much easier to look after their crops.  Her customers are different buyers who come to the area during the season to acquire the product.

She has asked COMIXMUL for a loan to buy agricultural supplies for maintaining and taking care of her coffee crops because if they are not treated in time it is likely that they will become full of bugs that will deteriorate the product.  Her plans and goals are to be able to tend to her crops to prevent the plants from getting damaged, and to get an excellent harvest that she could take the maximum advantage of without leaving anything behind.  Her dreams are to provide excellent education for her children and to be able to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining and taking care of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 57 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos y 3 nietos; en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Hace 6 años enviudó y esto trajo muchas dificultades, una de ellas es cuidar de su hija mayor que es minusválida, pues no puede caminar, pero esto la motiva mucho más y trabaja con ahínco para seguir con su negocio propio y de esa manera solventar su economía. María tiene un restaurante en la plaza de su zona, ahí los turistas y la población la visitan con frecuencia, pues saben de la exquisita sazón de María. Pero como ella es una mujer del campo, también siembra maíz y papa en grandes cantidades, los cuales realiza en terrenos agrícolas alquilados, pues no cuenta con unos propios. Este es su tercer crédito con kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
María, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de ingredientes como carnes, verduras , condimentos y utensilios para su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 57, is an admirable woman. She lives together with her three children and three grandchildren in a house she bought 20 years ago. Six years ago, María became a widow. Since then she has had difficult times, such as having to take care on her own of her handicapped daughter, who cannot walk. However, this motivates her to work harder and she does in order to get ahead with her business and improve her financial situation. 

María owns a restaurant located in a square close to where she lives. There, tourists and locals visit her frequently, looking for her delicious foods.  Since María comes from the countryside, she also grows corn and potatoes in large quantities. She has to rent some land because she does not own any.

This is María’s third loan with Kiva. She feels grateful for the financial help she has received. She promises to pay the installments on time. With the 2,500 soles [PEN], María will buy ingredients such as different types of meat, vegetables, condiments and some utensils for her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a 41-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling produce alongside, taking market tenders to collect market dues. He has a vision of establishing a bigger farm although he faces challenges of defaulters and diseases that attack his crops and cows. Clovice is requesting a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation and farm by buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation and farm by buying fertilizers.

loans.name: Franklin Yovani

texts.es:
Franklin tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero. Es un joven que se dedica a la agricultura desde los 8 años, su papá le enseño a cultivar la tierra desde muy pequeño junto con sus hermanos.
Franklin trabaja su milpa y trabaja como jornal para otras personas de la zona, que le pagan $40 dólares la quincena, que serian como $2.66 dólares diarios;  no posee terreno para cultivar, tiene que alquilar para cultivar. Aun con todas estas limitantes el joven no pierde los deseos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el y de su familia.
Con lo poco que gana como jornal y algunos ahorros de ingresos por venta de excedentes de cosecha, pudo comprar una vaca, la cual le ha dado 3 mas, a la fecha ya cuenta con 4 vacas, lo cual lo ha motivado a poder mejorar a través de la crianza y engorde de ganado.

Compra sus insumos y materiales cerca de donde vive a 7 kilómetros; pero tiene que pagar el traslado de estos en camión. Él tiene una carreta  pero todavía no tiene bueyes para  tirar de ella.

  El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 terneros para criarlos y engordarlos y en un futuro venderlos obteniendo un margen de ganancia. Aprovechara la época lluviosa, por que hay abundancia de pasto y es mas fácil mantener y engordar el ganado para su futura venta.

El préstamo le ayudara a tener alternativas  para la obtención de ingresos  para llevar a cabo su actividad productiva, permitiéndole mejorar su acceso a los servicios básicos.

Su deseo es poseer su terreno propio, para cultivar y repastar ganado,  que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin is 25 years old and he is single.  He is a young man that has worked in agriculture for the past 8 years.  His father taught him how to cultivate the land when he was very young, along with his brothers.

Franklin works in his father's maize field and he also works for small wages for other people in the region.  They pay him 40 dollars every two weeks, which works out to about $2.66 dollars per day.  He doesn't own his own land to cultivate, and so he needs to rent the land.  Even with all of these limitations, he has not lost sight of his dream of improving the living conditions of his family.

With the little money that he earns in wages, and with his savings from the sale of surplus items from his harvest, he was able to buy a cow, which has given him three more and he now has four cows. This has motivated him to improve his family's situation by breeding and fattening cows.

He buys his supplies and materials about 7 kilometers from his home, but he has to pay to transfer the items by truck.  He has a wagon but does not have any ox to pull it.

The loan that he is seeking from Fundacion Campo is so that he can purchase three calves and breed them, fatten them up, and in the future sell them to turn a profit.  He is taking advantage of the rainy season because there is an abundance of grass, which makes it easier to take care of and fatten up the calves for a future sale.

This loan will give him alternatives to making an income, to carry out his agricultural activities, and permit him to improve his access to basic services.

His dream is to have his own land, cultivate it, and make money so that he can provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy three calves so that he can breed them, fatten them up, and in the future sell them and turn a profit.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es:
José tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Proviene de una familia numerosa de 11 integrantes incluyendo sus dos padres vivían en casa ajena. Él a su corta edad de 10 años ya trabaja la agricultura por su propia cuenta y también jornaleaba cuidando animales ajenos ayudaba a su familia; ya que su padre no colaboraba mucho para la familia, sus 4 hermanos quienes 2 de ellos murieron muy jóvenes por la misma pobreza no se tenían los recursos para el tratamiento que  ameritaban, con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sus 15 años logro comprar un pequeño terrenito pagándolo y esperaba hacer su propia casa para llevar a su familia, pero por no tener el apoyo de un adulto no pudo arreglar el terreno a su nombre y se lo quito el anterior dueño, pero siempre su ilusión era comprar su propio terreno y a sus 20 años se caso y también logro comprar con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo un pequeño terreno donde a podido criar y darle el mejor conocimiento en el trabajo a sus hijos.

Él compra sus insumos agrícolas en un pueblo que esta a 1 kilómetro de su casa; luego los traslada a su vivienda, para después llevarlos al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos que esta a un kilómetro de su casa y los traslada en carreta.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de yuca. Manifiesta que siempre tiene la fuerza suficiente para valerse a si mismo y trabajar para su vejez.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old, is married and has 5 children.  He comes from a large family of 11 members, including his two parents that lived in an nearby house.  When he was 10 years old he worked in agriculture on his own and also cared for someone else's animals daily, helping his family.  Since his father didn't contribute to the the family much, two of his four siblings died very young due to poverty because they did not have the resources they deserved.  With a lot of effort and work, when he was 15 yeas old he was able to buy a small piece of land, paying for it and hoping to build his own home to bring his family to.  But, since he did not have the support of an adult he couldn't keep the land and the previous owner took it back, but his dream was to buy his own land.  When he was 20 he got married and was able to buy a small piece of land with much work and effort where he has been able to share his knowledge of his work with his children.

He buys his agricultural inputs in a small town that is 1 kilometer from his house. Then he travels to his home to later bring them to the land where his crops are, which is a kilometer from his home and he travels there in a cart.

The loan is requested through Fundación Campo, and is to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to cultivate 21,000 square meters of yucca.  He expresses that he always has sufficient strength to give the same effort and work in his old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to cultivate 21,000 square meters of yucca.

loans.name: Isabe

texts.es: Isabe, de 26 años es una madre responsable. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en casa de sus suegros desde hace 5 años.Isabe se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de maíz, papa, alfalfa y habas, los que realizan en terrenos agrícolas heredados por sus padres, “eso me permite ahorrar mucho sobre todo la alfalfa que me sirve de alimento para mis animales”, afirma. Ahora planean comprar su casa propia, saben que con trabajo y ahorro lo lograrán. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo financiero necesario para seguir adelante con su actividad agrícola. Isabe, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Isabe is 26 years old and she is a responsible mother.  She lives with Juan, her husband of 7 years.  Together they have two children who they have cared for in the home of her in-laws for the past 5 years.  Isabe works in agriculture - in growing corn, alfalfa and lima beans.  She started working in agriculture because she inherited land from her parents.  She says, "This has enabled me to save a lot.  The alfalfa has especially helped because I feed it to the animals."  

She now plans to buy her own home, and with her work and her savings, she knows she can do it.  This is her third Kiva loan and she feels happy to receive the financial support she needs to get ahead in her agricultural work.  Isabe will invest 1500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her next alfalfa planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 20 años es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Deyvid, todavía no tienen hijos y juntos viven en la casa de su abuelo. Desde los 14 años emprendió el negocio de compra y venta de ganados. Comenta que desde entonces aprendió a mejorar la habilidad que tiene para la negociación es por esa razón que espera con muchas ansias poder comprar su propia casa para así comenzar el proceso de crianza de los animales. Pues su trabajo en la actualidad se centra en la compra de animales como ovejas, vacas, cerdos entre otros. Los mismos que comercializa en las ferias ganaderas de distintas ciudades cercanas a su localidad. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida con el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ovejas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Twenty year old Ana is a simple and hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Deyvid in his grandfather's house. They don't have any children yet.

At the age of 14 she started a business buying and selling cattle. She notes that since then she has learned to improve her negotiation skills. This is why she is anxiously looking forward to being able to buy her own house and begin the process of raising animals. 

Currently, her work is centred on purchasing animals like sheep, cows, pigs etc. She then sells them in livestock markets in different cities near her town. 

This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the economic support she has received. She promises to make her payments punctually. Ana will use the money to purchase sheep to supply her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a  21-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children ages 7, 5 and 2 respectively. He engages in a buying and selling business. 

He sells kitchenwares, floor mats, blankets, and mosquito nets. He has been into the buying and selling business for more than three years now. 

Jeffrey requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more blankets and kitchenwares to sell, to continue to earn a living. Jeffrey would like to expand his buying and selling business to save money to finance the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and kitchenwares to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs to maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-year-old married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a general store for two years, as well as doing some farming for additional income. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a wholesale shop, but a lack of capital is his major challenge. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 61 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, dos hembras y dos varones.  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 15 años, a sus 61 años de vida, sigue manteniendo y sustentando su familia a través de esta actividad. Su papá le enseño junto con sus cuatro hermanos, las técnicas de cultivar la tierra. En la zona donde vive, la mayoría de la población se dedica a las actividades agrícolas.
Don Julio tiene su parcela muy cerca de su  pequeña casa, lo cual le permite ir  a trabajar  en la mañana y un rato en la tarde. Además, de dedicarse a la siembra de granos básicos, suelen subir a la montaña a recoger leña la cual venden para obtener pequeños ingresos extras.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes y plaguicidas para su cultivo de maíz y controlar las plagas para tener una buena producción. Lo que pretende es, tener el sustento de su familia y obtener ingresos de la venta de los excedentes que les permitan cubrir otras necesidades básicas.

Don Julio ve el acceso a créditos en Fundación  Campo, como una oportunidad de concretizar sus ideas de negocio; En un futuro piensa sacar un crédito que le permita comprar un molino de una tolva, ya que  en el cantón hay mucha demanda de este servicio.
texts.en:
Julio is 61 years old and he has four children - two girls and two boys.  He has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old.  Now at 61, he continues caring for and supporting his family via this activity.  His father taught him, along with his four brothers, the technical aspects of cultivating the land.  In the region in which he lives, the majority of the population works in agriculture.

Julio has a parcel of land very close to his small home, which enables him to work in the mornings and a bit in the afternoon. More than just growing basic grains, he also typically climbs the mountain to collect fire wood and then sells it to earn extra income.

The loan he is seeking from Fundacion Campo is so that he can buy fertilizers and pesticides for the cultivation of maize and so that he can control the pests for a good harvest.  He aims to support his family and make a bigger income from the sale of any surpluses after he has met his family's basic needs.

Julio saw the access to loan from Fundacion Campo as an opportunity to make his business ideas come to life.  In the future he is thinking about asking for a loan so that he can buy a mill hopper, because in his county there are is already demand for this service.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating his maize - and to control pests for a good harvest.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt:
A Gilda é casada e vive na casa própria com 2 filhos com 7 e 14 anos na 1ª e 7ª classes.
É negociante de bidões (depósitos de água) e vende quase todos os dias em sua casa. O dinheiro do empréstimo pretende aplicar na compra de bidões para revenda. Gilda tem a esperança de continuar com o seu negócio e pedir mais empréstimos para aumentar o volume da mercadoria existente.
texts.en: Gilda is married and lives in her own home with two children, 7 and 14 years old, who attend school. She sells water jugs almost every day from her house. She will use this loan to buy jugs of water to sell. Gilda hopes to keep running her business and request further loans to expand the amount of stock she carries.

loans.use: to buy water jugs to resell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.pt:
Clara é casada e possui 5 filhos e 2 netos que andam na 3ª e 5ª classes respectivamente.
	A Clara tem um negócio de revenda de açúcar, lenha e ração para animais, assim como de venda de bebidas tradicionais que prepara em sua casa. Ela pratica todo o seu negócio em sua casa. O valor do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos para revender, como açúcar, ração e lenha.
	A cliente diz que tem sonhos de ampliar o seu negócio uma vez que é a base da sobrevivência. O principal desafio é manter o seu negócio, que vem fazendo desde muito tempo.
texts.en: Clara is married and has five children and two grandchildren in the third and fifth grades. Clara has a business selling sugar, firewood, and animal feed, as well as traditional beverages that she prepares in her home. She runs the whole business from her house. The loan will be used to buy products for her business such as sugar, feed, and firewood. Clara says that she dreams of expanding her business since it’s the way she makes a living. Her main challenge is to keep her business going, which she has been doing for a long time.

loans.use: to buy products to resell such as sugar, animal feed, and firewood.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Fatima tem 46 anos de idade e é solteira. Tem 4 filhos, 2 com idade escolar e os outros 2 já independentes. Sustenta também 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Ela é negociante há mais de 25 anos e vende roupa no mercado. O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de um fardo de camisolas e sapatos para vender.      
O seu sonho é concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família e mobilá-la
texts.en: Fatima is 46 years old and unmarried. She has four children, two of whom are still in school and two of whom are adults. She also supports two nephews who live with her. She has had her own business for more than 25 years selling clothing in the market. She will use this loan to buy a bale of nightgowns and shoes to sell. Her dream is to finish and furnish her house so she can offer her family greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy a bale of nightgowns and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 58 years old and is separated. She lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she owns and manages a rice farm, planting rice for sale and family consumption. She joined GDMPC in 2012 to gain access to micro finance services. Recently, she took out a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. She will use the income generated from her farming to finance the costs of her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not been working properly for many days, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Mumtaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Mumtaz is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Luz Ángela

texts.es: Luz Ángela Morales es una señora de 52 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, ya que montó su restaurante con las utilidades que le ha dejado el taller de confección que se encuentra ubicado en su casa y, con el cual le brinda empleo a otras personas del sector. El crédito lo solicita para comprar una nevera para el restaurante ya que la que tenía se le dañó y se está viendo afectada su rentabilidad debido a que se le dañan los productos. Su mayor sueño es hacer que su negocio crezca y perdure en el tiempo y poder comprar el local donde se encuentra ubicado actualmente.
texts.en: Luz Ángela Morales, who is 52, is married but has no children.  A determined and enterprising woman, she set up her restaurant with the profits from the home dressmaking workshop in which she employs other local people.  She is applying for a loan to buy a fridge for the restaurant since the one she had got damaged, causing the contents to be spoiled and her profitability affected.  Her greatest ambition is to see her business grow and survive over time and to buy the premises where her restaurant is currently located.

loans.use: to buy a fixed asset ( a fridge)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, beverages and assorted bread to sell

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor este año empezó la escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Ana realiza el crédito para su esposo, el tiene un tanquero de agua que surte a ciertas empresas y fabricas en la ciudad de Manta, realiza varios viajes al día ya que en estos lugares requieren mucho de este liquido vital para poder trabajar, el recibe el pago semanal por la venta del agua, por lo cual requiere de capital para seguir trabajando, el lleva más de 14 años dedicado a esta labor que les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar agua y  combustibles para seguir trabajando. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y fáciles de pagar.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
En Los Bajos de Montecristio, a city known for its great diversity of typical products (for example, the straw "Panama hat" well-known both inside Ecuador and abroad), there is a meeting every 15 days with the members of the group called Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

This is where Ana lives.  She is 44 years old, she is married, and from this marriage she has two children, who are 16 and 6 years old.  The oldest child studies in high school and the younger one began going to school this year.  Her husband is a chauffeur.

Ana is taking out this loan for her husband.  He runs a water tank that supplies businesses and factories with water in the city of Manta.  He makes many trips per day to the various locations and it requires a lot of fuel.  He gets a small weekly payment for the sale of the water, which is then used to invest in the business and continue working.  He has worked in this job for over 14 years and it has enabled him to get ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of water and fuel so that he can continue working.  This is the fourth loan with Banco Comunal and she likes working with the bank because they are quick to help and it's easy to pay.

Their dreams are to continue getting ahead and to provide their children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy water and fuel.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 61 years old, has a clothes business in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for five years. Mary has four grown children.

This being her second loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), Mary plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of clothes. These include shirts, blouses, and skirts, as well as textile materials. She will use the anticipated income to continue increasing her stock, hence expanding her business.

Mary hopes to grow her business in the near future by opening a boutique and providing  a variety of products to meet different clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Noneta

texts.en:
Ma. Noneta is 52 years old, married and has 6 children, two of whom are in school.

Ma. Noneta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Noneta requested a 12,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Noneta has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Noneta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rossana Maribel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por El Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Rossana,  tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 9 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Rossana además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa estudia Ing. Civil en  una universidad de Manta, ella para poder solventar los gastos que generan sus estudios y al ver que a su esposo no le alcanzaba para los gastos decidió emprender un negocio, vende zapatos y sandalias de puerta a puerta por su localidad y también les vende a sus compañeras de la universidad donde estudia. Deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 4 años en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias. Lleva más de cuatro  años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres por el Progreso' community bank meet in lower Montecristi.  Montecristi is a city which is known for its diversity of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hat which is well known both in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where Rossana lives.  Rossana is 29 years old, married, and has a 9-year-old son from her relationship.  Her son attends school and her husband works in a factory in Manta.

In addition to being a very good mother and wife, Rossana also studies civil engineering at a university in Manta.  In order to cover the cost of her studies and seeing that her husband was not able to meet these expenses, she decided to set up a business selling shoes and sandals door to door in her town.  She also sells to her fellow students at university.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been running her business for four years.

Rossana will use this loan to buy shoes and sandals.  She has been a member of her community bank for more than four years and likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.

Rossana's dreams are to complete her studies and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: Akouwa Kpatagnon

texts.fr: Femme de 34 ans, Akouwa est mariée à un comptable et mère de famille. Revendeuse de pagnes, elle s’approvisionne à LOME. Elle a mis cette activité en place depuis 2009 et maitrise bien ce qu’elle fait. Ce troisième prêt lui servira à acheter beaucoup plus d’articles pour élargir sa clientèle. Elle espère avoir une boutique car elle vend de façon ambulante et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en: Akouwa is a 34-year old woman, married with children. Her husband is an accountant. She sells traditional "pagnes" fabric, stocking up on Lome. She has been in this business in 2009 and manages it well. This third loan will allow her to buy many additional items in order to grow her customer base.  Her hope is to open a store, as  she currently works as a street vendor, and provide for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. She is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for five years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardships are inadequate capital to meet the high demand, price fluctuations, and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home and her business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into new markets. Oliver is requesting money to buy sugar, salt, soap and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap,soda and  cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Neang is 40 years old and a mother of four children. Currently, only two kids are under her care as they are in school. She grows rice on seven hectares and it has returned her about 28,600 Riels (KHR) per day. 

With this new loan, Neang is the fourth-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She feels confident that she can sustain her lifestyle, making good progress from the past loans that she has fully repaid. She and a co-borrower, in the same group of two, are seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can boost her crop yield greater than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Abdul Kazem

texts.en: Abdul Kazem is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, has two children and is his family's sole provider. He earns a living by running a small shop where he specializes in repairing generators. He also repairs other electronic items such as refrigerators, air conditioners and washing machines. He has been in this business since 2005 and has good experience in this field. Thanks to this experience, he is well-known in his neighborhood and has an excellent reputation. He is requesting a loan for $2,400 to renovate his workplace and install a sign on his shop. His aim is to grow his business and increase his profits so that he can educate his children and provide them with a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his workplace and install a sign on his shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan for $1,000 to improve her business. She earns a good living by selling firewood because she lives and does her selling in a town that is near a large road. She opened her business two years ago with only $100 in working capital, but is now doing well and has customers every day.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Курбонби молодая незамужняя девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она  живет с родителями в районе Хамадони. Ее мать домохозяйка, а отец и брат уехали на заработки в Россию. У Курбонби среднее образование. Она трудолюбивая и отзывчивая девушка. Курбонби занимается животноводством. Ей было 16 лет, когда она начала свой бизнес. Курбонби разводит крупнорогатый скот уже 10 лет и любит сове дело, так как приносит ей хорошую прибыль. Курбонби просит кредит для закупа коров и телят. Она хочет расширить деятельность и за счет дохода планирует отремонтировать родительский дом.
texts.en: Qurbonbi is a young single woman.  She is 26 years old.  She lives with her parents in the Hamadoni district.  Her mother is a homemaker, and father and brother left to work in Russia.  Qurbonbi has a secondary education.  She is a hardworking and responsive young woman.  Qurbonbi is involved in animal husbandry.  She was 16 years old when she started her own business.  Qurbonbi has been breeding cattle for ten years and loves her business because it brings her a good profit.  Qurbonbi is requesting this loan to buy cows and calves.  She wants to expand her business and use the income to repair her parents' home.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves

loans.name: Fátima Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Fatima es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar por su cuenta su propio dinero por eso hace cuatro años atrás con la ayuda de su marido y reuniendo todos sus ahorros surtió una pequeña farmacia en su casa, la misma que con el paso del tiempo ha ido aumentando poco a poco y mucho mas desde que recibe los créditos del banco comunal, allí además de medicamentos ella también vende helados, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta la noche. 

Este crédito es para comprar medicinas para surtir más su negocio. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucho cuando necesita surtir su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener una gran farmacia y poder ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products such as, for example, the "Panama Hats" made of woven straw that are famous both inside and outside of the country, the communal bank " Mujeres Por El Progreso" meets every 15 days.

This is where Fátima, 33, lives.  She is married, and she and her husband have 3 children aged 11, 7 and 2.  The two oldest attend school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Fátima is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn money on her own, and so 4 years ago with the help of her husband, and gathering together all of her savings, she started up a small pharmacy in her house.  Over time the business has grown, and this has been especially the case since she started receiving loans from her communal bank.  In her pharmacy, in addition to selling medicines, she also sells ice cream, juices, soft drinks, and other items.  She works every day from 8am until night.

This loan will be used to buy medicines to stock her business.  She's been with her communal bank for a year, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot when she needs to stock her business.

Fátima's dreams are to have a big pharmacy and to be able to help people.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets and repair her leaking roof.

loans.name: Kache Mambo

texts.en:
Kache is a 54-year-old landlady and a charcoal dealer in Majaoni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four children. Kache's husband also works and provides additional income. They own some rental houses. Kache has been in the charcoal business for the last 20 years and describes it as a great business.

This marks her third loan with KADET LTD. to finance her business.She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and to repair her rental houses.The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to own several places for charcoal sale in Majaoni in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and repair her rental houses.

loans.name: Batzaya

texts.en: Batzaya, 35 years old, lives with her husband, two children, mother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in its own house on a plot of land. She began her sewing business in 2002 at her home and since 2008 she has been renting work space and sewing dresses ordered by clients. Her skill and trustworthiness quickly enabled her to secure a number of permanent clients. Her husband has the position of electrician at a private company and her two children both go to high school. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. The house they have lived in for so long has been deteriorating over the years and its outer and inner components have become fragile and vulnerable. So, Batzaya is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, her husband will repair and insulate their old house. The renovated house will enable the family to reduce coal consumption thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere, which contributes to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a building and insulation materials

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat, a villager from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, is 42 years old and has three schoolchildren who are under her care. To make a living, she sells vegetables as a daily source of income. Her husband mainly focuses on rice cropping on two hectares and works for others for a fee to supplement their income. She has been in this business since she was 32 years old. Phat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loans including this loan. She has managed her past loans wisely to inject working capital into her business. She has repaid her past loan with success. Now, she has formed a group of two to take out a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to prepare her farmland for the upcoming planting season and to buy fertilizer for her crops. She believes that she can make more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To prepare her farmland to be ready for the upcoming planting season and to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Johnny is a farmer, 56 years old, married and has two children. Johnny aims to improve his farming business to generate sufficient income. He and his wife help each other cultivate their farm land by planting a variety of vegetables to sell. They want to plant a larger variety of vegetables but lack capital.  Johnny is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticides needed in vegetable production. They hope that someday, they will improve their farming business as well as their status of living as they continue to work hard.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Maisom's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Maisom is 38 years old and the mother of one child who attends a local school. She earns a living by raising and selling fish while her husband drives motor-taxi to supplement the family’s income. She has been in her current business for 10 years, and earns about 20,200 KHR a day. She has taken out and repaid six previous loans from Kiva partner VisionFund, and has used these loans to successfully expand her business. She now leads a four-person loan group, and will use her portion of this loan to buy more fish to raise and sell. She hopes to earn enough money to start another business and earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy fish to raise and resell.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkan sont mariées  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bagadadji à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage et surtout leur activité génératrice de revenu.
