Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (échalotes, de la patate, d’aubergine de la fripouille et des bijoux) .
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan  (2ème femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la  photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du beurre de karité et des condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kgs de beurre de karité et beaucoup de condiments. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile, au marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The five women of the group "Benkan" are married in monogamous families. The women average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in the Bagadadji district in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and especially their revenue-generating businesses. The group members work in small-scale commerce involving shallots, potatoes, eggplant, secondhand clothing, and jewelry. 

With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Sitan (second woman sitting from the left in the photo) has a great reputation for selling shea butter and condiments of all kinds. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 kg of shea butter and a lot of condiments. Sales are made in cash or on credit at the market and by going door to door. Her customer base is composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure her home is supplied with food.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 23-year-old from Ejmiatsin. She lives with her parents and grandmother and jointly with them is involved in agriculture. The family cultivates land, gets agricultural harvest, and sells it locally. 

Gayane's mother is a teacher with 20 years of experience teaching at a local school. Unfortunately, as a teacher's salary is too low for sustaining the family of four, agriculture is the only source that helps them to have a stable income.

Realizing the importance of agriculture in their life, Gayane has requested this loan to purchase three oxen and fertilizer for land cultivation. The family wants to get involved in cattle breeding also, so three oxen are a good start. Fertilizer is very important for successful cultivation of the land, so it will help them to cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables and will increase their income.

Gayane dreams of seeing her family have appropriate living conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 38 años es madre soltera, vive en compañia de sus tres hijos en la casa de su madre. A pesar de los problemas que tiene para caminar, ella continua trabajando sin descanso, pues ello no le impide laborar en la agricultura, su principal actividad económica. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz, papa y alfalfa. Comenta que en temporadas de  cosecha contrata trabajadores del lugar para que le apoyen pues tiene que extraer los alimentos en el momento adecuado. Asimismo vende cuyes, ingreso que le ayudaa a pagar los gastos del día a día y algunas veces para los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos tanto en la agricultura como también en la crianza de estos animales. Este es su primer crédito con kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Carmen, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 38 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her three children in her mother's house. In spite of the trouble she has walking, she keeps working tirelessly, because it doesn't prevent her from farming, which is her main business. Her main crops are corn, potatoes, and alfalfa. During the harvest season, she says she hires local workers to help her gather her products at the right time. She also sells Guinea pigs, which helps her pay for daily expenses and for her children's education at times. 

She now wants to improve her income from farming as well as from raising these animals. This is her first Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to keep moving forward, which is why she promises to pay her installments in a timely manner. Carmen will invest the 1,000 soles in purchasing organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association DIANTOYERELA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, sont mariées et mères de six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et de légumes à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  sous-préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiment de légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, huile, sel et concentrée de tomate.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BADENYA is a group from the association DIANTOYERELA of N’TENTOU. It comprises four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 40 years of age and are married mothers of six children. They have different businesses, such as trading in condiments and vegetables, just like MARIAM, who is the first person in the photo standing from the left. The women live in large traditional families in N’TENTOU, in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are in high demand for their businesses. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the loan program at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their fifth solidarity loan. 

MARIAM, the group's president, is well-known in N’TENTOU and excels at selling vegetables condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase different kind of condiments (black pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, oil, salt, tomato paste). She gets her supplies from Bamako and locally from wholesalers. And she resells her goods in OUELESSEBOUGOU for cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, cabbage, salt, and tomato paste to sell

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village located in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Ram is a 35-year-old mother and blessed with three kids; two of them are still in school. She manages one hectare of rice as their main source of income and it has returned to her about 16,100 KHR per day. This is the third time for Ram with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans has upgraded her living conditions at a good pace. 

Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. Ram is the leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seed, and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income so that she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and pesticide

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en: Alcina is  taking out a loan of $ 1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $ 600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Dossou est un homme de 37 ans. Père de 2 enfants âgés tous scolarisés, il gagne sa vie en exerçant comme commerce la revente d’appareil de sonorisation. Servant une catégorie très variée de clientèle, il rêve d’avoir une boutique et de pouvoir employer des jeunes aspirants à son domaine d’activité. Il effectue ses opérations financières depuis cette année avec WAGES et sollicite un crédit en vue de s’approvisionner en appareils de sonorisation variés. Il espère prendre son envol avec ce crédit et participer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Il est dans cette activité il y a 06ans.
texts.en: Dossou is a 37-year-old man who is a father of two children, both in school. He earns his living by selling sound system equipment. Serving a highly varied category of customers, he dreams of having a store and being able to employ young aspirants in his area of work. For years, he has been handling his finances through WAGES and is requesting a loan with the aim of stocking up on various sound equipment. He hopes his business will take off with this loan, and he hopes to help his children to thrive. He has been in this business for six years.

loans.use: to purchase sound system equipment to sell

loans.name: Vilma  Haidee

texts.es: Vilma de 29 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. vilma tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Vilma is 28 and lives with her partner and children in her own house. Her job is growing corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for several years, and this experience means she gets better harvests. She sells her produce in the outskirts of the city, and she has a lot of customers who choose her for her high quality items, good prices and, above all, her good customer service. She is asking for a loan so she can invest in buying corn and bean seeds, insecticide, weedkiller, fertiliser and compost. Vilma has good references from people who know her. She is very responsible and is sure that she will be able to replay the loan in the agreed time period, while bringing economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, weedkiller, fertiliser and compost.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa 39 ans, mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 7 et 10 ans, est veuve. Elle lutte quotidiennement pour subvenir aux besoins de ses deux enfants en exerçant le métier de revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Opérant depuis plus des années avec WAGES, elle sollicite un troisième crédit dans le but d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle espère avec ce prêt disposer d’une boutique à l’avenir et de veiller comme toujours à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is 39 years old and the mother of two children, aged 7 and 10, who both go to school.  She is a widow and she struggles every day to meet the needs of her two children by reselling general food products.

She has been a client of WAGES for several years and she is requesting a third loan to buy general food products.  She hopes that this loan will help her to have her own store in the future and allow her to continue to take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Norietta

texts.en:
This is Norietta. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products and was able to generate more income. The loan also helped in the education of their children and in their everyday expenditures. She has been in this business for fifteen years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norietta hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her family will always have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children ages 9 and 11 years old. She is engaged in raising pigs. She has been raising pigs for more than five years now. To be able to meet the family's daily needs, Mirasol requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements, for the pigs to grow healthy so they can be sold at a given period. In the future, Mirasol hopes that she will be successful in her hog raising business so as to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman and a mother of seven children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

For more than five years now, Delia has been engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Delia is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Delia dreams of expanding their fishing venture, thus augmenting their income and profit.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has taken out and repaid a loan for PHP 14,000 which she used to buy more ingredients such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She uses a big portion of her earnings to pay her children's school fees and household expenses. She is requesting a new loan, also for PHP 14,000 so that she can buy more ingredients and continue educating her children and paying her daily expenses. Her dream is to be more successful and have a good life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study religion, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. She is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a retail business for four years. With the proceeds from the business she has been able to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hardship is customers not paying on time, and her personal goal is educating her children to university level. Her business goal is moving her business to a more permanent location. Agnes intends to use the money to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and jerrycans  to sell.

loans.name: Gufron

texts.ru: Гуфрон опытный повар. Он трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Детям 19, 17 и 14 лет. Гуфрон с 1994 года ведет своё дело. Гуфрон имеет своё кафе. Он готовит и продаёт разнообразные блюда. Он имеет 6 работников. Гуфрон год за годом развивает бизнес и привлекает больше клиентов. Его жена и сын помогают ему введение бизнеса. Гуфрон хочет отремонтировать свою квартиру, так как его квартира имеет плохое состояние. Гуфрон должен обновить обои, так как все стены грязные, а также он хочет купить пластиковые окна для того, чтобы заменить окна. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки обои и пластиковых окон. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gufron is an experienced chef.  He is a hardworking and honest person.  He is 42 years old, married and has three children, who are 19, 17 and 14 years old.  Gufron has been running his own business since 1994.  Gufron owns a cafe.  He cooks and sells various dishes.  He has six employees.  Year-after-year, Gufron develops his business and attracts more customers.  His wife and son help him with running the business.  Gufron wants to remodel his apartment because it is in a bad condition.  Gufron has to update the wallpaper because all of the walls are dirty, and also wants to purchase plastic window frames in order to replace windows.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase wallpaper and plastic window frames.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase wallpaper and plastic window frames and repair his apartment

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.ru: Зарифжон мужчина в возрасте 35 лет, занимающийся растениеводством и проживающий в районе Кубадиён. Он женат и отец троих сыновей и одной дочери.  Вместе с ними также проживают его родители, брат и жена брата. Вся семья Зарифжона занимается вместе с ним сельским хозяйством, а его дети учатся в школе.  Зарифжон уже три года как выращивает бахчевую культуру. Прибыль с продажи урожая является их главным источником семейного дохода, за счет которого поддерживается быт. Зарифжон просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая арбуза.  Он планирует в дальнейшем заняться посевом разных сельскохозяйственных культур.
texts.en: Zarifjon is a 35 year-old man, who is involved in agriculture and lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is married and a father of three sons and one daughter.  His parents, brother and brother's wife live with them as well.  All of Zarifjon's family is involved in agriculture with him, and his children attend a school.  Zarifjon has been growing melon crops for three years.  The profit from the harvest is the primary source of family income, with which they support the household.  Zarifjon is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for the watermelon harvest.  He plans to get involved in planting various agricultural crops in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for the watermelon harvest

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo a 47 ans il vit à Lomé avec sa femme et ses 04 enfants. Dont 02 scolarisés. Son épouse est couturière et en même de temps revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Kodjo est pour sa part chauffeur depuis plus de 10 ans. Il sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de WAGES afin d’acheter des pièces détachées pour sa voiture. Les profits qu'il réalisera lui permettront d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de sa famille. A long terme il aimerait pouvoir acheter d'autres véhicules afin de monter une entreprise de taxi.
texts.en:
Kodjo is 47 years old.  He lives in Lomé with his wife and his four children, two of whom are in school.  His wife is a seamstress and she also resells general food products.  

Kodjo has been working as a taxi driver for more than 10 years.  He is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy spare parts for his car.  With his profits he will be able to take care of his children's school fees and healthcare costs.

Over the long term, he would like to have the possibility to buy other vehicles in order to set up a taxi company.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Otuma

texts.en:
Otuma is 35 years old, married to Leperon, and has been blessed with five children that he supports. For the last six years, he has been a wheat farmer in the Naitupaki area, getting a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

With a third loan of KES 40,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), Otuma intends to acquire farm inputs for better yields. He will also be able to hire a tractor to plow his land.

Otuma plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire a tractor.

loans.name: Gustavo Tomas

texts.es: Gustavo Tomas  es un joven orureño que llega a La Paz el año 2005 junto a su familia con deseos de superación, trabajo y de conseguir un lugar donde vivir, con un padre en la tercera edad y una madre que casi no conocía la ciudad, Gustavo a la corta edad de diecisiete años busca junto a su padre una vivienda, después de haberla encontrado y haber invertido todo su dinero se percatan de que la vivienda que compraron está rajada, sin poder devolver la vivienda Gustavo junto a su padre trabaja para poder readecuar la casa,  trabaja durante ocho años para volver a construir la vivienda en el terreno, actualmente Gustavo trabaja como transportista de un micro. Solicita préstamo para concluir la obra fina de una habitación para su vivienda. El crédito es la oportunidad que necesita para realizar la obra fina en una habitación de su vivienda, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida de el y de sus padres.
texts.en: Gustavo Tomas is a young man from Oruro who arrived with his family in La Paz in 2005 with dreams of finding a better life, work and a place to live. As his father was elderly and his mother didn't know the city, at the age of just 16 Gustavo went with his father to look for somewhere to live. After finding a place and investing all their money in it, they realised that the house they had bought was damaged. Unable to get their money back, Gustavo and his father have been working for the last 8 years to rebuild the house and make it fit to live in. Currently, Gustavo works as a minibus driver. He is asking for a loan to complete the finishing touches of their home, which will help his family to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: house repairs.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbilika est conseillère du groupe d’affaire  « Alpha », doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est agent dans une entreprise commerciale. La cliente est sociétaire d’une papeterie. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Il y a 4 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 cartons de rames de papiers, 5 douzaines de cahiers, 3 boites de stylos, 15 dizaines de fardes, etc. Les taxes et impôts divers constituent un obstacle pour le développement de son entreprise. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Mbilika, is the advisor of the business group "Alpha". The most senior member and an experience entrepreneur, she is 58 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all students. Her husband is representative at a private company.  This client is an associate at a stationary store. She started in this business with funds from her husband. She has been in this business for four years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 3 boxes of reams of paper, 5 dozen notebooks, 3 boxes of pens, 15 dozen folders, etc. The obstacles in developing her enterprise include various taxes. So, she would like to grow her capital and feed her children. To conclude, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase paper, notebooks, pens, and folders to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk two year ago with her own working capital of $100.  Rosa is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob has been breeding cattle for eight years. His livestock currently includes 3 cows, 6 calves, and 14 piglets. Serob works hard, gets dairy products and meat, and sells them in the city market. Agriculture is the only source of his income which helps to cover his family's daily needs. Serob's family consists of his wife and two school-aged children. To tackle financial hardships, Serob wants to enlarge his cattle-breeding business.

By requesting this loan he wants to purchase five calves. The loan is important for him to be able to get more income and give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to pay for five calves

loans.name: Brenda Lee

texts.en: As the married mother of two children, Brenda Lee works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling food in the Philippines, and earns additional income by running a general store. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients that she can use to make food items to sell. Brenda Lee has sustained her business with the help of three previous loans from NWFT. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Barchin

texts.ru: Барчин жительница района Кубадиён. Она разведена, ей 48 лет. У нее есть один сын и одна дочь. Сын в настоящее время находится на заработках в России, а дочь учится в средней школе. Барчин с дочерью живет в доме у своего брата вместе с его семьей. Она является скотоводом и разводит крупно-рогатый скот с целью откорма и продажи. Барчин занимается этой деятельностью в течение 4 лет. Ей помогает брат. Сейчас у нее имеется две коровы. Барчин запрашивает кредит для увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота и продвижения деятельности. Она нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Barchin lives in the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan. She's a divoced 48-year-old woman with two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is away on work in Russia, while her daughter attends school. They live together with Barchin's brother and his family. 

For the past 4 years, Barchin has made a living by raising cattle, fattening and then selling it. Her brother helps her run this business.
Today, she owns 2 cows. Barchin is asking for a loan in order to increase the amount of cattle for future sale. She's hoping for your help.

loans.use: for the purchase and sale of cattle.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es: Doña blanca de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y sus dos nietos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Blanca, 65, lives in her own house with her two children and two grandchildren.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business for many years and has gained much sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  It’s located at home and is in a very busy area; it’s very well-known by local neighbors and she’s acquired a large clientele because the store is well-stocked.  She wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital which is why she’s asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store.  She is sure that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Doña marina es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su hijo de 22 años de edad, ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Doña marina solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su hijo una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Marina is very kind and hardworking.  She lives with her 22-year-old son.  She works hard on her own parcel of land where she grows corn and beans.  Her products are very good quality and when her harvests are in she stores them in the silo shown in the photo to subsequently sell in various markets that are near her place of residence.

Marina is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have the money needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like pest controls, fertilizer, manure and seeds, among other things needed for her crops.  She hopes to increase sales to earn higher profits to give her son better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad y comprometidos, uno de sus hijos aun viven en su casa con su familia. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Carmen con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon, Yanbal, Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal 16 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city noted for the wide variety of traditional products like the straw hats that are famous both inside the country and abroad.  The members of the “Mujeres Por El Progreso” (Women for Progress) meet there every fifteen days.

Carmen, 54, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are responsible adults.  One of her sons still lives at home with his family and her husband is a factory worker in Manta.

Aiming at earing a little on her own to help her husband with household expenses, Carmen works selling all types of clothes as well as Avon, Yanbal and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories.)  She sells door to door and also at home where her customers come by.  She sells on credit and collects every 15 days.  She’s been in business 10 years and does very well.

She will use this loan to buy clothes and cosmetics. She’s been in the communal bank for 16 years and likes it for the help the loans always give her in order to get ahead.  Her dream is to continue moving forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ufredo Gerardo

texts.es:
UFREDO  tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

UFREDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, abonos, insecticidas y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plgas y enfermedades en las siembras.
El sueño es comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Ufredo is 39 years old.  He lives with his partner and four children in the city of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

Ufredo is a member of the Genesis community bank which is located in Atascoso, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank farm and raise animals.

Ufredo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He is requesting this loan to buy urea, seeds, manure, insecticides and fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and a pump for spraying his crops.

Ufredo makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  The challenges he faces are pests and diseases among his crops.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.  In his free time, he enjoys reading the Bible.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, manure, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Victoria Liseth

texts.es:
Victoria, vive con su esposo  y no tiene hijos, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, tiene una tienda y panadería, ya que elabora pan artesanal y desea surtir la tienda con  productos de la canasta básica, ya que es un lugar con buena clientela.
El préstamo que solicita le servirá para comprar levadura, harina, arroz, frijol, aceite azúcar, sal, papel higiénico, golosinas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara  a aumentar la mercadería y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su sueño es tener su tienda y panadería en actividad constante para obtener ingresos y con ello ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria lives with her husband; she has no children or family members abroad.  She has a store and bakery since she makes artisanal bread and wants to stock her store with basic staples because it’s a place with a good clientele.

The loan she’s asking for will serve to buy yeast, flour, rice, beans, oil, sugar, salt, toilet paper and snacks, among others.  This investment will help her increase merchandise thus meeting customer needs.

Her dream is to have her bakery and store in constant activity in order to earn income with which to offer better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amalfi

texts.es: Amalfi, de 60 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Su dedicación a la agricultura es sorprendente, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano cuida de sus cultivos de maíz, papa y alcachofa, le va muy bien en su trabajo. Sobre todo en sus cultivos de alcachofa, que son bien cotizados en el mercado, pues es uno de los alimentos que se exporta a otros países. Además cuida de animales como ovejas y cuyes los cuales cría para luego vender a los carniceros, que la visitan a su casa con frecuencia. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero para tener más terrenos agrícolas y así sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Amalfi, invertirá los S/.1700 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Amalfi, 60, is hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and children who she cares for in the house she bought 20 years ago.  Her dedication to agriculture is amazing.  She cares for her corn, potato and artichoke crops starting very early every morning; she does very well in her work, above all with the artichokes which are very well priced in the market because it’s a food that’s exported to other countries.   She also cares for animals like sheep and guinea pigs that she raises to sell to butchers that visit her at home frequently.

Now, she wants to gather money to buy more farmland to plant larger amounts and earn higher profits.  This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support received to continue forward which is why she commits to make her payments punctually.  Amalfi will use the 1,700 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 7 años que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.

Doña María sabiendo que su esposo no tiene trabajo seguro desde hace un tiempo atrás con los pocos recursos que tenia y con ayuda de su primer crédito construyo un pequeño corral en su casa y compro pollos para la cría, actualmente tiene cien  pollos los cuales los cría hasta que estén listos para el consumo y luego entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o vende a vecinos de la zona ya sea en pie o por libras de acuerdo a lo que necesiten sus clientes. Es así como ella y su familia salen adelante cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo y esto gracias a los créditos que la Fundación les ha brindado.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At Los Bajos de Montecristi, city known for its diversity of local products and crafts such as toquilla straw hats (Panama hat) known in and outside the country, the members of the community bank “Women for Progress” get together every 15 days.

This is where Maria lives, she is 30 years old, married and has two children ages eight and seven, her kids are in school.  Her husband works occasionally.

Knowing that her husband doesn’t have a stable job, Maria used the little resources that she had and with her first loan, she built a small pen in her house and bought chickens to raise, she currently has 100 chickens, which she raises until they are ready for consumption and she sells to merchants that come to buy at her house or to neighbors, she either sells by the pound or by unit, depending on what her customers need. 
This is how her and her family get ahead when her husband doesn’t get work, and it’s attributable to the loans the  Foundation has provided to them.

This loan is to buy chickens, feed and medicine.  She has been with the community bank for 4 years and she likes it because she gets ahead with the loans.

Her dream is to provide her kids with the best.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has been engaged with Fresno Economic Opportunities Commission (parent agency to Fresno CDFI) since he was 13 years old, when as a freshman in high school he joined an EOC after-school work program that helped him make ends meet for his mom, who was unemployed at the time. He worked for Goodwill and then attended summer school through the program, which allowed him to graduate a year early and, as he says, "kept me out of a whole lot of trouble."

Simon decided to open a cell phone repair store in 2012 after teaching himself to repair phones via YouTube videos. He was repairing all of his friend’s broken screens. In August, 2012, he opened a small cell phone repair shop in central Fresno.

Simon has been successful in business and is ready to expand to a new location with higher foot traffic. He completed a business plan and saved up $1,500 as part of an Individual Development Account (savings matching) program with Fresno CDFI. He needs an additional $2,000 to complete his capitalization for the move.

loans.use: To move to a larger location with more foot traffic.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгулу 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Его доход последнее время не хватает для обеспечения семьи, так как дети год за годом вырастают и требуют больше благ. Норгул решила организовать свой бизнес. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры как кукуруза, рис и другие зерновые культуры. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 Сомони для покупки семена. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Norgul is 45 years old. She's a married woman raising 3 children. Her husband makes a living as a farmer, yet, recently, his income has become insufficient to meet the increasing need of their growing children. So Norgul decided to open a business. She received a Certificate for completing an Achieve Success course offered by the Businesswoman's Association. 

Norgul wants her future business to focus on growing cereal crops like corn and rice. Her husband plans to help her with this business. 
Norgul is asking for a loan of 2000 soms in order to purchase some seeds. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy seeds to start a new business.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont en majorité mariée  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 27 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira à Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage et surtout leur activité génératrice de revenu. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes (real wax, des draps) et des parfums.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (1ère femme débout de la gauche vers la droite dans la  photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter plusieurs pièces de pagnes et quelques draps. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile, au marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité pour agrandir son activité de commerce. Toute comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame Fatoumata à pour objectif de pérenniser ses activités dans le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Most of the ten women of the Djiguiya group are married within monogamous families.  They are, on average, 27 years old with four children each.  They all live in the Missira neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know one another through neighborhood, family and marriage ties and also particularly through their income-generating activities.  The members of the group sell "real wax pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), bed sheets and perfumes.

They have decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and this is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Fatoumata (standing, first from the left in the photo) is a well known seller of pagnes of various kinds.  She plans to use her loan to buy several sets of pagnes and a few bed sheets. She sells her merchandise for cash or on credit, from home, at the market and also door to door, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women.

Thanks to this loan, Fatoumata is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business in order to expand her commercial activity.  Like the other members of the group, Fatoumata's goal is to continue to strengthen her business through partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and bed sheets.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, 48, is single and lives in Linao Norte. She is a woman and proves to be responsible in managing a small business, which is her grocery store. She usually earns a minimum monthly income of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She budgets for daily expenses and has rolling capital for her business.  

Wilma is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to increase her sales. She will buy more biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to provide quality products and services to her customers and gain continuous profits to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell at the market

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es:
La  Señora Linda Rosa de 55 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una  comunidad  de Nacaome Valle, en la zona sur de Honduras,no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de ropa de todos los estilos.
Doña Linda Rosa  también compra cerdos para destazo, sus clientes son amigos y vecinos que a diario le visitan y los clientes que ella sale a visitar. 
Doña Linda Rosa  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pantalones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, ropa de niño, camisas,sandalias, etc. sus clientes han aumentado y espera poder satisfacer su demanda y con las ganancias poder mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Linda Rosa su sueño es tener una tienda bien surtida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Linda Rosa, 55 years old, lives in her home, located in the community of Nacaome Valle, in the south Honduras zone. She does not have children who depend on her. For 10 years, she has been selling all styles of clothes.

Linda Rosa also buys pigs to butcher. Her customers are friends and neighbors who visit her daily, as well as the customers that she goes out to see.

Linda Rosa is requesting a loan to purchase pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, children's clothes, shirts, sandals, etc. Her number of customers has increased, and Linda Rosa hopes to be able to satisfy their demand, and, with the earnings, be able to improve her life style and her family's life style a little bit.

Linda Rosa's dream is to have a well-stocked store.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: purchase pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, children's clothes, shirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in Kapan, with his wife and three children. He repairs cars, and his specialty is body work. Now he does his work in a small, rented garage. He also has an apprentice, to whom he teaches all the skills of auto body work. His wife is unemployed, so Norayr's is the only income for their family. The family's needs are far more than the monthly income from his work. 

Norayr is so skilled in his work that he buys worn out, old cars and manages to repair, paint, and sell them at convenient prices. He also offers car washing services. Norayr works very hard and without taking off any weekends, but nevertheless his family is short of money. He asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams. He will use the loan to buy old cars, which he will repair and resell later, for profitable prices.

loans.use: to buy worn out cars and repair them, to resell

loans.name: Alfredo Otilio

texts.es:
ALFREDO  tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y la conyugue en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ALFREDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se ddeica a ala crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, abono orgánico y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 48, is in a common law relationship and has two children; he lives with his children and spouse in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Genesis” communal bank located in Atascoso which belongs to Ventanas Canton; they carry out agricultural and animal husbandry activities.

Alfredo works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises pigs and chickens.  He’s asking for this loan to buy urea, seeds, organic manure and fertilizer.  With the loan’s help he will be able to buy the fertilizer and a pump to fumigate his crops.

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  The challenge he faces is infestations and crop diseases.  His dream is to buy land to continue planting.  He likes playing indor soccer with neighborhood friends in his free time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dagi

texts.ru: Даги 52 года. Он с женой и тремя сыновьями проживает в городе Вахдат. У Даги среднее образование. Он работает таксистом с 2008 года. Даги предоставляет услуги такси по маршрутной линии город Вахдат - город Душанбе и в день он делает 5 рейсов. Он уже 5 лет за счет этой деятельности обеспечивает семью  и поддерживает быт. Сейчас с его машиной, на которой он развозит пассажиров, возникли технические неполадки. Чтобы устранить эти неполадки он обратился за кредитом. Даги хочет отремонтировать свою машину на сумму кредита и затем снова продолжить свою деятельность. Он будет очень признателен за поддержку в такую трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Dagi is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and three sons in Vahdat, Tajikistan. He has a high school level of education and has worked as a taxi driver since 2008. He makes runs between Dushanbe and Vahdat and usually makes 5 round-trips per day. 

This job has enabled him to successfully support his family for the past 5 years. Unfortunately, however, the car that he uses as a taxi has broken down. So Dagi is asking for a loan in order to repair it which would enable him to continue providing his services. He would be very grateful for any assistance in this difficult time.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Felicita  De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Felicita de 52 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz cuando sus  cosechas ya estan listas las almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia para luego comercializarloz, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con sus cuatro hijos. Doña felicita está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: herbicidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Felicita is 52 years old and has been working in agriculture for several years. She cultivates beans and corn and when her crops are ready she stores them in the granary shown in the photo, in order to commercialize them later. By selling her crops she is able to cover the household expenses. She is a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman that lives with her four children. 

Felicita is applying for a loan in order to buy agriculture inputs such as herbicides, organic fertilizers, seeds, fertilizers, etc. so that she can increase her income and improve her economic stability. Her profits are not enough to pay for these expenses.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, organic fertilizers, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Shirley Rosana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 11 y 8 años, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Jaramijo.

Doña Shirley tiene un servicio de internet y cabinas telefónicas en su casa, también en su local ella vende cosméticos, helados, sodas, jugos, golosinas, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras, allí trabaja todos los días desde hace tres años que tiene su negocio y le va muy bien ya que no hay muchos negocios como el suyo por donde ella vive.

Este crédito es para pagar el servicio de internet y la cuenta del teléfono y para comprar cosméticos. Lleva casi 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora aun más su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city known for its vast variety of traditional products like the straw hats that are famous both inside and outside the country.  The members of the “Mujeres Por El Progreso” (Women for Progress) communal bank meet there every 15 days.

Shirley, 34, lives here.  She’s married and as three children who are 14, 11 and 8 years of age.  Her two oldest attend secondary school and the youngest is in primary school.  Her husband works in the city of Jaramijo.

Shirley has an Internet access and phone booth service installed at home; she also sells cosmetics, ice-cream, soft-drinks, games, snacks, phone cards and air time recharges of all operators there too.  She works there every day and has been in business three years.  She does very well because there aren’t many businesses like hers around where she lives.

This loan is to pay for the Internet access and to pay her phone bill and to buy cosmetics.  She’s been in the communal bank for almost two years and likes it because she’s able to improve her business even more with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to pay for Internet and telephone service and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 32 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 15 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla. Ella  es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy conocida en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que ella consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 32 years old. She grows corn and beans. She has been working in this sector for 15 years and this is how she makes her living. When the crops are ready, she harvests them and stores the harvest in barns such as the one shown in the picture. She then shells her crops.
Guadalupe is a hard working woman, responsible and well known in the area for her big heart and generosity towards others. Because it is sowing time, she decided to start getting ready for it. This is why she is asking for a loan from the field partner, Integral, to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.
Guadalupe's biggest wish is that her crop be plentiful and better than the previous ones because this is how she provides for her family. She is hopeful that with the help from Kiva lenders, her dedication and determination she will make her dream of improving her family's quality of life come true.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for stick brooms, soft brooms, net bags, sandpaper, and other products to resell in her business.

loans.name: Jhonny Jose

texts.es:
Jhonny tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Jhonny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Soliciat el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, abonos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos.

 El sueño es comprar terreno y tener mas ingresos para dar buena vida a la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 37 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.

He is a member of the Genesis communal bank, which deals with farming and livestock. It is located in the Atascoso neighborhood within the canton Ventanas.

Jhonny is a farmer and he cultivates corn and rice. He is requesting this loan to buy urea, seeds, manure, and insecticides. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer. 

He will make his purchases and sales in the city of Guaranda. The challenges he faces are the pests and plant diseases. His dream is to buy land and earn more income to give his family a good life. In his free time, he likes to play sports with his friends.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, manure, and insecticides.

loans.name: Adrian Arturo

texts.es:
ADRIAN tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los abuelos en la ciudad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ADRIAN ARTURO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos . Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas y fertilizantes y balanceado para los cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprarce un tener un negocio propio en los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Adrián, 23, is single and has no children; he lives with his grandparents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Genesis” communal bank located in Atascoso which belongs to Ventanas Canton; they carry out agricultural and animal husbandry activities.

Adrián Arturo works in agriculture growing corn and rice and also raises pigs.  He’s asking for this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizer and nutritionally balanced pig feed.  With the loan’s help he will be able to buy what’s necessary.

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  The challenge he faces is infestations and crop diseases.  His dream is to own a business and he enjoys playing indor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Zawadi Julian

texts.en:
Zawadi is 34 years old and a bajaji (local Tanzanian taxi) driver in Dar es Salaam. He lives together with his wife and his two-year-old son. For the last five years Zawadi has been driving his bajaji everyday - 7 days per week - to bring people safely through the heavy traffic jams in Dar es Salaam. For this, he borrows the bajaji from a private company which he has to pay approximately 280 USD each month. This amount equals 45% of his total income.

One month ago Zawadi also started his own social business with solar energy. With the help of African Solar Rise, he wrote a business plan and started selling solar products to his passengers. Furthermore, he developed the idea of his own "Solar Bajaji Project": to create awareness about solar energy he wants to equip his own bajaji with solar products so that his passengers can experience this ecological energy solution during their ride through Dar es Salaam. With a Kiva loan we can make this project come true, and Zawadi can buy his own bajaji to equip it with solar products.

Due to his organisational skills, the repayment of the loan won't be any problem for Zawadi. After a bit more than one year the loan will be fully repaid, and Zawadi will own his own "Solar Bajaji" and can save money for the education of his son.

loans.use: to start his own solar business

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, 43, is married with two children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and cassava planting in her village. She has been running her businesses for 23 years, earning about $15 per day. She is able to save about $10 each day. 

Nan received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. She is now applying for another loan to  buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Hi's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager in Battambang province, Hi is a farmer who grows rice on six-hectares of farmland in the local area. Her husband helps with farming and works for others, for a fee, to supplement the family’s income. 

Hi has six children. From her current business, which she has been with for 10 years, Hi is able to earn about 28,000 Cambodian Riel (KHR) per day to support her family’s needs.
 
Hi has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is leading her group of seven to apply for a loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for rice growing in the rainy season. She hopes that she can get a high crop yield from her farming so that she can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for rice growing in the rainy season.

loans.name: Djekafo  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix  femmes du groupe Djekafo 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Madame Kadia (1ier femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Djekafo 1 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 34 and on average, five children. They all live in the village of  Sirakorobougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities as well as due to being neighbors, linked by marriage and kinship ties their village.  They grow peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy themselves small equipment and stock up on farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third agricultural loan.

Mme Kadia, the first woman standing left to right in the photo, is a busy rainy-season farmer in the village of Sirakorobougou.  She intends to use her loan to plow her field, buy seed and  fertilizer and pay young people to weed her field. Her agricultural produce is sold for cash at the end of the rainy season in order to pay back her loan and have income to support her children and be responsible for some other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Doña maria de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, doña maria es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramienta, etc. doña maria tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
María, 46, lives with her life companion and their two children. She works in agriculture specifically growing corn and beans.  She’s been working in this line of work for many years and has acquired very valuable experience that makes it possible for her to get the best harvests.  Her land is located in an area of high agricultural activity.  She sells in all the adjacent zones and has many regular customers.  These people always prefer her products because it’s quality at truly affordable prices and besides service is unequaled.

María is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always willing to work hard to reach success.  She wants to take advantage of the boom in her business to increase production to earn higher profits.  She needs to invest in supplies but needs capital which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc.

María has good payment references and is sure to repay the loan on time while at the same time is confident that she’ll be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: Djekafo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix  femmes du groupe  Djekafo 3  sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le dans le village de Sirakorobougopu dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Madame Djelika (dernière femme debout à droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djekafo 3 group are all married women who live in traditional families.  On average, they are 37 years old and have three children each.  They all live in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season, and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties within the village.  They cultivate millet, groundnuts and rice.

The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and agricultural inputs.  This is their third cycle of farming loan.

Djelika (standing first from the right in the photo) is an important and active farmer during the rainy season in the village of Sirakorobougopu.  She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers and then to pay some young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mirna Rafaela

texts.es: Mirna de 39 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee un puesto de venta de refrescos y gaseosas en su lugar  de residencia, vende todos los días por la mañana ya que cuando es hora del almuerzo la gente la busca para comprarle, tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por su amabilidad y sus buenos productos, con las ganancias que obtiene  logra  cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Mirna esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas gaseosas y refrescos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Mirna, 39, lives in a rented house with her life companion and their two children.  She has a sales stand where she sells soft-drinks and snacks at home.  She sells every day in the morning because when lunch time comes people look for her to buy from her.  She has a large clientele that prefers her because of her kindness and her good products.  She uses profits earned to cover some of her household expenses.  Mirna is asking for this loan to be able to buy more soft-drinks and snacks at wholesale to stay in business and earn higher profits that will help her attain better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and snacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años siembra maíz y frijol vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia , con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que tiene  su hogar,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos que también le ayudan en la agricultura, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con su siembra como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: This client has earned her living in agriculture for five years, planting corn and beans that she sells at markets near her home.  She uses profits from the sales to help out with household expenses.  She lives with her parents and siblings, who also help her out with the farming.  She is seeking a loan so she can buy the supplies she needs to keep planting her crops: fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, pesticides, etc., to bring in more profit so she and her family can have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 39-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 20-years-old while the youngest is 12. 

She has a business selling snack foods. She makes banana cue (deep-fried saba (banana) covered with caramelized brown sugar) and sells it to nearby schools. Aside from her food business, Leonora also farms seaweed. She grows seaweed and harvests at a period of time in order to earn additional income. She has been selling banana cue for more than five years now.

Leonora has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to buy more bananas and additional seaweed seedlings.  In the future, Leonora hopes that she will be successful in both her businesses in order to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and additional seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Los Cisnes Group

texts.es:
Los Cisnes es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 12 personas alegres, amables y trabajadoras, ellas decidieron formar un grupo para solicitar estos creditos ya compartian un interes en comun el brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ademas de que cada una de ellos desarrolla una actividad economica. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una region de muchos y fuertes calores llamada Tierra Blanca y las principales actividades economicas son el comercio y la ganaderia. 

Concepcion es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 22 años, solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos uno de brazos (bebé) y el mayor asiste al preescolar.
Desde muy pequeña ha sido una mujer trabajadora  ya que no tuvo muchos estudios se le enseño a trabajar y lo que mas le ha gustado es el comercio porque se trabaja de acuerdo con el tiempo y la temporada, cuando inicio con sus ventas vendia papayas pero actualmente vende ropa para dama y caballero, realiza sus ventas de casa en casa con sus amigos y conocidos, ella ya tiene tres años realizando esta actividad y esta muy contenta porque ha ganado buenos clientes y en ocasiones le hacen pedidos especiales. Concepcion tambien esta realizando ventas de mojarras una vez a la semana y asi obtener un extra. Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que durante este tiempo ha ayudado a sus esposo a brindar una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Un credito de Kiva le ayudara a comprar  variedad de camisas, blusas, playeras, ropa interior, vestidos, faldas y pantalones.

En un futuro le gustaria que su negocio continue creciendo, hacer mejoras a su hogar, su meta a largo plazo es darle estudios a sus hijos.

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que se le esta brindando a través de estos créditos
 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Ana  venta de accesorios de plata
Maria  venta de zapatos
Adela venta de masa
Margarita venta de zapatos
Narcisa servicio de satreria 
Arcelia venta de refrescos 
Alicia venta de refrescos
Paulino servicio de taxi 
Paula venta de ropa 
Agripina venta de tortillas
Ana Leidi venta de ropa
texts.en:
“The Swans” is the name of this group composed of 12 happy, kind, and hard-working people. They decided to form the group to solicit these loans. And they share a common interest – offering their families a better quality of life, and, in addition, each of them pursues her own economic activity. The group is located in an area with much sun called “White Land” and their principal economic activities are commerce and cattle raising.

Concepcion is a member of this group. She is 22 years old and only studied to the 5th grade in primary school. She is married and has 2 children, one a baby in her arms, and the older attends pre-school.

From a very young age, Concepcion has been a working woman, since she didn't have much schooling. She learned to work and what she liked most is selling, because she can work according to her schedule and the weather. When she began peddling, she sold papayas but, at present, she sells men and women's clothing. Concepcion sells door to door among friends and acquaintances. She has done this for 3 years and is very pleased because she has gained good customers and, on occasions, they order by special request. Concepcion is also selling bream once a week and thus earning extra. What she likes most about her business is that during all this time, she has aided her husband in offering a better life for their children.

A loan from Kiva will help her buy a variety of shirts, blouses, T-shirts, underwear, dresses, skirts and pants.


In the future, she would like for her business to continue growing and making improvements to her home. Her long-range goal is to offer education for her children.

The group is grateful for the help offered by these loans. The remaining members of the group are:

Ana sells silver accessories
Maria sells shoes
Adela sells tortilla dough
Margarita sell shoes
Narcisa offers sewing services
Arcelia sells soft drinks 
Alisia sells soft drinks
