Paulina offers taxi services
Paula sells clothing
Agripina sells tortillas
Ana Leidi sells clothing

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, T-shirts, underwear, dresses, skirts, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Musanka

texts.en:
Musanka is 41 years old and married. He supports a family of five children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last six years. His monthly income has been KES 18,000. He has received his third loan from KADET, in the amount of KES 27,000. This loan will facilitate him in preparation of the land and purchase of inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and to reinvest. His future dreams are to improve his family's living standard and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Parsimei   Ole

texts.en:
Parsimei is 40-years-old and married.  He supports a family of seven people. He has been in the livestock  business for the last 15 years with a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Parsimei qualified for a fourth loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD of KES 60,000 which he plans to use for farming and rearing of livestock.  The anticipated profit will help him expand his business. 

Parsimei looks forward to buying more livestock to fatten and sell. 

His hopes and dreams remain to grow more stable especially in regard to finances.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten.

loans.name: Anjielyn

texts.en:
Anjielyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of rice to sell to her customers.

Anjielyn has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Anjielyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.en: Felismina is applying for a loan of $1,000, which she will use to grow her business. She is running a business supplying rental chairs, from her house.  She is making a good income from rental chairs, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to rent from her. She is open for rentals every day. She started her rental business a year ago, with working capital that she had, in the amount of $400.00.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs again, which she will rent out to customers

loans.name: Djekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes  de Djekafo 2 ont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Madame Mayama (1ier femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Djekafo 2 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 33 and on average, three children. They all live in the village of Sirakorobougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities as well as due to being neighbors, linked by marriage and kinship ties in their village. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy themselves small equipment and stock up on farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third agricultural loan.

Mme Mayama, the first woman standing left to right in the photo, is a busy rainy-season farmer in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, buy seed and fertilizer, and pay young people to weed her field. Her agricultural produce is sold for cash at the end of the rainy season in order to repay her loan and have income to support her children and be responsible for some family expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 55 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 40 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos y obtener las mejores cosechas, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, don Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que  muestra la fotografía ya que donde el reside los terrenos son  muy  rústicos y muy pedregoso, y  asi el pueda seguir con sus cosechas para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jorge is 55 and has made his living growing corn and sorghum for forty years, giving him the knowledge and experience he needs to tend his crops and obtain the best harvests.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their three children.  Jorge is seeking a loan so he can buy the supplies he needs, like fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc., and improve his plot, the one pictured above; the fields in the area are very rough and gravely.  He'll also be able to continue harvesting crops so he can offer his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc., and improve his land.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 49 años es una mujer casada. Vive en compañía de su esposo Wilfredo con quien tiene 2 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Nancy se dedica a la crianza de vacas lecheras de buena calidad, posee 5 ejemplares de las cuales 2 están preñadas y espera de esta manera aumentar la cantidad de ganado que posee. Tiene una producción de 40 litros por dia, por lo que espera poder incrementar está cantidad, ya que de acuerdo a ello obtiene sus ingresos. Ahora desea ahorrar el dinero necesario para poder comprar vacas de calidad y sembrar la alfalfa necesaria para poder alimentarlos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido ya que esto le permite seguir adelante con su actividad laboral, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nancy, invertirá S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, is a married woman; she lives with her husband, Wilfredo, with whom she has two children but only one of them still lives with them in a house she inherited from her parents.  Nancy works raising good quality dairy cows.  She has five head two of which are pregnant; she’s hoping to increase her herd size thanks to this.  Her production is 40 liters per day and she hopes to increase this since this is her source of income.  She wants to save the money needed to buy quality cows and to plant alfalfa to feed them.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support received since it will help her continue with her work.  She commits to make her payments punctually.  Nancy will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her alfalfa crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her alfalfa crop.

loans.name: Djekafo 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  huit femmes de Djekafo 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Madame Yah  (2ème femme debout à droite vers dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Djekafo 4 group are all married women who live in traditional families. On average, they are 30 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Sirakorobougou, in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season, and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties within the village. They grow millet, groundnut and rice.

The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and agricultural inputs. This is their third cycle of farming loan.

Yah (standing second from the right in the photo) is a very active farmer during the rainy season in the village of Sirakorobougou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers and then to pay some young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Maria Sorina

texts.en:
Maria Sorina dreams of becoming successful in business, in the future. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She and her husband maintain a farming business, wherein they grow rice and some vegetables.  To generate additional profit, she is engaged in the business of selling soft drinks and balut, in their community. (A balut, or balot, is a duck embryo that has been boiled, and is served, in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.)

To improve and strengthen the business, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to buy more soft drinks and balut to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, Maria Sorina believes that she is going to improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy products to resell, including a variety of soft drinks and balut (a Filipino food)

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Julita earns a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business. She is also into bread-baking.

Julita is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store and additional ingredients for baking like flour, milk, yeast, sugar and others. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store and additional ingredients for baking like flour, milk, yeast, sugar and others

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle.

Daisy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Daisy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like oil, slippers, detergent and soap to resell. 

Fernanda is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business.

loans.use: to buy oil, slippers, detergent and soap to resell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is 35 years of age and blessed with two children. She has been selling green vegetables for five years. She started the business with her savings. She came to know about Milango through friends, and she decided to join so that she can access credit. She now seeks a loan to buy two sacks of potatoes, two crates of tomatoes and one sack of cabbages. The major challenges she has been facing are competition from other businesses and price changes. She wants to own a wholesale business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of potatoes, two crates of tomatoes and one sack of cabbages for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su papa, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con sus cosechas y asi seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client lives in his own home with his father. He has for several years grown corn and beans, selling his crops to companies that buy and sell staple grains in his area. The client uses the income he earns from sales to help meet household expenses. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc., and to improve the land he farms, which is shown in the photo. The loan will help him continue to harvesting his crops and help meet his household expenses without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell to her customers. NWTF is re-listing Lucia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 36 years old. She did not attend school, but she is engaged in a business to help herself. She is married, with five children between the ages of 18 and 3. They are in school, and all live at home.

For the past ten years now, Josephine has been selling used clothes in the local market. She received a small amount from her husband to establish her business, and she learned this way of trading from her friends. She likes her business because she makes more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for business.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha is taking out a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she opened her business in 2011. She has a shop to generate income for her family. 

Joaninha has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better now that she has applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her shop such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and bags

loans.name: Tumusiime

texts.en:
Tumusiime is a married man, age 41 years. He is a businessman involved in the buying and selling of a local brew commonly known as waragi. He has many customers for the commodity because it's easily affordable for the residents. He has been operating this business since 2002 and it is his major source of income for looking after the family. 

He supplements his income by practicing agriculture, but on a smaller scale. Because of the smaller business he operates, the income generated is not sufficient enough to improve the living conditions of the family. 

Currently, Tumusiime and his family are staying in a mud and wattle house which is not good for them. Tumusiime has now applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Two million shillings only) to complete the construction of his residential house so that their living conditions can be improved.

Tumusiime's dream is to complete this house and embark on expanding his business for good returns from it in the future. In the photo, Tumusiime is in front of the house under construction.

loans.use: To complete his residential house now under construction.

loans.name: Kotognontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe  Kotognontala 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougopu dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Awa   (dernière femme debout à droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Kotognontala 2" are all married in traditional families, and they average 32 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farmwork and by ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing various equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle.

Ms. Awa (last woman standing at the right in the photo) is a great seasonal farmwork leader in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan, and finally to have revenues to provide for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Kotognontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Kotognontala 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Maimouna (dernière femme debout à droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Kotognontala 3" are all married in traditional families, and they average 37 years of age and two children each, all living in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farmwork and by ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing various equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle.

Ms. Maimouna (last woman standing at the right in the photo) is a great seasonal farmwork leader in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan, and finally to have revenues to provide for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Kotognontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes de Kotognontala 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougopu dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Nana   (première femme assise à gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The six women of "Kotognontala 4" are all married in traditional families, and they average 39 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farmwork and by ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing various equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle.

Ms. Nana (first woman sitting from the left in the photo) and is a seasonal farmwork leader in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and finally to have revenues to provide for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente posee  un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa de sus padres con su compañera de vida y su hijo. El cliente cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. El cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
This client has a food stand near his place of residence and uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his parents’ house with his life companion and their son.  

He has the satisfaction of having a regular clientele because his location has many passersby.  He wants to expand the stand, that is to buy tables, chairs and raw materials like rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary his menu and earn a bit more money but he does not have enough income to make this investment and this is why he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan to buy the aforementioned and thus earn higher profits to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and raw materials.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children. He has been farming for five years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding dairy cows.'  His biggest challenge is: 'High cost of feed.'  Animals on the farm have been given the name of  'Chelel.'

Edwin was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'It offers low interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It trains farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Edwin replied: 'I will earn more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Edwin owns the following: 'cow, poultry,' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.'  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit for feeding dairy cows

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in the seaweed farming business. She grows and sells seaweed to earn a living. She has been farming seaweed for almost 10 years now.

Cirila requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy nylon, weight sinker, and additional seaweed seedlings to help her pursue her livelihood.  In the future, Cirila  hopes that she can improve her livelihood to provide good food and a quality life.

loans.use: to buy nylon, weight sinker, and additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Reiza

texts.en:
Reiza is from the village of Calaocan, Alicia, Isabela.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She owns and operates a general store in her community, selling a variety of different products. She has been in this business for three years.  She is thankful that she has been able to earn PHP 8,000 a month.  

Reiza would like to make her business a progressive one.  To make this a reality, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional products to sell in her 'sari-sari' (general store), such as canned goods, spices, beverages and snacks.  She believes that the financial support of the lenders will be of great help in making her business a successful one.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her 'sari-sari' (general store)

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a widow who has eight children, one of whom currently attends school. Annah retired from her job as a nurse in 2004 to take care of her family after the death of the husband who was the major supporter to the family, and she decided to concentrate on agriculture. It is from agriculture that she earns some income to supplement her pension so that the family is taken care of.

Annah is paying the school fees for her daughter.  But because it is not yet coffee harvesting season, Annah has approached Ugafode for a loan of 800,000 shillings to pay the school fees and she plans to pay back the loan after the coffee harvest.

Annah's dream is to see her daughter complete her studies and get something to do so that she can support the family. However, as a result of her limited income and the seasonality of agriculture which at times leaves her with nothing to sell to earn money, she constantly faces the challenge of paying the fees.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 22-year-old Iraqi youth client who is married and has 2 children. He provides the family income while his wife takes care of their children. He owns a small shop where he sells eyeglasses and contact lenses. He has gained his experience in this field through working with his father, who has a similar shop. 

Amjad established his business in 2010 and has gained a good reputation since he is the only person with such a profession in the neighborhood. He is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to buy ophthalmic equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may enhance his current financial condition and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy ophthalmic equipment, specialized for his work.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik is very thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan he was given, which helped him to increase his profit in his construction business. He used the loan to purchase ceramics and other materials used for decoration and for enhancing the environment of various establishments. Because he had more to offer his customers, he was able to increase his income and production. 

This has had a positive effect on his family life, as he was able to improve their living conditions. Now he is requesting a second loan to buy more materials for his work. Since it is the summer and the weather is usually favorable for construction, the amount of business increases from customers. This loan will help him to satisfy his customers and thereby increase the income. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business even more and eventually even hire an employee to assist him. He appreciates all of the lenders for their support, which helps him reach and attain his goals.

loans.use: to buy ceramics and materials for decoration.

loans.name: Fidel Alberto

texts.es:
Fidel, está acompañado  y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 7 y 11 años, ambos estudian. El se dedica al servicio de transporte, realiza viajes con un pik-up, el cual es propio y dichos viajes los lleva a cabo a cualquier hora del día y asimismo posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, este oficio lo aprendió en un taller como ayudante y lo realiza desde hace 5 años.
El préstamo que solicita es para comprar accesorios para el mejoramiento del vehículo; este le ayudara a tener en óptimas condiciones el vehículo y así tendrá mayor seguridad a la hora de realizar los viajes. 
Su sueño es seguir estudiando, ya que por motivos familiares había abandonado sus estudios, los cuales ya los inicio nuevamente y  su objetivo  es superarse.
texts.en:
Fidel is in a relationship and has two children aged 7 and 11, both of whom go to school. He works with transportation services, traveling with the pickup truck he owns, and he travels any time of day. He also owns a metal workshop, he learnt this profession as a workshop apprentice from the age of five.

He is applying for this loan in order to buy car parts so that he can improve his vehicle. This will help him to keep the vehicle in optimal condition so that he can travel more safely. His dream is to continue his studies, which he had to abandon for family reasons and which he has now initiated again with the aim of improving himself.

loans.use: to buy car parts so that he can improve his vehicle

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama, 37, is a mother and head of household. 

Two years ago, she started selling merchandise (sanitary pads and second-hand clothing). She considered this as the only way to take care of two daughters who are currently in school. She learned this type of work on her own and she insists that it’s become one of her greatest blessings since that is what the family depending on. She, therefore, plans to take care and improve her business. 

She’s currently asking for a loan of GHS 1,300 to buy more sanitary products and second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

She dreams of moving her two children forward and to give them a quality education, so that they can enjoy better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more of sanitary products and second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hedije

texts.en:
Hedije is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. The loan she had been given previously has helped her to renovate her kitchen and to install a water supply. She is very happy that she has been able to work towards realizing her dream. She has said that without the loan she could not have managed to complete the renovation. 

She is now requesting a loan once again to continue renovations in her home, this time to buy tiles and to extend the water supply to the toilet. She hopes that with this second loan she will be able to finish the renovations to her house. Once she is able to complete all of the work needed in her home, she would like to focus on her goal, which is to open her own hair salon for women. In this way she believes she can manage a way to offer a better life for her family. She wants to thanks all Kiva lenders for their second loan.

loans.use: To buy tiles and to extend the water supply to the toilet.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria, de 55 años de edad, está casada con David con quien vive en su casa propia junto a su nieta de 7 años ya que sus hijos son personas independientes . Silveria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos tales como cremas para manos, perfumes, talcos, etc. los cuales compra por catálogo y los vende en su vitrina ya que cuenta con un salón de belleza instalado en su propio hogar desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes brindándoles un buen servicio, lleva 05 años en está actividad y lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio de belleza pues le genera muy buenas ganancias, con los cuales puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva por tanto espera de su apoyo para seguir adelante y cumplir todas sus metas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en compra de cosméticos tales como cremas , talcos, perfumes , labiales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Silveria, 55, is married to David and lives with him in their own house with her 7 year old granddaughter since her children are all independent people now.  Silveria works selling cosmetics like hand cream, perfume, talc, etc.  She buys them via catalog and sells them in her display case since she has a home-based beauty salon where she takes care of customers very kindly providing them with good service.

She’s been in this occupation for five years and she works alone.  She likes the beauty business because it generates very good profits that she can use to cover her household expenses.  

This will be her first Kiva loan so she’s hoping for your support so she can continue forward and reach all her goals.  She will use the 2,500 new soles to buy cosmetics like cream, talc, perfume, lipstick, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Pedro Arnoldo

texts.es: Pedro de 30 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años su principal siembra es el frijol y el maíz con las ganancias que obtiene logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus hijos y su sobrino, pedro esta solicitando un credito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cosechas y poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30 years old. He has been working in the agricultural field for 10 years. He grows mainly beans and corn and with the profits he covers some household expenses. He lives in a house of his own with his wife, children and a nephew.
Pedro is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, pest control products, etc., as shown in the picture. This will allow him to continue with his crops and to provide for his family without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Kotognontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Kotognontala 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Awa   (dernière femme debout à droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Kotognontala 1" are all married in traditional families, and they average 32 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Sirakorobougopu, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farmwork and by ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of purchasing various equipment and stocking up on farm inputs, the group members found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third farm loan cycle.

Ms. Awa (last woman standing at the right in the photo) is a great seasonal farmwork leader in the village of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase seeds and manure, and then pay youngsters to weed her field. Sales of her produce are made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan, and finally to have revenues to provide for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Elsa Cleotilde

texts.es: Doña elsa de 52 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el  maiz y arroz desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, doña Elsa está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y asi seguir con sus siembras y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Elsa, 52, has worked in agriculture for many years and her main crops are corn and rice; when the harvest is ready she stores it in the silos shown in the photo to subsequently sell in markets near her place of residence.  With profits earned she’s able to cover household expense.  She lives in her own house with her children.  Elsa’s asking for a loan to be able to buy necessary supplies like fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc. to continue planting and to be able to give her children better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz vende su producto en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que tiene en el hogar, juan esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para seguir cosechando ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder llevar el pan diario a su casa.
texts.en: Juan is 57 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife and daughters.  He has been engaged in farming for several years and this has given him the experience necessary to care for his crops.  His mainly plants corn and sells his product at the markets close to his home.  The profits he earns enable him to pay some of his household expenses.  Juan is requesting a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and other supplies to continue growing as this is his only source of work and enables him to bring home the daily bread.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat is 45 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays home taking care of their children. His older daughter, Doljinsuren, studies at a local primary school and the younger child, Dolgorsuren, goes to the local kindergarten. 

Erdenebat used to run a retail animal pelt and other materials business in the local market, and he has just finished a course in mobile phone repair. He is now planning to start his own mobile phone business, selling and repairing mobile phones in a rental stall at the local market. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of phone spare parts and other inventory to sell at his stall. He is a hardworking, diligent and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of phone spare parts and other inventory to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Francisca Gloria

texts.es: Francisca vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; francisca es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de  salir adelante, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Francisca  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca lives in a house of her own with her husband and son.  She owns a tortilla shop that is very well-known in the location where she lives; she has many customers because she sells the best, nice and hot tortillas and her service is the quickest and besides her prices are truly affordable.  

Francisca is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She believes that when someone wants something she must be aware that she runs risks and that’s why life is worthwhile; she wants to run this risk in order to make her business grow and this is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn at wholesale.  Francisca hopes that in this way she will be able to provide economic security at home and a fulfilled life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Marieliza Genoveva

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Marielisa, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que estudian en  colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. 

Doña Marielisa es  una gran ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por cátalo y productos de Avon y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y es más fácil salir, además  tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Ella está desde que se inicio el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique y comprar un carro para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Cantón, known for its rich precolonial history and for its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts.  It's the home of the famous panama hats.

Here lives Marielisa.  She is 34 and has a common-law spouse with whom she has two children, 11 and 8, both of whom are in school.  Her spouse works in a factory in Manta.

Marielisa is a skilled homemaker who sells catalog clothing and Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories), so she can make her own income.  She sells door to door every day, in the mornings because that's when her kids are in school and it's easier to go out.  Also, she has numerous clients who come to her house to buy products.  She sells on credit and collects every weekend.  She's been in business for more than five years and it's going very well.

She is seeking a loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.  She's been been with the communal bank since she started and she likes it for the help the loans provide.  

Marielisa's dreams are to have a boutique and to buy a car for selling her wares.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams , cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Marc Jayson

texts.en:
Marc Jayson is a third-year student at La Salle University in Ozamiz City. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. His father is a farmer, and his earnings are not enough to support Marc’s higher education costs because of his younger brothers’ need for support, too. 

All these hindrances did not stop Marc from pursuing his dream. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay school tuition fees. He dreams to finish his studies and be able to work for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chicks and five sacks of broiler mash.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Progreso tiene 16 integrantes, donde cada una ha puesto y pone de si para poder mejorar la vida de sus familias. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para mejorar. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta no mostró un resultado favorable.
Ella tiene una despensa en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, con el cual surte a su barrio.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, lácteos, y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir dando a su clientela lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Progreso" has 16 members.  They have invested in themselves to improve their family's lives, and they continue to do so.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey so that they can move forward.  One of the members is Maria, who did not show a favorable result in the last survey.  She has a store in her house where she has all types of basic consumer goods to supply to the neighborhood.  

Maria is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and other supplies so that she can continue to give her customers what they need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, dairy products, and other products for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 41 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia, acompañada de su esposo y sus hijas. Delia se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy temprano se dirige junto a su esposo a los terrenos agrícolas que poseen a dos horas de su pueblo, donde todos los días cuida a sus cultivos de plátano, yuca y maíz en mayor abundancia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y con los ahorros que tenía  junto a su esposo compraron un terreno para aumentar la producción de maíz. Gracias a la experiencia que tienen pudieron salir adelante, y conseguir una buena producción. Desde que tuvo su ultima hija Delia se dedica más a su hogar, siendo su esposo el que se encarga de los cultivos, como una mujer emprendedora en una parte de su casa tiene un pequeño terreno, el cual empezó a implementar de algunos cultivos, como son el plátano, yuca, fréjol, papaya que comercializa en el mismo pueblo. Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece de antemano el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos. El monto de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para su producción de maíz.
texts.en:
Delia, 41, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and daughters.

Delia makes a living in agriculture.  She goes with her husband very early to their farmland two hours from her town.  She takes care of her banana, yuca, and corn crops every day.  She has worked in agriculture her whole life.  With their savings she and her husband bought a plot of land to increase their corn production.  Thanks to their experience she can get ahead and get a good crop.

Delia devotes herself more to her home since she had her last daughter, her husband being the one who tends to the crops.  Like an enterprising woman she has a small plot of land in part of her house where she started to grow some crops such as bananas, yuca, beans, and papaya, which she sells in the same town.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's grateful in advance for the economic support received and promises to be punctual with her payments.

She'll invest the amount of 1500 soles [PEN] in buying organic soil amendments for her corn crop.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria de 43 años de edad  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 6 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María, 43, owns a store where she sells basic staples like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business six years and has gained sales experience that leads to the best profits.  It’s located at home which is in a very busy area; she’s very well-known by her neighbors in the zone and she has a large clientele because the store is well-stocked.  She wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital which is why she’s requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what’s needed in her store.  She is sure to repay the loan and confident that she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children, in a ger (traditional, felt tent) in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife, Dolgorsuren, is 32 years old and works at a local school. Their children go to local kindergarten.

Erdenebat has been providing taxi services in town since 2008, and he has gained a lot of experience and customers. He has sold his car and purchased a second-hand minivan. With a minivan he will be able to provide public transportation services, which will enable him to increase his income. He is now requesting a loan of 2,100,000 MNT. He will use the loan to purchase parts and pay for repair services for his newly-purchased minivan, which needs to be adapted to provide public transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase parts and pay for repair services for the second-hand minivan he recently bought, which needs to be adapted to provide public transportation services

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has seven children. Martina runs a sari-sari, or variety, store selling various goods to the people in her area. Her husband also works as a fisherman.

Martina is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell in her store such as canned goods, soap and toiletries, and new fishing nets. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store and her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store such as canned goods, soap and toiletries, and new fishing nets

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman.  She is 41 years old, married and has one child.

She has run her sari-sari store business for almost ten years, and her income is a big help in providing the school allowance for her child. 

Gloria wishes for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items like canned goods, beverages and bread. She believes that the loan will serve as her stepping stone in achieving her dream.  She hopes that her small sari-sari store will become a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 31 while the youngest is 18. She is engaged in seaweed farming. She grows seaweed for a living. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional seaweed seedlings, materials like ropes and floating foam, and to pay the laborer. 

In the future, Virginia would like to expand her business to be able to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweed seedlings, materials like ropes and floating foam, and to pay the laborer.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living, she helps her husband on their farm planting rice, which they sell. Aside from farming, she manages a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation. 

In 2008, Jeanne joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services and it has helped her improve her ability to engage in business. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP to repair an existing motor and to purchase a new set of tires. She plans to improve her business to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Carmen Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Carmen se dedica al comercio pues tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí también vende artículos de bazar, helados y productos de catálogos (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando ellos están desocupados. Tiene 6 años con su negocio y le va muy bien ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y esto es porque en su local  sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y cosméticos de catálogos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and its artisan products that are known both at national and international levels.  Panama hats also originate from.

And it is here that 42-year-old Carmen lives.  She is married and has three children - aged 19, 17, and 14 years old each.  The eldest is studying at university while the youngest are still in secondary school.  Carmen's husband is a driver.

Carmen has a business - she has a small shop selling supplies that she runs out of her home.  She also sell miscellaneous items, ice creams and catalogue goods (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works every day from 7am until 9pm and her children help her with her work when they are free.  Carmen has had the business for six years and it is going very well as her number of customers is growing.  She has so many customers because they can find everything they need in Carmen's store.

Carmen will use this loan to stock-up her store.  She will buy supplies and cosmetic products from catalogues.  Carmen has been with the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the group is very close.

Carmen's goal is to progress with her business as the shop is growing more every day.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nemeriano

texts.en:
Numeriano lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with his wife and seven children. He has had a motor transportation service for more than two years, from which he earns a living. 

In 2008, Numeriano joined GDMPC micro credit and he gained access to micro finance services.  

In order to purchase motor accessories, he has borrowed 2,000 PHP. 

He plans to acquire another unit in the future for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. She previously accessed a loan of 20,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to provide for her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marites dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ceneida María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ceneida, tiene 40años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  14 y 11 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Ceneida es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Los mismos que vende en un local que ella tiene en su casa en la cual además tiene unas cabinas telefónicas, allí  realiza recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras, con esto ella se gana algo extra que le ayuda a salir adelante, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a sus ventas y las cabinas tienen cerca de 4 años  en las cuales le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y pagar servicio telefónico. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Productivo” (Productive) communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Ceneida, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 14 and 11 years of age and are attending secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver.

Ceneida is a housewife who in order to earn income of her own to help her husband with household expenses works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories) that she sells in a space she has at home where she also has telephone booths.  She sells air time recharges of all operators there and earns a little extra that helps her get ahead.  She sells her products on credit and collects every 8 days.  She’s been in sales for 8 years and has had the phone booths for 4 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream and cosmetics and to pay for the phone service.   She’s been in the communal bank for more than 2 years and likes it because the loans are easy to get.  Her dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to pay for phone service and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

She feels better, now that she applied for her first loan. Natalina will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy that Tuba Rai Metin offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house by selling gold. She is making a good income from selling gold and she wants to buy more inventory with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She began her business in 2001 with her own working capital of $3,000.

loans.use: to buy gold rings and necklaces to resell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 33 years old and blessed with two children. She is a single parent and working hard to provide for the needs of her children. To sustain their daily needs, she operates a store, selling grocery items and school supplies, and she manages a laundry shop business, too. She generates an average of PHP 20,000 each month and uses it as rolling capital in her businesses, and to pay school expenses and cover daily household expenses.  

She hopes to keep improving her business to generate a better income. This led her to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy a variety of merchandise for her store, such as biscuits, cup noodles, sardines and laundry soap. She wants to have more customers and she extends good products and services. She is doing her best for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Santos Thony

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive el señor Santos, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 23 y 22 años que estudian en universidad. La esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda en su trabajo.

Don Santos tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y un local en el cual vende repuestos y refacciones para automóviles, los mismos que utiliza para realizar su trabajo, con esto el asegura sus ventas ya que sus clientes le compran sus repuestos, su especialidad es parte electrónica y computarizada de los automóviles, tiene muchos clientes que llegan hasta su taller para que les realice sus trabajos ya que no hay muchos técnicos que arreglan este tipo de daños en los vehículos. Su esposa le ayuda en su trabajo al igual que sus hijos cuando ellos pueden, lleva con su negocio más de 6 años el cual lo tiene en un local alquilado.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos eléctricos para automóviles que necesita para surtir su negocio.  Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación  a otros bancos. 

Su sueño es tener un local propio para ya no pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton.  This area is known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and its artisan products that are known both at national and international levels.  Panama hats also originate from here.

And it is here that 49-year-old Santos lives.  He has a partner, with whom he has two children aged 23 and 22 years old respectively.  They are studying at university while Santos' wife is a housewife and helps Santos with his work.

Santos has a garage for motor vehicles, as well as a shop where he sells spare parts for cars.  He also uses these spare parts for his own work. With these products on sale, Santos is sure to have sales as customers buy his spare parts.  His specialty is electronics and the computing elements of vehicles.  Santos has many customers who come for Santos to do work on their vehicles as there are not many technicians who can repair damage to these parts of vehicles.  Santos' wife and children help when they can.  Santos has had the business for over six years, during which time he has rented the workshop.

Santos will use this loan to buy spare electrical parts for cars that he needs to stock-up his business.  He has been with the communal bank for three years and likes it because interest rates are much lower compared to other banks.

Santos' dream is to have his own premises so that he does not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy spare electrical parts for cars.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol; she has five children. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business, where she sells various items such as biscuits, sugar, shampoo, noodles, soaps, and beverages.

Teresita requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as canned goods, beverages, and soft drinks.

In the future, Teresita would like to expand her sari-sari store to provide her family with good food and a quality life.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as canned goods, beverages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Flor Virginia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 56 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Doña Flor además de ser una gran madre también se  dedica a la venta de productos Garden (productos naturales) además de sabanas y zapatos por catálogos. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella al lugar que vaya lleva sus revistas para enseñar a sus clientes y realiza sus ventas, tiene muchos clientes especialmente de los productos naturales. Lleva más de 14 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante y más después de la muerte de su marido.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales, zapatos, sabanas y otros productos que ella vende. Lleva 3 años en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The “Productivo” (Productive) communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Flor, 56, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago but she has four adult children two of which still live with her.  

Besides being a great mother, Flor also sells Garden (natural products) products in addition to sheets and shoes by catalog.  She sells door to door.  At each place she goes she shows her magazines to show her customers and make sales.  She has many customers especially for the natural products.  She’s been in this line of work for more than 14 years and it makes it possible for her to get ahead especially after her husband’s death.

 She will use this loan to buy natural products, shoes, sheets and other products she sells.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goal is to continue forward with her business and that her family life continues.

loans.use: to buy natural products, shoes, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is married and has six children residing at Sinara, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He used to operate a buy and sell business purchasing newly harvested rice and reselling it in the market. Aside from this, he manages a farm, planting and harvesting rice for consumption and sale.

Recently, Miguel joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to cover the farm's maintenance costs.  He hopes to see his children successful in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the farm's maintenance costs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Rosalina is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Rosalina dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Maritza Dolores

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar  vive la señora Mariza, tiene 47 años, hace varios años su esposo falleció  y no  tiene hijos, ella vive con familiares.
 
Es modista desde hace varios años ya que estudio corte y confección en una Academia de esta ciudad. Doña Maritza es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y salir adelante con el fruto de sus trabajo, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa, ella también vende productos de Esika y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende ya sea saliendo a ofrecer puerta a puerta o en su casa cuando sus clientes llegan a que les confeccione sus prendas,  lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos y cosméticos de de Esika y Yanbal. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos para salir adelante. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller de costura más grande y un bazar.
texts.en:
The “Productivo” (Productive) communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Maritza, 47, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago and she has no children; she lives with relatives.

She’s been a dressmaker for years since she studied clothing design and sewing in a local academy.  Maritza is a dedicated woman who likes to fend for herself and get ahead by means of the fruit of her labor.  She has a sewing workshop at home and she also sells Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories.)  She sells them either going door to door or at home when her customers come by to have her make them clothes.  She’s been in this activity for more than 10 years.

 She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread and Esika and Yanbal cosmetics.  She’s been in the communal bank 3 years and likes it because of the loans they give her to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a larger sewing workshop and a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and cosmetics.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has six children. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea and she has been doing this work for 12 years.

Betty says what is most enjoyable about her work is: "dairy farming." Her biggest challenge is "drought." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Chemur."

Betty was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because of training." This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she said: "It gives loans."

Betty's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, she replied "Will earn income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Betty owns the following: cow and poultry.  But, she does not own: pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas se llama esta grupo, está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Una de las integrantes digna de destacar es la Sra. Paola, quien también es la presidenta, comenta que también trata de motivar siempre a sus compañeras para que sigan luchando por mejorar sus vidas y la de sus familias. Ella vende frazadas, y cuando se viene el verano siempre vende de todo. Este crédito lo solicita para poder invertirlo en más frazadas, ya que se viene la época de frio y quiere poder seguir creciendo y mejorando su microemprendimiento. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  It’s taking the poverty elimination survey to determine each and everyone’s situation to be able to improve their and their families’ conditions.

One of the members worth mentioning is Paola who is also the president.  She comments that she always tries to motivate her fellow members so that they will continue striving to improve their and their families’ lives.  She sells blankets and when summer comes she sells all kinds of things.  She’s asking for this loan to buy more blankets because the cold season is approaching and she wants to be able to continue growing and improving her micro business.  She gives thanks for this great opportunity she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora  tiene 45  años,  es comerciante, su esposo es el señor Eustacio de 60 años le ayuda en su negocio, el matrimonio tiene hijos mayores que ya son independientes, una es comerciante, otra trabaja el España, de quien recibe ayuda, y otro varón que cuenta con negocio propio de venta de celulares y accesorios.
Se inicio en el mercado de ventas ya hace mas de 20 años gracias a la ayuda económica de su esposo quien empezó el en el comercio vendiendo prendas de vestir, su puesto de ventas está ubicada en un comercial importante de la ciudad en donde acude muchas personas, cuenta con buena clientela.
El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de calzados de temporada como botas, calzados para damas, zapatitos para criaturas y zapatos de vestir para caballeros.  Agradece a Fundación paraguaya por el apoyo, y comenta que uno de sus mayores anhelos es de cada día  prospere cada día su negocio
texts.en:
Teodora, 45, is a merchant. Her husband, Eustacio, 60, helps her in her business.  The couple has adult children who are independent now; one of them is a merchant and the other one works in Spain and sends help and another son has his own business selling mobile phones and accessories.
