She started in the sales market more than 20 years ago thanks to economic help from her husband who started in commerce selling clothes.  Her sales stand is located in an important commercial center in the city where many people come; she has a good clientele.

She’s asking for the loan to buy seasonal footwear like boots, women’s shoes, baby shoes and men’s dress shoes.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support and comments that one of her greatest wishes is that her business is prosperous every day.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jazmin Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 13 mujeres es muy trabajador y luchador, ellas se ha unido con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias a seguir creciendo.
Carolina es parte de este grupo, ella vende comestibles que son preparados por ella misma. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela debido a que sus comidas son muy ricas y solicitadas por sus clientes. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus alimentos y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo ella y sus compañeras, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by 13 hard-working and determined women. They have come together with the hope of helping each other and through work, help their families improve.
Carolina is one of the members of this group. She sells food which she prepares herself. Carolina is hard-working and enterprising. She says she has earned a good customer base because her food is very tasty and well demanded by her customers. She is asking for this loan to purchase supplies to keep preparing her food in order to keep her customers satisfied. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and her colleagues, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food for selling.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 52 years old, and has six children. 

Aside from the service-based business mentioned in her previous loan, she is selling vegetables in the market which she harvested from her own garden. She has been doing this for two years, and it helps her earn a good enough living. 

Vivina has decided  to expand her garden, and to establish a new plot of vegetables. Therefore, she has asked GDMPC micro credit a loan of 19,000 PHP. This loan would help Vivina improve and expand her garden.

loans.use: to expand her garden and to establish a new plot of vegetables.

loans.name: Genny Mariana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 24, 22, 20, 18 y 13 años de edad, los dos mayores ya están casados y los tres menores  estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es albañil. 

Doña Genny además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica a la venta útiles escolares y productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa donde tiene  vitrinas para exhibir sus productos,  también vende bocadillos y ciertas golosinas.  Trabaja de tres a cuatro  días más que todo por las tardes, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Lleva 8 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y perfumes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas sobre todo los que están en oferta. Lleva 3 años en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" (Productive) Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton. This canton is known for its rich precolonial culture and handicrafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally. The canton is home to the famous straw hats "Panama hats".

This is where Genny lives. She is 45 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. They have 5 children, aged 24, 22, 20, 18 and 13. The two elder children are married, the other three attend university or school. Genny's husband is a construction worker.
Besides being a very good housewife, Genny sells school supplies and Avon and Yanbal products. These are beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' fashion accessories. She sells door to door and also from her home, where she has glass cabinets to display her products. She also sells sandwiches and some candies. She works 3-4 days per week, mostly in the afternoons. She sells on credit and gets paid weekly. She has had this business for 8 years and she is doing very well. The products she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes.

Genny will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams, in particular those that are on special sale. She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and she likes it because of the support she receives. Her goal is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Kimsour, 46 years old, has been growing rice and corn as a main source of her family’s income for 12 years. She is a married mother of five children, one of whom is in school and another one of whom is too young for school. 

Kimsour is just with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for this loan cycle. She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland and will also use a portion of loan to pay for plowing her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice on time so as to improve her family living conditions and she hopes to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old and married with seven children. Out of them, five are school-going. She is a peasant farmer involved in the growing of crops and raising animals. It is from agriculture that she gets income to look after the family.

She previously got a loan of UGX 200,000 (Two hundred thousand shillings) to pay school fees so her children were able to do their exams for the last term. She now wants a loan of UGX 1,000,000 (One million shillings) to pay school fees for her son who is studying in a nursing school.

Esther wishes to see all her children go to school and complete their studies. However, her main challenge is that she has limited sources of income to achieve her dream. The other problem she faces is the changing weather which affects agriculture and therefore limits her cash flow. In the photograph, Esther is with the UGAFODE Credit officer.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Sayas Pty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sayas Poty está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, para que sigan creciendo.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Alba, quien también es la presidenta del grupo, es una persona que se esfuerza por crecer, ayudar a sus compañeras y crecer cada una en los emprendimientos que hace. Ella además de ayudar a sus amigas es costurera, y cuenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo debido a que es muy buena en lo que hace, confecciona todo tipo de prendas y en eso le va muy bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, ya que con ello podrá seguir haciendo sus trabajos. Ella se define como una persona que lucha y que quiere progresar.
texts.en:
The Sayas Poty group is in its sixth cycle in the women’s committee program.  They all work and help each other in order to get ahead.  They take part in the survey to eliminate poverty in order to be able to know each other’s situations so that they can keep growing.

Alba is one of these women, and she is also the president of the group.  She is a person who puts forth great effort in order to grow and to help each of her colleagues to grow.  She always has a lot of work because she is very good at what she does.  She makes all types of clothes, and this is going very well for her.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies.  By doing so, she will be able to continue doing her work.  She can be defined as a tenacious person who wants to advance.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 34, is married with four children who are 12, 10, 7 and 4 years old. Three of the children attend school, and he is paying their school fees.  John is a poultry farmer and he has been doing this since 2000 as a major source of income to support his family.

Previously, John borrowed UGX 1,000,000 from Ugafode so that he could expand his poultry business.  With that loan, John says he was able to increase the number of eggs produced. 

John now wants another loan of UGX1,500,000 to buy more chicks and poultry feed so that he can increase his returns.

John's dream is to buy a vehicle to help him transport the feed to the farm, as well as transporting eggs to the markets.

The challenge John faces is the risky nature of the business, plus the increase in the prices of feed and chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 38-year-old hardworking women who lives with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. They have three buffalos and her husband sells the buffalo milk to their neighbors and other people, which is the only source of income for their family. Rubina wants to sell milk, yogurt, and butter in the market on a larger scale, so she needs to increase production. She is facing a very difficult time as her monthly income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. 

As a member of a two-person group, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a new buffalo in order to increase the production of milk and increase her monthly income. After earning the profit, she is planning to send her children to school. Rubina is very hopeful that the loan will be productive for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Rubina is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo for milk.

loans.name: Laura Aleyda

texts.es: Laura se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo y  tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo. Laura  solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en: Laura has been selling tortillas from her house for several years. She works from Monday to Sunday and has many customers, since she is a very hardworking and friendly person. With her earnings she is able to pay her household expenses; she lives in her own house with her husband and son. Laura is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal to continue making tortillas and thus make more profits in order to have better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru:
Мухаррам замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Спитамен. Ей 52 года. У нее есть взрослый сын, который уже женат и имеет одного ребенка. В настоящее время муж Мухаррам и ее сын находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Мухаррам живет с невесткой и внуком. У Мухаррам имеется 0,20 га орошаемой земли, на которой она выращивает кукурузник и луг.  
Сейчас Мухаррам имеет намерение начать новый бизнес. Она хочет заняться куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. В новой деятельности ей будет помогать невестка. Мухаррам планирует откармливать скот в течение двух месяцев и затем продавать на местном рынке. Она не нуждается в корме, так как на ее земли растет кукурузник и луг. Мухаррам запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить бычков и начать деятельность. Она верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Muharram is married and lives in the Spitamen district.  She's 52 and has a grown son who is already married with one child.  Her husband and son currently work abroad while she lives with her daughter-in-law and grandchild. 

Muharram has .2 hectares of land where she grows corn and grass and now she would like to start her own business buying and selling small livestock so she'll be able to help out her daughter-in-law.  She plans to fatten up the livestock for two months and then sell them at the local market.  She doesn't need feed because grass and corn grow on her land.  She's seeking loan to buy calves start her business.  She has faith in your support.

loans.use: to buy, fatten up, and sell her livestock.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Doña Victoria, tiene 36 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por tres miembros dos hijos y ella, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en la comunidad de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Doña Victoria es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser la responsable de la alimentación y la educación de sus hijos. Tienen una vivienda de paredes de adobe, techo de cañahueca y revoque de barro, esta clase de vivienda cada año antes de las lluvias hay que hacer el revoque, DoñaVictoria, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos  para tener más producción y de mejor calidad y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old.  Her family is comprised of three members, two children and herself.  It is a humble family with scarce financial resources.  They live in the Mizque community in the Cochabamba department.

She works in agriculture and with cattle.  She produces potatoes, beans, and onions.  She sells them to the merchants in the same place where she lives, Mizque.  Victoria is a much respected person in her community.  This is because of her dedication to her work and for being very responsible about feeding and educating her children.

They live in a house with adobe walls and a roof made of bamboo, and mud plaster. This type of house has to be re-plastered every year before the rainy season.

Victoria is requesting the loan to buy more chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, and agrochemicals in order to have more production and better quality. This way she will improve the living conditions of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
carlos tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene  hijos, vive con los padres en casa de ellos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario.
 
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y tener negocio de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta fútbol con los amigos.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 20, is single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  He belongs to the Genesis communal bank, which is in the Atascoso precinct in the Ventanas canton.  He works in agriculture and with cattle.  Carlos grows corn and rice.

He is requesting the loan to buy urea, seeds, compost, and fertilizers.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs.  He will make his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  The challenges he faces are pests and plant diseases.

His dream is to buy a piece of land in order to keep planting and to have a family business.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, compost, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kotognontala 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes de Kotognontala 5 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougopu dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Satan (femme debout au milieu dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Sirakorobougou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The six women of the "Kotognontala 5" group are all married and live in traditional households. They are on average 39 years old with four children. They all live in the town of Sirakorobougou in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through their seasonal agricultural activities as well as through neighbourhood, marital, and familial links in town. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.
With the goal of buying small equipment and supplying themselves with agricultural inputs, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third rural loan cycle.
Ms. Satan (the woman standing in the middle of the photo) is a major agricultural operator during the rainy season in the town of Sirakorobougou. She intends to use her loan to work her fields, buy seeds and fertilizer, and pay local youths to weed the fields. The sale of her agricultural produce takes place in cash at the end of the season, and will be used to repay her loan and to generate an income to take care of her children and a portion of the family.

loans.use: To buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Jorge Clemente

texts.es:
JORGE tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y con la conyugue en la ciudfad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JORGE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se ddeica a la crianza de cerdos y pavos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas,fertilizantes, polvillo, morocho. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la comida para los animales.  

El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar  terreno para sembrar cacao y aumentar la produccion. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli y futbol.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old.  He lives with his partner and four children in the city of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Jorge is a member of the Genesis community bank which is located in Atascoso, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank farm and raise livestock.

Jorge is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He also raises pigs and turkeys.  He is requesting this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and corn.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and feed for his animals.

The challenges Jorge faces are pests and diseases on his crops.  His dream is to buy a plot of land on which to sow cacao in order to increase his production.  In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and corn

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Djollo Kagoua,  un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne  avec l’institution, les prêts precedents ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  ABI, 1 ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Benkadi 1" group are married women who are on average 35 years old with four children and all live in traditional households in Djollo Kagoua, one of the towns in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their agricultural activities properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth rural loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid properly.
Abi, the woman standing all the way on the left in the photo, grows peanuts as her main crop.
With her loan, she intends to pay for agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and labour costs to maintain 1.5 hectares.
The produce will be sold at the town level and in San, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 40,000 FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, small farming equipment, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO commune de moribila  cercle  de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  WASSA,  1 ere femme  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San et Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Benkadi 3" group are married women who are on average 36 years old with four children and all live in traditional households in Nagousso, in the town of Moribila, which is in turn part of the circle of San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their agricultural activities properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fourth rural loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid properly.
Wassa, the woman standing all the way on the left in the photo, grows peanuts as her main crop.
With her loan, she intends to pay for agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and labour costs to maintain 1.5 hectares.
The produce will be sold at the town level and in San and Kimparana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 40,000 FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, small farming equipment, and seeds.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  BATATA,  2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the "Benkadi 6" group are married women who are on average 39 years old with five children and all live in traditional households in Nagousso, one of the towns in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their agricultural activities properly during the rainy season.
They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid properly.
Batata, the woman sitting second from the left in the photo, grows peanuts as her main crop.
With her loan, she intends to pay for agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and labour costs to maintain 0.5 hectares.
The produce will be sold at the town level and in San, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 12,500 FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, agricultural inputs, small farming equipment, and seeds

loans.name: Eduardo Simon

texts.es:
EDUARDO  tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

EDUARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica  a la crianza de chivos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, abonos, pasto para los chivos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y lo demás que necesita.


El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plgas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es con el tiempo estar a corde a la tecnologia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 40 years old.  He lives with his partner and four children in the town of Ventanas, in los Ríos province.

Eduardo is a member of the Genesis community bank which is located in Atascoso, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank farm and raise livestock.

Eduardo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He also raises goats.  He is requesting this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and pasture for his goats.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and other supplies he needs.

The challenges that Eduardo faces are pests and diseases among his crops.  His dream is to start using technology in his farming.  In his free time, he enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers and pasture for his goats

loans.name: Danaya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  DANAYA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pourè, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide Mme    NANA, 3 eme  debout  de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the "Danaya 1" group are married women who are on average 40 years old with three children and all live in traditional households in Pourè, one of the towns in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to manage their agricultural activities properly during the rainy season.
They are on their third loan with the institution, and all their previous loans were repaid properly.
Ms. Nana, the woman standing third from the right in the photo, grows peanuts as her main crop.
With her loan, she intends to pay for agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and labour costs to farm 0.5 hectares.
The produce will be sold at the town level and in San, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize a profit of 40,000 FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and labour costs.

loans.name: Moussodjeton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  MOUSSODJETON 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJALAKORO, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide  avec   AISSA, 1 ere  femme  assise de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo avec foulard vert blanc au coud.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Moussodjeton 1 group are all married women.  They have an average age of 35 and an average of 4 children each.  They all live in traditional families in Djalakoro, a village in San, the fourth administrative region of Mali.

These women work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see their farming businesses through the winter.  This is their fifth loan from the institution.  Their previous loans were all repaid promptly.

Aissa is the lady crouching on the far right of the photo, wearing a green/white scarf round her neck.  She grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy supplies, seeds and small agricultural tools.  She will also pay labor costs for workers to farm 1 hectare of land.  After harvesting, she will sell her produce at the village level and also in San to a customer base made up of both men and women.  She plans to make a profit of 60,000 francs at the end of the season.  These profits will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies, seeds, small agricultural tools and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jasmani David

texts.es:
JASMANI tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

JASMANI se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Soliciat el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los suministros necesarios para la siembra. 

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plgas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar un carro y una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jasmani is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives with his dad in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province. Jasmani is a member of the Genesis community bank which is located in Atascoso, in Ventanas canton. The members of this group farm and raise livestock. 

Jasmani is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He has requested this loan to buy urea, seeds, manure, and fertilizers. With the help of this loan, he will be to buy the supplies necessary to sow the land. Jasmani makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. 

The challenges he faces are pests and plant diseases. His dream is to buy a car and a home. In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer  with his friends.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Guilber

texts.es: El sr. Guilber es una persona muy humilde de escasos recursos económicos, don Guilber  es soltero, vive con sus padres compartiendo los gastos y responsabilidades de casa. El señor Guilber se dedica a la producción de frejol y maní, en la presente campaña agrícola  tuvo una baja en la producción de frejol  y maní ya que se presentaron heladas tempranas  afectado en la maduración de frutos de los productos mencionados, todo esto ha derivado en la disminución de ingresos que estaban calculado para la compra de torillos; sin embargo continua la idea de comprar estos semovientes para lo cual solicita este crédito que le beneficiará de gran manera, indica también que con la cría de ganado vacuno obtendrá un valor agregado teniendo a disposición la tracción animal para el uso personal y alquiler de los mismos.
texts.en: Guilber is a very modest person, with limited economic resources. He is single and lives with his parents, sharing the expenses and responsibilities of the household. Guilber's main activity is the growing of beans and peanuts. In the current farming season, he suffered a decrease in production due to early frost which affected the ripening process. As a result, Guilber has had a loss of revenue which he had planned to invest in the purchase of young bulls. Nevertheless, Guilber still wants to buy the livestock. This is why he is asking for a loan, which will help him a lot. He says that raising the cattle will provide him with an added value, because he will have animal drawn traction for his personal use and to rent out.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и живет вместе со своей семьей на севере Таджикистана. Она имеет 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Хуршеда умелая женщина и шьёт красивые платья. Она занимается предоставлением услуги швеи более 10 лет. Она имеет достаточного опыта и постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она старается предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне. Она хочет проводить мероприятие в семье и пригласить много гостей. Однако она не имеет денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки необходимого средства для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khursheda is a hard-working woman. She is married with three children and lives in northern Tajikistan. Khursheda is a skilled seamstress and sews beautiful dresses. She has over 10 years of experience and is slowing expanding her business. She tries to provide the highest level of service. She wants to hold a celebration for her family and invite many guests but does not have the money to do so. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to make the necessary arrangements for the event. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to have a party for her family

loans.name: Valentin Celedonio

texts.es:
VALENTIN  tiene 37 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

VALENTIN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de patos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, fertilizantes, polvillo, morocho. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la alimentación para los animales.

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras y animales.

El sueño es comprar un terreno seguir sembrando para tener dinero para dar mejor nivel de vida a la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta predicar la palabra de dios.
texts.en:
Valentin is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, which is in the Los Rios province. He is a member of the communal bank VRC Genesis, which is located in El Atascoso, in the canton of Ventanas. Members of the communal bank make a living through agriculture and raising livestock.

Valentin works in agriculture, growing corn and rice, and also raises ducks and chickens. He is requesting this loan to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, feed, and corn. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and feed for his animals. 

He buys and sells his goods in Ventanas. The challenges that he faces are pests and diseases that his plants and animals contract.

His dream is to buy land and to continue farming crops to make money and give his family a better quality of life. In his free time, he likes to preach the word of God.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, fertilizers, feed, and corn.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbayar, 39 years old, lives with his wife, his two children, and his father-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been running a spare parts sales business for 12 years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in dealing with suppliers and finding the right customers. One of his children has graduated from university and is now looking for a job. He is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy an automobile with an electric engine. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because the internal power source produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Buying this car will help him to save time going between work and home. The borrower is very hard-working individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Carlos Bernardino

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y honesto vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años su principal siembra es el maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en barriles asi como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito para  poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. Para continuar con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carlos, a 45-year-old man, is a hard-working, responsible, and honest man. He lives in his own house with his wife and their five children.

He works in agriculture. For the past 20 years, his main crop has been corn. When his crop is ready, he stores it in barrels like the one in the photo so that he can sell it later in the agencies that trade basic grains. 

With his earnings, he has been able to cover some household costs. 

Carlos requests this loan in order to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, tools, etc. so that he can continue farming and be able to provide economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en: Mkoyi, who is in his early 40s, is married and has two children who are still going to school. He has been running a butcher shop since 2000. He works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Mkoyi's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open another butcher shop in a different place. He used his profits to buy a TV set, a sofa set and a fridge, and to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. He has repaid all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy more beef, chicken and fish to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of opening another butcher shop in a different place and of renovating all his shops to good standards. Mkoyi will share this loan with his loan group, "Mshikamano," consisting of sixteen members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more beef, chicken and fish to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Voris

texts.ru: Ворис живет вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 3 года. Ворис является основным кормильцем в семье, так как его жена швея и имеет маленький доход. Он более 4 года занимается скотоводством. Он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и поэтому он имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Он начал свой бизнес с одной коровой и данное время он имеет 6 голов коровы. Он также является мясником. Он продает на рынке мясо скота, за которым, он сам присматривал.  Он имеет постоянных клиентов. Изучив рынок, он хочет развевать свой бизнес. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота для расширения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход и таким образом улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Voris lives together with his family in the countryside. He is married and raising one child, who is 3 years old. Voris is the main breadwinner in the family, as his wife is a seamstress and has a small income. 

Voris has worked with cattle breeding for more than 4 years. Since childhood he has helped his parents with cattle breeding and therefore he has a lot of experience in this business. He started his own business with one cow, and currently he has six cows. He is also a butcher. He sells cattle meat at the local market, from animals he bred himself. He has regular customers. 

After having studied the market, he would like to develop his business. He requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni for the purchase of cattle for increasing his working capital. He awaits your kindness. This loan will help him increase his income and this way improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Clea

texts.en: Clea is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in the food-vending business. She sells home-cooked meals, such as soup, vegetable stew and meat recipes. She has been operating a food-vending business for almost 10 years. She applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, rice and soft drinks, to continue serving her customers and to earn a living. In the future, Clea hopes that her food-vending business will help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, rice and soft drinks, for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Galo Macario

texts.es:
GALO tiene 45 años de edad es cadao tiene 6 hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

GALO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas,abonos y fertilizantes,  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos.  

El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para aumentar la produccion y tener mas dinero para dar ejor vida a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Galo is 45 years old, he is married and has 6 children. He lives with his children and his wife in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. 
He is a member of the communal bank "Genesis," which is located in the Atascoso precinct. It is part of the Ventanas canton and works in farming activities.
Galo farms corn and rice.  He requests a loan to buy urea fertilizer, seed and other fertilizers.  With the help from the loan he will be able to buy the inputs he needs for his crops.
The challenges he faces are pests and diseases in his fields. His dream is to buy some land to increase production and make more money to provide a better life to his children. In his free time he likes to read the bible.

loans.use: to buy urea, seed and other fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sandra, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 10 y 1 año de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y en  escuela. El marido es artesano. 

Doña Sandra para salir adelante junto a su esposo  tienen una tienda en su casa, vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  helados, además de realizar recargas y vender tarjetas telefónicas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Su esposo además también se dedica a la artesanía mismas que elabora en un taller de aluminio y vidrio que tiene en su misma casa por lo cual también su esposo le ayuda de vez en cuando, tiene más de 9 años con su negocio y les va muy bien ya que cuentan con muy buena clientela.

Este crédito lo va invertir en la compra de víveres, útiles escolares, helados y recargas telefónicas. Lleva más de  3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Productivo” [Productive] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi canton, a region known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally. It is also the home of the famous Panama hats.  

In this region, lives Sandra.  She is 39 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has three children, ages 14, 10, and 1.  The two older children attend school.  Her husband is an artisan.  

To get ahead, Sandra and her husband have a store set up in their home.  They sell all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, fruits and vegetables, and ice cream.  In addition, they provide mobile phone air time recharges and sell phone cards.  They work every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes much later.  Her husband is also engaged in artisanal crafts that he creates in an aluminum and glass workshop located in their home.  His wife helps him occasionally.  He has been in this business for over nine years and it is going well because he has a good clientele.  

She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of food, school supplies, ice cream, and mobile phone air time recharge cards.  They have been members of the communal bank for over three years and they like it because of the support they provide through the loans.  Her dream is to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase food, school supplies, ice cream, and mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons. She belongs to a very poor family. Her husband sales waste materials to the recycling factories, which is the only source of income for his family. He is a very hard-working person. He collects waste materials from door to door and sells them in the recycling factories. Her husband wants to open a shop for his work. However, due to lack of money, he finds this difficult. Therefore Ghazala has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband open a shop. Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to open a shop to trade in recycling materials.

loans.name: Nahodha Group

texts.en: Cecilia, who is in her late 30s, is married and has five children. Four of them are still going to school. She has been a food vendor since 2005. She works from 7:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Cecilia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more food stocks to meet her clients' demand. She dreams of owning a hotel. Cecilia will share this loan with her loan group "Nahodha," consisting of sixteen members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks to meet her clients' demand.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of ten children. Teresita has been engaged in farming, together with her husband, for more than six years. This is the source of her income. Teresita is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm, as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is 28-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband owns a small hotel in the market, which is the only source of income for their family. He is expert in cooking. His delicious food is liked by everyone. Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will buy food products, including chicken, beef, bread, pulses (legumes), vegetables and oil. Shabana wants to save money for her children's education from the profits. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food for her husband's hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing pen.

loans.name: Greda Trader's One Group

texts.en:
Note: The photo shows all 14 members of Greda Trader's Group. This loan is for a subgroup of eight of the 14 members. 

Grada Trader’s One Group is made up of eight members who are located in Greda Estate in Teshie. This is their second loan from Kiva, and they are counting on Kiva's usual support for GHS 8,800, so that they can expand their businesses. 

Yaa is the leader of Greda Trader’s One and Two. She is 65 years old, married to a 68-year-old pensioner who helps her in selling foodstuffs. They have two adult children. Yaa is excited to be taking out her fourth loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan of GHS 1,200 to invest in buying palm oil, kennel oil, cassava, plantains and yams. She will reinvest the profits in her business. She started about 20 years ago and has decided to expand her business quickly, since she is helped by her husband. For her future, she is dreaming of improving her business and selling different products. She thanks you all for Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to invest in buying palm oil, kennel oil, cassava, plantains and yams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida's husband offers shelter services. Sajida is applying for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to buy bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Sajida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails and iron sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат 26 лет. Она разведена и живет с родителями и братом в районе Носири Хусрав.  Шарофат работает в сфере торговли в течение 10 лет. Она в магазине занимается продажей продуктов питания, и в частности продает чай, сахар, муку, макароны, рис и т.д. Ее магазин расположен в самом рынке района и ее продукты питания пользуются хорошим спросом. Шарофат в бизнесе помогает ее пожилая мать. Еще в юном возрасте она научилась у матери торговой деятельности. Шарофат имеет намерение увеличить товарооборот и расширить бизнес. С этой целью она берет кредит для приобретения ассортимента продуктов питания на продажу. В свою очередь увеличив товарооборот, Шарофат сможет улучшить финансовое состояние семьи.
texts.en: Sharofat is 26 years old.  She is divorced and lives with her parents and brother in the Nosiri Khusrav district.  Sharofat has been working in the retail field for ten years.  She is involved in selling food products, such as tea, sugar, flour, pasta, etc., at a store.  Her store is located right in the district market, and her products are in good demand.  Sharofat's elderly mother helps her with the business.  Sharofat learned the retail business from her mother in her young age.  Sharofat intends to increase product turnover and expand her business.  With this goal in mind, she is requesting this loan to buy a selection of food products for resale.  Having increased the product turnover, Sharofat will then be able to improve her family's financial condition.

loans.use: to buy a selection of food products for resale

loans.name: Jhossy

texts.es: Jhossy, de 28 años es un hijo responsable; vive en compañía de su hermano Miguel en la casa de sus padres, desde hace 3 años. Jhossy se dedica a la crianza de ovejas de raza; ya que aprendió a cuidarlos y reproducirlos hace mucho tiempo, pues tiene clientes ganaderos que compran sus ejemplares para sus rebaños, en especial machos que les sirven como reproductores. “Esta actividad es mi principal distracción”, comenta. Además estudió la carrera de ingeniería informática, ahora se encuentra trabajando en un hospital del estado peruano en esa área, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual que le permite mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia, pues apoya a su mamá en los gastos del hogar. Este es SU tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente feliz por al apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Jhossy, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas de buena raza para dinamizar su negocio.
texts.en: 28-year-old Jhossy is a responsible man who, for 3 years, has lived with his parents and his brother Miguel in the parents' house.  Jhossy breeds purebred sheep, having learned to care for them and breed them some time ago.  As a result, breeders buy his animals for their flocks, particularly his rams which they use for breeding. "This business is my main hobby" he says.  In addition to this, he studied Computer Engineering and now works in a local state-run hospital.  His monthly wage allows him to ensure his family's financial stability and help his mother with the household expenses.  This is his third KIVA loan; he is grateful for the financial support which enables him to make progress and he promises to make his repayments punctually. Jhossy will use the loan to buy purebred sheep to invigorate his business.

loans.use: to buy purebred sheep.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Pursat Province, Kror Kor district, Somaly is 31 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are still in school while another one is too young for school. Somaly is a farmer who grows rice on two hectare of farmland as her main source of income and raise pigs to earn extra income for her family. She and her husband have been in farming for four years.

Somaly has been with VisionFund for two cycles, and she has successfully paid back her previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000KHR and her other group member is applying for 1,000,000KHR loan amount. As the leader of the group, Somaly will use this loan to buy a plot of farmland to extend her farming business. She hopes to increase her yields and so improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to extend her farming business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 37 year-old responsible and hardworking housewife. She is a mother of five children and her husband is currently working as an auto mechanic. Parveen and her husband have been saving money for many years to purchase a van. Her husband wants to start his own transport business. For that purpose, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. They would purchase the van and be able to start their own business. This could solve many of their financial problems. Parveen is very much thankful to Kiva

loans.use: To start a transport business

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 53-х лет. Она замужем и является матерью двоих дочерей и троих сыновей. Ее муж работает таксистом. Сама Зулхумор является фермером. Она на орошаемом участке земли выращивает зерновые культуры, в основном рис. Она занимается земледельческой деятельностью на протяжении 5 лет. Зулхумор научилась работе на земле у своих родителей. Ей в посеве и сборе урожая помогает муж и невестка. Зулхумор запрашивает кредит для закупа семян риса и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Zulkhumor is a hard working woman of the age of 53. She is married and the mother of two daughters and three sons. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Zulkhumor is a farmer. She grows crops, mainly rice, on an irrigated plot of land. She has been working with agriculture for a period of five years. 

Zulkhumor learned to work the land from her parents. Her husband and sister in law help her with sowing and harvesting. Zulkhumor requests a loan for the purchase of rice seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Oimpocho

texts.ru: Оимпочо способная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1960 году в районе Кумсангир, на юге страны. У нее есть заботливый муж и трое детей. Оимпочо занимается сельским хозяйством. Она в течение 6 лет выращивает огурцы и помидоры для консервирования на продажу. Это довольно прибыльный бизнес, так как консервированные продукты пользуются спросом круглый год, что обеспечивает Оимпочо стабильный и постоянный доход. В данный момент Оимпочо обратилась за кредитом для развития деятельности. Она на сумму кредита хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения и топлива для урожая помидора и огурцов, а также закупить банки и крышки для их консервирования. За счет полученной прибыли с продажи консервированных огурцов и помидоров, а также сбережений, которые ей высылают сыновья, Оимпочо имеет намерение в этом году женить сыновей, которые сейчас находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Она знает, что ее планы реализуются только с помощью Вашей поддержки!
texts.en: Oimpocho is a capable and hardworking woman.  She was born in 1960 in the Qumsangir district in the south of the country.  She has a caring husband and three children.  Oimpocho is involved in agriculture.  She has been growing cucumbers and tomatoes for canning and sale for six years.  This is a fairly profitable business because canned products are in demand year around, which provides Oimpocho with a stable and regular income.  At the present time, Oimpocho requested a loan for business development.  She wants to use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel for the tomato and cucumber harvests, and also to buy jars and lids for canning.  Oimpocho intends to use the resulting profit from selling canned cucumbers and tomatoes and also from savings that her sons send to marry off her sons this year, who are currently working abroad.  She knows that her plans will only realize with your support!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel for the tomato and cucumber harvests, and also to buy jars and lids for canning

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Нигора.  Ей 38 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Климат ее местожительства весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 7  лет она занимается скотоводством. Она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Нигора хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A person with a big heart and beautiful soul is in need of your support, as she recently has had financial problems. Her name is Nigora. She is 39 years old, married and raising two children. Her place of residence has very favorable climate for growing agricultural crops and also for livestock breeding. 

Nigora has worked with livestock breeding for more than seven years. She sells livestock which she has looked after for a period of a few months. She has many customers at the market. 

Nigora would like to develop her business, but does not have sufficient means for this. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock, in order to develop her business. With the income received, she intends to support her children with a good education and modern technology. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her business

loans.name: Maut

texts.en:
Maut is a resident of the region of Reussey Keo, Phnom Penh. He, aged 64, is married and is an industrious father of three children. Two of them are currently employed in local garment factories, and the other one provides motor-taxi services to the surrounding area. Likewise, Maut has operated a transportation business, providing Tuk Tuk services, and he makes approximately $10.00 per day.

Maut wants to help his son start providing Tuk Tuk services like what he does to increase his daily income. In order to start activities, he needs to buy a trailer, which can be linked to the existing motorbike for a transportation business. He has insufficient funds. Therefore, he applied for a loan and hopes that his goal will be realized with the loan support from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a trailer, which can be linked to the existing motorbike for a transportation business.

loans.name: Kiloja

texts.en:
Kiloja is 36 years old, married to Lantinit and blessed with four children, aged seven, five, and three years, respectively. He is a wheat farmer in the Mau-Narok area and has been in farming for the last five years, earning an income of KES 40,000 monthly. He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET that will help with land preparation and purchase of farm inputs to help get better yields
He intends to use to use anticipated profits to support the business and provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs
